All Reviews

  1. Cheers to Braun's innovation in addressing the age-old problem of electric shavers with its cutting element generating heat whilst shaving. The \\"Active Cooling\\" feature instantly activates the cool strip in between the two (2) cutting elements, which actually provides a soothing, cool feeling on your skin during the shave. My older Braun 1775 shaver is still working after 9 years but decided to upgrade and try the new Braun CoolTec CT5cc model. Although it's a bit chunkier, I like the fact that the two (2) independent cutting elements improves coverage and precision, cutting more hair in less time, giving me a closer shave. To top it all off, the base included in the kit doubles up as a charger and a built-in cleaning station which uses a bluish solution, similar to the ones used in salons to disinfect their cutting tools, and with one push of the button, it cleans and disinfects the razor head. That is definitely cool.
  2. Pound and wasn't happy with the shave
  3. For the most part it gets a pretty close shave and the CoolTech system works great, but the actual shaver doesn't seem to get every hair on your face. I had trouble with areas on my face and neck that the shaver would not shave off. I would go over the same spot multiple times in different directions and it still wold not get as close as the rest of my face or neck. I didn't expect it to be perfect but I expected it to work a little better than it did.
  4. I tried this shaver for a week, and while the cooling part of the unit is a very interesting effect, the fact that the head does not pivot really limited my ability to get a close shave. After a week, I was reaching for my old Braun instead of this.<br /><br />Also note that because it comes with the cleaning solution, you apparently cannot return this to Amazon. Still working through the details with them on how to resolve.<br /><br />I have used several Braun models over the years, including the series 7, which in my opinion is their best model. This one is definitely a step backwards from that.<br /><br />Just a quick update - Amazon resolved the return process quickly and simply.
  5. I was very excited to try my new Braun CoolTec electric shaver and was not disappointed. I was blown away by how smooth the shave was and how cool my face stayed throughout the shave. I was not itchy or irritated during or after the shaving process (which is not always true with other razors). The razor is solid, but flexible at the same time to give a smooth shave that gets every aspect of the face.<br /><br />The Clean&Charge Station was really cool and something I have not seen before. I like knowing my shaver is clean before each use.<br /><br />The electric shaver was provided via a program run by Braun.
  6. Coming from a guy with sensitive skin, I can't say enough about this CoolTec system. The cooling bar is unbelievable. I wondered to myself before I tried it what benefit this would bring to the table. It really is an enjoyable feel to have a cool shave, when activated. I say when activated because this system allows you to turn the cool bar on and off. In addition, I always hated to clean my dry shave razor. With the CoolTec system, you can clean and charge this shaver with the push of a button by putting the razor in the cleaning station. The CoolTec system also comes with a travel case and travel lock feature to prevent it from turning on in your luggage-how cool is that!<br /><br />I received this shaver through a program with Braun and I'm so happy I decided to try it!<br /><br />I would recommend this shaver to any guy that's looking for an easy to maintain razor that leaves you with a clean smooth shave every time!
  7. I received this Braun's ¬∞CoolTec electric shaver as part of a program Braun was doing. When I first received it I was highly impressed. The idea of it was pretty \\"cool\\", however after using for a week or so I am less than impressed. I know this is an electric razor but it didn't get into the hard to reach contours in my face.<br /><br />I also am not crazy about having to buy replacement cooling packs. It says that they only last about 3-4 weeks on the packaging. I don't want to have to remember to buy \\"extras\\" for this so I don't know if I would recommend just based on this.<br /><br />Over all it was just an okay razor, but not the best out there.
  8. I was very excited to receive the Braun CoolTec Shaver after hearing that it reduces shaving irritation. While I was in the Navy, I had to shave twice a day, if I had duty. Having to shave every day, irritates my face to no end. I was hoping that this would be the razor that fixed this problem. I loved the razor itself and how easy it was to handle. I became disappointed after I started shaving. i had to go over my chin and neck several times, which irritated my skin. I was hoping to shave once, get all the hair and no irritation. No luck. Braun's sent the Braun CootTec Shaver to get my opinion of the shaver and I hate to say that for the money it would cost to buy, I think you could purchase a better razor for less money. The other issue was the price of the replacement blade. It was a little more costly than others. I did find that the battery charge held. I truly wanted to like this razor, but I don't think it's worth the cost.
  9. I got the shaver for free from Braun for a program it is running. I have to say I'm impressed with it.<br /><br />I can feel that it is cool to the touch. I have always used a Gillette Mach 3 standard razor and this is way better. I get pretty bad razor burn on my neck from a conventional razor and after using the Braun on two consecutive days I havent had a problem. I even did my head (disclaimer...there wasn't much hair left) and it worked great.<br /><br />It is super convenient to simply throw it on the charger after using it and just by pressing a button it cleans it out.<br /><br />I did have an issue with a spot just above my ear. It would touch the spot because of the contour of my head and the extending trimmer didn't really work well either.<br /><br />***Update***<br />Ive had a chance to use the system for a while and I was less impressed over time. Im not sure if it is all electric razors but the shave never got close to the skin and missed a lot on my face. I felt like I had to go over the area multiple times in order for it to get razor close.<br /><br />I have been using my normal multiple blade razor the beginning of my work week and hitting the electric razor half way through.<br /><br />It is still good at not irritating my skin and have even used it on my head a few times. It actually seemed to work better on my head than it did on my face.
  10. I received my Braun CoolTec electric razor on 11/12/13 which was provided via a program run by Braun. I tried it out and I must say it is really a &#34;cool&#34; tech product. The metal bar in the middle of the blades is very cold and makes your skin feel cool and not so rough and worn out. It has 3 options to be cleaned which are 1. Manually with the included brush. 2. Take blade off and rinse it under the water or 3. You can just put the electric razor inside the self cleaning device and will clean,sterilize and lubricate it for the next time of use. Also final feature is how quick it charges from the time it is put on the charger and charges under an hour. I highly recommend this product and I am very satisfied with it. I will never go back to any kind of razor blades again.
  11. I tried the Braun CoolTec electric shaver through a program run by Braun and I was a little skeptical. How much difference could a cold little bar make? Well I was wrong.<br /><br />I gave it a try and was pleasantly surprised by the performance of the razor. The razor does a very nice job and the CoolTec cooling bar did a very nice job soothing my skin. I did not have any red razor burns on my face which is common with all other electric razors I have tried. Additionally, the cleaning station was a really cool added bonus. With the touch of a button, the charging/cleaning station takes care of all the messy cleaning and it will be ready to use, clean and charged, the next day.<br /><br />As a small negative, the Braun CoolTec does not get as close of a shave as a traditional razor and shaving cream. But I have not found a single electric razor that does.<br /><br />Overall, I was really impressed with the Braun CoolTec electric razor. Together with the charging/cleaning station and the soft case that will allow me to take this on the road with me, I think this is a great razor for a close shave without any skin irritation.
  12. Great shaver the cooling factor is something else it truly makes for a better shaving. Braun offered this to me to try out and have to say it is the best electric shaver i have ever used. Deffinatlly would recommend this to everyone its one nice shaver and works very very well
  13. I was able to try out the new Braun CoolTec Shaver through a program run by Braun. I've used a lot of shaving brands and products in my adult life, and this might be one of my new favorites. The product itself comes with the shaver, traveling case, power cord, and charging/cleaning station.<br /><br />I used the shaver a couple of days ago and it did a great job. I had a full beard, so I used the built-in trimmer to bring my beard down to stubble. I then used the CoolTec Shaver to make my face silky smooth. The CoolTec Technology exceeded my expectations. I didn't have that awful burning feeling I get when I've used other shavers. Once I was done I put it on the cleaning base to have it cleaned for the next shave, and it charges at the same time.<br /><br />I highly recommend the Braun CoolTec Shaver. My only negative is that, like with many other shavers, it was very tricky getting some of those pesky hairs that refused to be trimmed.<br /><br />This is a great product, and for any guy looking for a new shaver, this is the one.
  14. I received my Braun Cooltec in the mail a few days ago. When i found out that Braun would be sending me one to try out i was super stoked. Right out of the package you can tell that this is not your typical electric razor. It comes with a a clean and charge station that not only recharges the razor in between uses but also cleans the blades and lubricates them to keep them in tip top shape. After a quick charge I had to give this razor a try. The first thing I noticed was the cooling feature, where an aluminum cooling bar is chilled to reduce irritation. I was a little skeptical at first but was pleasantly surprised as to how well it cools. I have to say that it gave me one of the best shaves i have ever had using an electric razor. Absolutely no irritation and a very close shave. I actually had my wife feel the side of my face after shaving, suffice it say she approves. I would definitely recommend this razor to people that are looking for a great electric razor that gives a very close shave without the irritation.
  15. I'm newer to electronic shavers as I usually use clippers to maintain my facial hair. However, I was surprised by the performance of this product. I enjoyed the cooling function, that was pretty awesome. I also managed to get a pretty close shave as well. While I won't be switching over completely to electric shavers due to the length I tend to keep my facial hair, I will definitely break this out when I need to get close.

  17. First, I'd like to start off by saying that I don't have a thick beard, so I can't say that I did a good job of stress testing the razor.<br /><br />Next, I'd like to say that the razor does work well. It's a very comfortable shave and the cooling mechanism works noticeably well. Granted, I can shave without it and experience no irritation, but it does feel better to have it on.<br /><br />Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed with the performance. For my first shave, I let my beard grow as long as I normally do for about a week. It doesn't grow very fast. While it did cut most of the hairs, it did leave a few stubborn hairs that were laying down. I tried moving it around to try to pick up the hairs, but it didn't work.<br /><br />I tried it couple more times and it worked better with the hairs pretty short. It works fast, but it doesn't get all of the hairs by the back of my jawline. Everywhere else, it shaves very close. For some reason, even when I stretch the skin, I still have some stubble left in those spots.<br /><br />Outside of the performance, the equipment appears to be well constructed, including the carrying case. I even tried the cleaning system and it looks like it worked well. Overall, I'd have to say that if electric razors work well for you, this is a good razor to try.
  18. I recently received this razor as a test product through a program run by Braun. I used to use electric razors almost exclusively then switched back to manual ones (since I do most of my shaving the shower). I have used this razor a few times, I would recommend it. What sets this razor apart is its cooling bar, which soothes the skin by cooling it, helping to prevent skin irritation during shaving. (It gets really cold!) I used it after not shaving for several days and it didn't pull the stubble at all. The only thing this razor has going against it is the price (retailing for about $200). I would not have purchased this razor on my own because of that (since there are cheaper models out there that likely work just as well).
  19. I received this razor through a program from Braun. Its a fairly decent shaver. It trims down alright, wasn't like a clean shave though. We have 3 men in the house and all tried it. It does decent work,but can't exactly seem to get the neck beard cut that close. All around okay shaver. It works, but I personally think you could get a cheaper razor that does everything the same.
  20. The razor has a close shave, but unless you just like the cold feeling, I don't really see the use of the cooling agent. The pores would open up better with warmth instead of cold. I guess its personal preference
  21. The Braun Cooltec shaver gives a great shave and the cooling bar feels great on the face. I have used Norelco shavers in the past and they leave my face with mild irritation, with the Cooltec the cooling bar leaves my face irritation free. It works great, gives me one of the closest shaves for an electric shaver and looks great on the counter. I received this product through a program run by Braun and I have been very pleased by how good this shaver is. I thought the cooling bar would be a gimmick, but it really has worked at keeping my face from getting irritated. It feels like a little ice cube against the cheek. The self cleaning station works very well, it only leaves a tiny bit of hair behind. The only issue with the shaver is it is a little awkward shaving the mustache. The spacing of the blades makes it tough to shave under the nose. Other than that this is a great shaver and well worth the money.
  22. I got this razor in a promotion for Braun. It was my second Shaver and i was very impressed!!   23. I received the Braun CoolTec shaving system through a promotion program run by. Braun. I got to try out this shaver and I have to say it's now my favorite one. I have tried everything from typical razors to vibrating razors. When razors heat up they irritate my skin but this one doesn't. The coolness is soothing and let's me shave longer and more continuously than before.<br /><br />The shaver itself has a good grip and is more weighty which I like because it gives me more accurate control.<br /><br />I had another Braun with a charging station before and I like that this one doesn't need to be plugged in. It saves the hassle of finding space on the bathroom counter and an outlet to plug it in. A complaint I had about the old version is that the cleaning station leaked when moved around a lot. I haven't gotten the chance to try the cleaning station on this one yet to know if it's better though, but I hope it is.
  24. I received the razor as part of program run by Braun. I'm a long time user of Norelco shavers and was pleased to receive this shaving system to review. I've used the razor about a dozen times now with various degrees of hair length and can say that I am mostly happy with it.<br /><br />If I shaved daily or every other day, this razor is perfect. It will give me a super close shave while keeping my face chilled (from the built in cooling system. I have noticed that when I started using this razor that the cooling system has kept the irritation of my face to a minimum; which is awesome because I have super sensitive skin.<br /><br />After not shaving for 4-5 days, then using this razor, I was disappointed. I could use the Norelco with little to no pulling but the Braun hurt like heck to shave with; it hurt so bad that I stopped using it, switched to the Norelco to get the hair short, then continued using the Braun to get a clean shave that the Norelco can't give me. That's really my only complaint with it.<br /><br />Cleaning and charging couldn't be any easier. Just plug in (although the plug could have a longer cord; but I solved that by stretching the included one out for it to work), drop in the CoolTec and flip to the right and it automatically cleans it. Cleaning refills are reasonably priced as well.
  25. Let me say this up front, this razor was provided to me via a program run by Braun, but that has no bearing on my review. I've used electric razor's for quite a while now but never a Braun. It is by far the best I've ever used. It has a very close shave for an electric razor. At first I wasn't sure if I liked the CoolTec feature or not but the more I used it the more I liked it. That feature would be great for someone with sensitive skin or razor burn but it's really for anyone. There is a design flaw with the razor though. The power cord plugs into the charging/cleaning base in an odd way. I have mine sitting on the dresser and the cord hangs over the back and plugs into the wall. The weight of the cord caused the power cord to keep falling out of the base. I ended up having to tape it so it would stay. Other than that, no complaints about the razor. Here's one tip: after cleaning the razor, remove it from the base so it can dry before use.
  26. Awesome product !!! Get a really close shave and absolutely NO burn !!<br />Additional bonus is the cleaning kit. Really nice<br /><br />Disclaimer: I received this shaver as part of a program run by Braun.
  27. Now that \\"No Shave\\" November is over, I was finally able to use my new Braun CoolTec Shaver. The CoolTec was provided to me as part of a program sponsored by Braun. As someone who really suffers from shaving irritation, I was a little skeptical about using the CoolTec. I am happy to say that the CoolTec does live up to hype with regards to skin irritation, but that's about it. I found that it was not as close a shave as I normally get from a razor which meant shaving more often. Also the cleaning/charging system, while effective, takes up a lot of space on the bathroom counter. Overall I give it a 3 out of 5 and think I will just stick with my Schick Quattro
  28. I received the Braun CoolTec from a program run by Braun. I've used 4 or 5 electric shavers in my 25 years of shaving. Of all the shavers I would place the Braun in the middle of the pack. I think Braun is a quality product, but the design needs help.<br /><br />Pros<br /><br />3 day beard shave - The shaver does the best job of any shaver I've ever used at handling 3+ days of growth. It have recessed trimmer cuts the longer hairs down to where the shaver can handle them<br /><br />CoolTec bar - I've seen mixed reviews on the CoolTec bar. Some say is was no good, other like it. For me I could definitely tell a difference in my shave. I have sensitive skin and I've seen a reduction in irritation when using the Braun.<br /><br />Close shave - The shaver gives as close of a shave as all my other shavers, but does it without irritating my skin.<br /><br />Cons<br /><br />Ergonomics - It's just a little better than holding a brick to shave.<br /><br />Cutter head design - While you can get a close shave it takes some work. The shaver is designed to be used in a back and forth pattern. If you hair grows at odd angles you will find yourself having to adjust your grip and angle of attack. Remington's with their circular cutting head does a far superior job.<br /><br />- Charging / Cleaning station - The cleaning station is pretty big. People with a small shaving area (like me) will find this annoying. You can charge without the cleaning station, but you have to lay the shaver down on a charging base and it still takes more room than it should. I also don't like that there is no plug for the shaver itself. If you run out of battery during a shave your are going to have to switch to a razor or wait for the shaver to charge. I feel the cleaning station is a gimmick and not really needed. I will most likely put it in storage and just rinse out the shaver head like I do with all my other shavers.
  29. I'm not a huge fan of electric razors. My previous experiences haven't been good. Low charge time or being stuck to the wall thanks to a 2.5 foot power cord, followed by serious irritation from a poorly engineered head have made me stick with disposable razors for the last 20 years. I was lucky enough to be selected by Braun to test this electric shaver. Majority of those previous opinions changed the first time I fired up my Braun CoolTec shaver.<br /><br />Everything Braun claims the shaver does, it does and does it well. The cooling feature is extremely &#34;cool&#34;. I'd venture to say that its specifically responsible for my skin not being an irritated mess after I'm done shaving. This has been a massive problem for me in the past, but not with this shaver! The unit has a pretty long charge life, and as such travels well. All of us who travel for a living know its an awful mess when we are running late already to hop on a train, pull out our razor only to find out its as dead as a doornail. In case you are going to be gone for a good while, the unit ships with a &#34;mobile charger&#34; that is compact and easy to haul along. You'll lose the benefits of the automatic cleaning that you have at home, but at least you won't run out of juice (or have to lug the giant base with you).<br /><br />The quality of the shave is extremely close. My wife is quite impressed with how smooth my face is after I finish with this shaver. I honestly feel like I've gotten a shave thats as close as what I'd get if I used my typical Mach 3 disposable.<br /><br />The cleaning/charging base is one of the coolest features of this product. Its so insanely easy to use, and requires very little effort to upkeep. The reasonably priced &#34;Clean and Renew&#34; refill packages keep the shaver very clean and ultra sanitary.... No more spending 10 minutes with a piddly little brush, trying to dislodge your hair from their cutting unit. Just pop it in, hit a button and walk away. You'll come back to a clean, fully charged shaver, every time!<br /><br />I have 2 very small reasons why this unit doesn't receive 5 stars from me, and they are indeed small issues that probably shouldn't sway ANYONES purchasing decision:<br /><br />1) The head of the unit is just too big for anyone who is attempting to upkeep any sort of &#34;lines&#34;. I've recently grown a &#34;chinstrap beard&#34;, and while I can maintain it with this unit, it requires far too much work to doso without taking out a chunk of a perfectly manicured line. Men that have a goatee or a mustache will be just fine, but if you are doing anything around your jawline, you will experience much frustration in trying to use the main head of this shaver.<br /><br />2) The automatic cleaner / charging base (home) is pretty big. If you have a small bathroom with a tiny vanity, plan on this baby taking up more real estate than you'd like.<br /><br />This product is high quality and lives up to all of my expectations. I'd recommend this to a friend without any hesitation. If you are on the fence and stuck comparing this unit to a slightly cheaper model, hit the &#34;Buy&#34; button on the CoolTec... The extra features are worth the price of admission. You won't be disappointed!You'll come back to a clean, fully charged shaver, every time!<br /><br />I have 2 very small reasons why this unit doesn't receive 5 stars from me, and they are indeed small issues that probably shouldn't sway ANYONES purchasing decision:<br /><br />1) The head of the unit is just too big for anyone who is attempting to upkeep any sort of &#34;lines&#34;. I've recently grown a &#34;chinstrap beard&#34;, and while I can maintain it with this unit, it requires far too much work to doso without taking out a chunk of a perfectly manicured line. Men that have a goatee or a mustache will be just fine, but if you are doing anything around your jawline, you will experience much frustration in trying to use the main head of this shaver.<br /><br />2) The automatic cleaner / charging base (home) is pretty big. If you have a small bathroom with a tiny vanity, plan on this baby taking up more real estate than you'd like.<br /><br />This product is high quality and lives up to all of my expectations. I'd recommend this to a friend without any hesitation. If you are on the fence and stuck comparing this unit to a slightly cheaper model, hit the &#34;Buy&#34; button on the CoolTec... The extra features are worth the price of admission. You won't be disappointed!
  30. Let me start by saying I was looking forward to this product the minute I heard about it. I received this product for free directly from Braun to try it out and give my honest review.<br /><br />I think the cooling head is an excellent idea. That being said let me get to my review. I have always wanted to use a nice electric razor for my shaving instead of always using shaving cream and a multiblade razor thinking that this will be quicker, more convenient and give me a nice close shave without slight razor burn or possible nicks.<br /><br />When I first got my razor I quickly plugged it in so I could use it the next morning. I had just shaved the morning before. I am rather hairy and my facial hair grows quickly and rather thick. I had avoided electrics in the past because I could never get a good shave. I always chalked it up to buying a cheap razor. After using this razor the first time I had 2 main issues. It seemed like no matter how I positioned the razor I couldn't get a good shave on my neck. It seemed like I was missing areas all over. I tried different angles, I tried pulling my skin tight, I tried going opposite the grain. Nothing seemed to work. I don't know if the blades aren't sharp enough or give a close enough shave or if my skin and hair is too soft for an electric razor. My other issue is I could never get the hairs from my upper lip shaved, so I would end up having to use a bladed razor to shave there.<br /><br />Now I had heard a long time ago that not everybodies faces work well with electric razors and that some faces after time get adapted and the shave gets better. I don't know if this is true or not. I'm obviously continuing to shave with the razor to test that theory out.<br /><br />The cooling bar is an awesome feature. Without this my face would definitely have been all irritated by all of my attempts to get all of the hair cut. I have never once felt the razor get hot or my face get warm. That in itself is a great feature. The cleaning station is also a great feature. It's very nice to just place the shaver in the cleaner and it's clean very shortly and gets a full charge.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this razor to anybody who has had a previous model or is looking to upgrade or try out using an electric razor.
  31. I received this razor as part of a Braun promotion and am so happy I did! I have very sensitive skin on my face and shaving often leads to razor bumps. I have been avoiding shaving until I have to, until the Braun CoolTec came along! The cooling sensation soothes the burn I normally feel on my sensitive skin. It fits easily into my hands and holds the charge for a more than ample amount of time. My razor bumps have become a thing of the past these days and I recommend this shaving system to anyone with sensitive skin.
  32. I have been using this shaver for several weeks now. I received the Braun CoolTec Shaver through a program run by Braun to review it. I have been using Braun shavers most of my adult life. My last Braun was a pulsonic which I was very happy with and used it until it practically fell apart. I was not impressed with the results from the CoolTec. It is more of a daily maintenance shaver. If you have more than a few days growth or longer hairs, it is very difficult to shave with the CoolTec. The head does not pivot and to me it appears like the long hair trimming head in the center has been minimized to make room for the cooling head. I did feel the cooling effect but it typically took too long for it to activate and get cold before I was most of the way into my shave. It did seem like I had to press harder than other Brauns to be able to feel the cool bar also. I wanted to wait a few weeks to review this shaver to give it a chance but even so, I still often find places that were missed even after several passes. The cleaning light comes on everyday even if I rinse it off completely... I will continue to use to see if it is a learning curve.
  33. Note: This shaver was provided via a program run by Braun, but the comments below are mine.<br /><br />This is a great shaver for those people who are looking for an electric shaver. The CoolTec system is something that I have never experienced before in a shaver and it is worth the price of the razor. Instead of getting irritated by the blades and having your face feel like it is on fire, Braun has come up with a better way. The CoolTec system literally cools down your face by having a chilled bar in the middle of the shaving service. It is an incredible feel on the face (I have turned it off to see the difference and I cannot imagine why anyone would want to turn it off).<br /><br />I have been using a triple or quad blade razor for many years so it took me a few weeks for my face to adjust to the electric but once it did, it provides a great shave. It has two foils which help catch whatever you miss on the first pass. The feel of the shaver itself is very comfortable and ergonomic. It can be used both dry and wet (I have used it in the shower with great results).<br /><br />It also has a wonderful self-cleaning system. Just put the razor into the charger, hit the button, and walk away. A few minutes later the CoolTec razor is cleaned from the inside out. You can also just rinse it off and/or use a brush on it.<br /><br />When I first got this razor, I told my brother (who is an electric guy through and through) that once I was done trying it out I would give it to him. Now, I am having second thoughts on it. I like the fact that I don't need to lather up and (inevitably) cut myself each time I shave. I can shave anywhere with this and it provides a good shave, so I am happy with that.<br /><br />On the negative side, I still can't figure out how to shave the bottom of my neck and get it all. It is probably a user error, but that knocked it down one star for me.<br /><br />Overall, if you are looking for an electric razor, I don't think you could do better than the CoolTec Shaving System from Braun.

  58. Just received the Braun CoolTec Shaver via a program Braun was running. I've shaved with it for a week now and for the most part I like it, with a few quibbles over the function.<br /><br />First thing to mention is the &#34;cooling bar&#34;. When I first heard about it I thought &#34;this is going to be a useless gimmick&#34;...but it's actually a nice (unique) feature. After you switch on the shaver it takes a few seconds for the coldness to power up. Once it's cold, it feels a bit like a cold piece of silverware...throw a butter knife in the fridge overnight and then rub the handle on your face...I think that's exactly the experience.<br /><br />Surprisingly, the coldness does affect your shave. It numbs the face a tiny bit and seems to improve the overall &#34;glide&#34; of the shaver over the &#34;easy parts&#34; of your face. Cheeks, the broad strokes of your neck, etc.<br /><br />I'm an electric guy...and it takes your face a week or more to get used to an electric razor...but after that breaking in period the results are almost as close as a blade. You'll never get entirely as close....but the trade off is convenience in my opinion.<br /><br />Anyway, the cooling strip is novel and pretty cool (pun intended).<br /><br />My issues with this razor are about the shave over the trickier parts of my face. upper lip, the jawline, etc. I just can't seem to get as good coverage with this razor as I have been able to with other products (most recently a Philipps/Norelco Senso Touch). Don't get me wrong, the shave is still good-- just not AS good, in my experience.<br /><br />So this ends up being a 4 star product for me. I like it....I think the cooling bar is not just a gimmick...it actually works. The question is whether I will continue using it...and deal with a slightly more difficult shave.... because of the cooling.<br /><br />I'll update after a month and let you know.

They told me I was receiving a CoolTec razor that kept my face cool during shaving. I wiped my face with my hand and no water was there. I kept shaving and my face stayed cool. It was awesome.   65. I have been using the Braun CoolTec for about a week and a half so far and it is certainly the most &#34;comfortable&#34; electric I have tried. I have not been a big fan of electric shavers in the past, but I was given the opportunity to try the CoolTec as part of a program run by Braun, so I jumped at the chance to give it a shot. That being said, there definitely some clear pros and cons that I'll outline for you below:<br /><br />Pros:<br />1. Very easy to use. Easy setup.<br />2. Comfortable shave - I have used other electric brands in the past that have caused significant skin irritation (breakouts) and I am not exepriencing any discomfort with the CoolTec<br />3. I LOVE the cooling bar. It's an instant burst of coolness that feels so great against my skin.<br />4. Great for use in the shower. I like to shave at the end of my shower giving my beard time to steam and soften. The fact that the CoolTec is water resistant is great.<br />5. Easy to clean. I love that the blade/foil unit pops right off the top making it super easy to clean. And can be rinsed under a stream of hot water. Also - the cleaning basin is great and easy to operate while the unit is in it's charging station.<br />6. Great travel case. Took on a weekend trip to vegas and the power lasted 3 days with no problem and the case was perfect to just throw in my suitcase.<br /><br />CONS:<br />1. Confusing instructions. The instructions provided with the unit were a little confusing and unclear. It referenced parts that weren't included in my particular model which made me initially think that there was something missing. Once I had it all set up; however, it was pretty clear and easy to use.<br />2. Not as close as a blade. I would say I have a &#34;medium&#34; level of beard growth. I would shave every other day with a blade with out looking too scruffy. Using the CoolTec, I really have to shave every day as if I wait a day or two inbetween, the shaver has some difficulty getting a really close shave. If you are daily habitual shaver, this shouldn't be a problem for you. I did go 4 days once without shaving, and this unit couldn't handle the growth and I had to revert back to a blade.<br /><br />Overall I would recommend the Braun CoolTec as it provided a very comfortable shave which is the number 1 priority for me when it comes to electric units.
  66. My biggest complaint about razors is never the heat of the razor, its that i don't really save any time or get any closer than a manual razor and shaving cream can offer. The cooling bar felt nice, minimized burn etc. When i received this shaver from braun through a special program i wasn't expecting much. It may be to early to tell if this will change my habits, but I am going to give it another 3-4 weeks and see how it goes. If you like electric shavers give it a try, its better than rotary blades that's for sure...
  67. After using the Braun Cooltec for almost a month now, i and thoroughly enjoying this product. This was given to me through a program that was run by Braun as a trial to test and review personally. inside the box was everything i expected such as the razor and the charging/automatic cleaning station.. With this new shaver, i don't have the problem of razor burn or the feeling of hairs being pulled out of my face at all. It felt as though i was putting in little to no effort for a nice quick and painless even shave. The cooling bar is an awesome feature on the shaver. It wasn't as cooling as i expected but if for sure was noticeable. Everything about this shaver is great. the cooling bar, the handle itself is easy to hold and maneuver around your face. the automatic cleaner works wonders and always keeps the blades nice and clear from hair and skin. i would highly recommend giving this a try for anyone looking to buy a new electric razor.
  68. I am definitely happy with the Braun CoolTec System, I received it in a program run by Braun. I was quite interested in how the system would work when I first heard about it and was excited to start using it. The cooling bar cools almost instantly, no need to wait, and absolutely reduced the irritation. My neck has always been a problem no matter what way I try to shave with, and always requires numerous passes which typically irritates my skin. The CoolTec system definitely helped to reduce that irritation, considerably! It does not seem to get quite as close as my other rotary shaver but the difference is minimal, and for day to day shaves, the reduced irritation is preferred over the closeness difference. I plan to enjoy the new CoolTec razer for many years to come.
  69. I received my Braun electric shaver kit through a program that Braun was running. I was very excited when I saw the new &#34;CoolTec&#34; technology offered with this shaver. I'm a long time Braun shaver owner and enjoy their products and the features that are offered, but this by far was the most exciting. I'm one of those guys that like electric shavers but even with Braun the shaver head gets warm and sometimes a little hot and causes some skin redness and sensitivity. When I finally received my shaver I plugged it right up to charge and put everything together. I thought that the little travel shaver stand was a neat idea along with the very sturdy case for your shaver. Once I began using the shaver I was immediately thrilled about the CoolTec system that keeps the head of the shaver very cool for the entire shave, keeping my skin cool and un-irritated. I have used my shaver several times now, and am excited every time I need to shave now. However, there was just one thing about the kit that I was a little disappointed with and that was the charging/cleaning station. The shaver doesn't seem to just slide in and fit snugly in the station, it seems as though you need to manipulate it a bit to make sure that the prongs on the back of the shaver are touching the connectors on the station and then you can push the cleaning button, I also noticed that bumping the counter also causes the shaver to be jarred off the connectors, stopping the cleaning process then you have to reconnect and start again. The previous Braun shaver I had, the shaver slid further down into the station and it was snug and lights automatically came on, even with an indicator of how dirty the shaver was so it knew the intensity to clean at. The new CoolTec shaver does offer a small light on the shaver that indicates when it needs cleaning. All in all I really do like the new Braun CoolTec shaving system, with having lots of experience with electric shavers w/stations I can work aroundminor things, but I thoroughly enjoy the cooling affect of the shaver during shaving and will definitely enjoy using this one for a long time.
  70. I was very excited to try my new Braun CoolTec electric shaver which was provided via a program run by Braun, and was not disappointed. It was very smooth and kept my face cool with the CoolTec system throughout the shave. I was not itchy or irritated during or after the shaving process. The razor is solid, but flexible at the same time to give a smooth shave that gets every aspect of the face. It did a much better job of close shaving if used every day but did have a tough time (as expected) with dealing with a weeks worth of scruff.<br /><br />I like knowing my shaver is clean before each use so the Clean&Charge Station was something I was really impressed with and I have not seen before.
  71. I had serious disappointment after my first shave with the Braun CoolTec System, which was provided by a program run by Braun. I decided to give it a second try with much less facial hair. While there were no pulls from the razor this time, I still didn't get the close shave I was hoping for with the CoolTec System. I do love the aluminum cooling bar and the sensation it provides. My skin showed no irritation after the shave and had a very smooth feeling, even with some pesky stubble remaining. Unfortunately I wouldn't recommend the Braun CoolTec System to anyone I know unless they don't grow much facial hair or if they shave daily.

  73. The Braun ¬∞CoolTec System took a few shaves to get in the groove of it. I've used a triple head Phillips electric razor for many years so thr Braun setup was new to me. I must say once I got the routine down and added in the cooling bar effect, it was a solid shave. Best ever maybe. Extremely well made piece of equipment. Feels perfect in your hand as you shave. Great close shave that really hits the mark.<br />The icing on the cake is the cooling bar. At the touch of a button you can activate the cooling feature. And it really works. I've noticed less irritation during shaving. It really just helps to make the whole shaving experience more satisfying. Think about it, you are generating mondo heat throughout the shaving process that typically has nowhere to go but into the air and into your brain. Instead through conduction you get an easier more efficient way to remove the heat.<br />Your face will love you for it.
  74. When I first received this Braun cooltec electric razor via a program run by Braun, I was sporting a good mountain man sized beard. Upon receiving the shaving system I wasn't exactly sure what to expect, and I was rather reluctant to try the cooling bar because I live in a cold climate where the last thing I want to do in the morning is get hit with the cold, but I have to say it definitely surprised me. The bar is cool to the skin, but not enough to make it feel unpleasant, it cools the skin as it shaves it and gives it a nice relaxing feeling to wake you up.<br /><br />The razor itself glides across the skin rather well, I didn't have it getting hung up on anything or tugging on loose hairs, my only issue with the razor itself (and the reason I gave it four stars) was because it takes a while to get the longer hairs without using the long hair trimmer, and even the stubble may take two or three passes to completely get down. That being said, when I do get the stubble down it's incredibly smooth, even better than a manual razor. The instructions for the razor took a little while to understand, but after figuring out each individual piece maneuvering the system is simple.<br /><br />When it comes to cleaning though, this razer makes it a breeze, there's a simple way to clean the top, by running water on it, a deeper clean by simply pulling off the top and cleaning inside, or the third which is the easiest. Simply put the razor into the cleaning/charging station and it automatically cleans it with alcohol.

  80. I received the Braun CoolTec Men's Shaving System from a program run by Braun. For a razor, the Braun CoolTec is quite fun to play with, when you consider all of its features. As far as being an actual shaver goes, though, it was incredibly disappointing.<br /><br />The razor was easy to setup, as the instructions explained the process reasonably well. The cooling bar feels nice against your face, but it didn't seem to do much by way of keeping my face from being irritated. I had a light beard at the time of shaving, which should be easily taken care of by a razor such as this one. Unfortunately, it just would not cut my hair at all. I tried every which way I could think of to get the razor to cut my beard, but, I just could not get it to shave it down at all. Fortunately the little trimmer on the back of the razor worked to trim my beard down a little bit. Sadly, it did not trim my sideburns down at all (to keep them neat), and I had to go back to my old razor to finish them.<br /><br />After trimming down my beard, I tried using the head of the razor again to trim my face. This time, it worked, and it cut the hair down. Cutting to the chase though, it did a pretty poor job, and I was very disappointed. I spent a VERY long time, once again trying shaving every which way I could think of (within reason), including dry (recommended in the manual), wet, up-strokes, down-strokes, sideways-strokes, etc., but I just could not get a good, even shave. I also noticed that the razor was a bit rough, as I cut my face a little, which really never happens to me while shaving, regardless of whether I use an electric razor or a manual razor. As I stated before, the cooling feature was neat, but it didn't really do much for me other than feel good in and of itself.<br /><br />The cleaning station was interesting, and I trust that it cleaned the head of the razor well since it uses an alcohol based solution for three minutes of cleansing. I was disappointed that the trimmer part could not also be cleaned, as that was the part of the razor that I probably got the most use out of, and was therefore the &#34;dirtiest,&#34; but there is no actual physical way for the cleaning station to clean the trimmer.<br /><br />In the manual, it mentions shaving every day when it talks about replacing parts. I would probably say that this razor best suits somebody who shaves every single day, as it seemed to struggle to do anything to even a light beard, and could not evenly trim very short hair. This razor should be, first and foremost, a device for shaving and, though the technology built into it (and around it, if you consider the cleaning station) is nice, it does not and cannot make up for its lack of a good shave for me personally.

  88. This razor I was given from Braun is a great idea. The CoolTec technology on the razor feels great on my face and neck. It helps with the sensitive skin that I have. I have a beard and don't shave that often. The cooling sensation on my face makes up for the lack of shaving cream. The cleaning station is also wonderful. It makes cleaning the razor a snap. Though I'm not a fan of having to buy replacement cleaner. The small trimmer on the back of the unit is also a great feature, it helps when I need a quick trim. Now what I don't really care for out weighs all the good I just described. First, the shaving performance itself is not that great. I don't have that much to shave since I grow a beard, so I would expect it not to take that long to shave my face. It seems not to catch a lot of hair with a few passes. I need to keep going over the same spot for quite a while. The longer hairs also don't get cut well. I end up having to break out the ol' classic to get the rest. Then there is the cleaning light. The first time I used the razor I shaved a small amount of hair and the clean light went off. This made me a bit upset. Either this is a flaw in some or it doesn't actually have anything to tell when it needs to be cleaned. It just beeps and blinks after every shave. All in all I would recommend this to someone who shaves on a regular basis with skin sensitivity. It seems to work much better when the hair is shorter and better maintained. Sometimes I go weeks without shaving. For myself and my beard, it will most likely end up under the sink like the rest of them. Or maybe Ill pass it off to someone who will use it. If they can handle the fact that I used it. Though that is where the cleaning feature will really come in handy.

  97. Buying electric shavers is a lot like buying car tires. Some give you great traction, some give you great fuel mileage, hardly any will give you both. I have been using Braun's top shaver's from the Activator to the Series 7. My Series 7 gives me the closest shave, is light, feels good in my hand, and is highly maneuverable. However for someone with Rosacea I will gladly trade off the heat and irritation that come with the Series 7's close shave for the CoolTec's cool bar shave. Prior to the CoolTec the Series 7 was the least irritating for me.<br /><br />I have used the CoolTec for a week now. Somehow I am able to shave quicker and that cooling bar feels as good on my face as when a barber puts hot shaving cream on my neck. If you have rosacea you will understand the need to keep your face cool. Yes the CoolTec is bulkier and heavier but for me this is the best shaver. I am a tech gadget geek. The technology geek snob in me wants the top of the line series 7 shaver. But overall I benefit so much from the cooling of the CoolTec that this is my new everyday shaver. The CoolTec keeps my face cool and calm. I turn on the shaver and wait like 3-5 seconds for it to get cold.<br /><br />15 years ago my face became so sensitive I had to stop using a razor and shave gel so for me I am not trying to get a baby's butt smooth shave on my face to replace my razor. I can only use electric shavers. Ideally Braun will figure out a way to get this CoolTec technology into their top Series 7 shaver as an optional model. Like tires for a car you just have to find the one that works for you. One guy will think tires are too bumpy while another praises the same model for ride comfort.

  102. Good product! Deliver fast.
  103. I had the series 7 before and it was much better. The cooltec does not get as close of a shave, the trimmer is in a odd position, and the while it does cool I do not feel it's worth it. Just a cool gimmick trying to make a sell. I'm sending back under the 60 day money back guarantee and will be ordering a new Series 7.
  104. Last year I got a [[ASIN:B003V37Z9W Philips Norelco 1250X SensoTouch 3D Electric Razor with Jet Clean System]] and really love it. I had my doubts that this Cool Tec could dethrone Norelco's nifty 3D blades, but the Braun's Cool Technology piqued my curiosity.<br /><br />Yup, It Really Is Cold<br /><br />How they did it, is beyond me, but this shaver literally feels cold on my face. Yes, cold. I guess Braun thought the solution to razor burn, was its literal antithesis. And I have to say, I'm quite impressed. Could you imagine a barber trying to sell you a cold shave?<br /><br />No Lotions, Potions, or Creams -- Oh My!<br /><br />I was skeptical, but decided to jump in. My sensitive skin definitely deeds something on it while shaving with any other method. Yet somehow, this Cool Tec directly on my face glided across my skin with ease. No burns, no bumps, no more stubble.<br /><br />Norelco 3D Blades vs. Foil<br /><br />These blades definitely don't hug every contour of my face like Norelco's blades do. Yet, it takes far more passes around my face to get the same shave as with Cool Tec. Something about the cooling technology just works better, plain and simple. Probably it's just the natural tightening of the skin that happens when it gets cold. Whatever the case, it works. And I'm happy to omit any shaving aids, since they often just irritate my sensitive skin.<br /><br />Cleaning Base<br /><br />To my knowledge, Braun was the first to innovate this gimmick. I've had a couple Braun's in the past, and the cleaning bases usually were the first thing to croak. This iteration is very similar to Norelco's -- sleek, black with a single button. But I prefer Norelco's cleaning solution; it's cheaper and seems to be more readily available locally. Not keen on getting roped into Braun's world again, in that department, but this Cool technology has got me sold, so I guess I'm stuck springing for those expensive blue cartridges again. Good thing we got Prime now, since I know I'll never find them locally. The base does do a nice job of cleaning though. And for once, Braun's cleaning base doesn't sound like a Lear Jet is taking off in my bathroom.<br /><br />Close Shave<br /><br />Is it closer than Norelco's? No, not really. But it seems to get the job done faster, and with fewer passes. Oh, and it does it with a comfy chill instead of whirring blades that get hotter with each stroke. So I'd say that all adds up to an edge in Braun's favor.<br /><br />Bottom Line - I found my new fave shaver ...again. My Norelco still works great, and certainly cost enough. But Braun's unique cool technology has me hooked. I'll definitely be reaching for this one over my Norelco 3D. Just wish I wasn't stuck with these blue cleaning cartridges again; especially after swearing them off the last time, for a second time. But the Cool Tec is just ...well ...cool. Happy! ;oDw I'll never find them locally. The base does do a nice job of cleaning though. And for once, Braun's cleaning base doesn't sound like a Lear Jet is taking off in my bathroom.<br /><br />Close Shave<br /><br />Is it closer than Norelco's? No, not really. But it seems to get the job done faster, and with fewer passes. Oh, and it does it with a comfy chill instead of whirring blades that get hotter with each stroke. So I'd say that all adds up to an edge in Braun's favor.<br /><br />Bottom Line - I found my new fave shaver ...again. My Norelco still works great, and certainly cost enough. But Braun's unique cool technology has me hooked. I'll definitely be reaching for this one over my Norelco 3D. Just wish I wasn't stuck with these blue cleaning cartridges again; especially after swearing them off the last time, for a second time. But the Cool Tec is just ...well ...cool. Happy! ;oD
  105. So seriously, this razor is kind of amazing. I just received the razor through a customer review program with Braun and I couldn't be happier! I've been an electric razor guy forever. I've done the rotary. I've done the foil. I've done the wet/dry. I've pretty much done it all.<br /><br />Couple of other things - in the past, electric razors don't get it done for me. Or at least they haven't. I shave with one every morning. Every morning. And then every morning, I shave with a disposable razor after that. The electric doesn't get close enough. And it irritates my skin (likely because I need to shave so much). And then came the CoolTec. It's different. Really different.<br /><br />For starters, the shave was really close. For the first time in years, I haven't had to give it a once over with the disposable razor. And really, isn't that what we all want anyways - the close shave? Where I'd go over my face over and over with my Panasonic ES8103S Shaver just to get halfway clean shaven, the CoolTec was probably 1/2 the passes. And the hard to reach spots traditionally like the neck and jawline? The CoolTec seemed to handle that w/ no problem.<br /><br />And the Cool bar thing was really sweet. I didn't know what to expect but it was honestly a very comfortable shave. It felt great and seemed like it was heck of a lot less irritating. The contrast of the hot shower and the nice cold bar made shaving a pleasure. I love the innovation!<br /><br />I was in need of a new razor as my Panasonic's display was a mess and I'm pretty sure my beard beat the blades into submission. I can say that the CoolTec is an excellent replacement. I would absolutely recommend it.
  106. I was given this shaving system through a program by Braun, and after using the Cooltec, I am extremely glad I was chosen. I have used several different shaving systems in the past, and none have worked as well as the Cooltec. I have very sensitive skin, and cooling bar works better than any other shaver I have used on minimizing the irritation. The cleaning system is easy to use and works very well, I actually let the hair on my head grow out a few days to see if the Cooltec could handle it and to see how well the cleaning system works. The Cooltec shaved my head, no problem at all, and, to my disbelief, the cleaning system cleaned the head spotlessly.   107. The Braun Cooltec is a pretty cool shaver, no pun intended.<br />It comes with a big base that includes cleaning solution and that aside from charging the shaver also cleans the head.<br /><br />It's very easy to put together and you're quickly ready to start.<br />The cooling sensation of the shave takes a moment to get used to but once you're used to it feels very good, especially because it helped my skin feel less irritated after shaving, which has always been an issue for me with electric shavers.<br /><br />Another issue usually is for me that the shaver just leaves a lot of short stubble I am not used to from wet shaving, but I didn't have that problem with the Braun shaver.My wife even commented on how nice and soft my skin feels.<br /><br />So, while I did receive the shaver through a program by Braun, I will definitely buy it once this one reaches the end of it's life.
  108. I recently received the Braun Cooltec Electric shaver as a promo run by Braun and quickly unwrapped it. I had been waiting for about 5 days from my previous shave; my facial hair was asking for a good shaving. It took awhile to get all my facial hair in comparison to using a razor. The Braun Cooltec didn't pick up all the facial hair, especially under my lower lip area and neck area under the chin. I really had to push the shaver into my skin. That's where the cooling bar really helped. It was really cool and kept my face from feeling the heat of the electric blades. Felt like an ice cube going along my face. Shaving every other day with only small amount of facial hair helps with the skin irritation; compared to the first experience where I had a lot of facial hair. The adaptable 3 -stage cutting system and sensoBlade seems to be giving a nice comfortable shave, but doesn't pick up all the facial hair in one run. Have to look a few time and even feel in the area after shaving to see if it is smooth. What was really awesome about this shaver is it comes with a Clean & Charge station. After use, you can either clean it with warm running water or you can stick it in the cleaning station. Push the power bottom and it starts cleaning. Before you use it, you have to open a cartridge that contains or what seems to smell like rubbing alcohol and insert it in. Really easy. The cartridge does need to be replaced and there is an indicating light that tells you when it does. Overall, it is a convenient shaver that does the job, but not as good as a good shave with a razor. I really like it because of the convenience and you will too.

  110. After getting the Braun cooltec razor from a program by Braun, I tried it for the first time and I love it. This electric shaver was provided via a program run by Braun, and I appreciate the chance to try it out. That being said, all of the electric shavers I have tried this is probably one of the best.   112. I received my Braun a week ago and it quickly came a part of my daily morning regimen. The cooling bar did scare me as the possibility of a gimmick, but in reality it really is pretty cool. The cooling bar cools off in seconds and feels like a can of soda between the foils, just as advertised. I am a younger guy (in my 20's) and do have fairly sensitive skin so the cooling bar definitely got my attention. The main thing that I notice is less itching and redness immediately following my shave. My previous shaver left my skin feeling much more irritated. I do still use after Dove after shave balm every time I shave, haven't worked up the courage yet to trust just the cooling bar.<br /><br />The performance of the shaver itself is above par. I get a nice close shave on my face, but i struggle with getting a good close shave on my jawline and neck area. The shaver works best held at a good 90 degree angle and that took some getting used to. The first thing that I noticed about the shaver is its grip, it has a very ergonomic solid feel to it.<br /><br />The system comes with a travel charger and a travel case. The case is very solid and dependable but I do wish that it came with a way to hold the travel charger, it is a little hassle keeping them together while traveling. The battery does not have a very large capacity so if traveling for more than a couple of shaves worth the charger will be necessary.<br /><br />The system also comes with a clean and charge station that is recommended to use after every shave. When finished shaving the shaver shows a &#34;wash&#34; symbol to remind you that the shaver needs to be cleaned. All you have to do is place the shaver in the clean and charge station and push the power button, it runs through a 3-minute self clean cycle. After the cycle the station automatically switches to charge. I have read reviews that stats that the station is not as high of quality as the series 7 Braun clean and charge station. I cannot speak for that but do not see anything wrong with the build of this station.<br /><br />With all that said, I would definitely recommend this shaving system. The shaver could provide a closer shave, but it does close enough for what I need and the cooling bar is worth the trade-off.

The cooltec technology does seem somewhat gimicky. I'm not sure it actually does anything other than provide a cooling sensation. Does it reduce irritation? I don't know. I don't typically get irritation from using an electric razor. For those that do, this may work; I just cannot comment on that.<br /><br />I do like that it is wet/dry certified. It needs to be put in the charging cradle in order to charge.   129. So I got the Braun CoolTec System from a program run by Braun and have been using it for over a week now and I have to say its pretty good shaver. I used to have electric shaver from Remington but switched back to razors since that Remington I had never shaved as close or quick as a razor in addition it didn't perform nearly as good as when I first got it. The cooling bar is a nice and unique feature, you basically activate it while shaving and the little bar in between the blades will give your skin a nice cool little blast. Me personally, I don't usually get irritated skin so it wasn't much of a factor for me. The things I liked that I felt was different from my previous electric shaver is that it gave a quick and close shave. I didn't have to go over areas multiple times. In addition, the shaver was very easy to clean. Just flip of the top and run it through water. The design doesn't have many crevices that will trap hair into the unit like my previous shaver. Also, it has a base unit that will clean and sanitize your shaver just as my previous electric shaver. All in all, it's a definite huge upgrade from my previous electric shaver and will make me ditch my razors.
  130. I have never used an electric razor before for an extended period of time. The main reason was that in the past they pulled hairs rather than cutting them. So when I was offered a Braun CoolTech razor to review, I went in with somewhat of a bias, but the razor sounded cool and I figured why not.<br /><br />To test the razor, I decided to use it exclusively for a two week period. What happened next was somewhat unexpected, but also mixed a slew of positive and negative factors for me.<br /><br />We'll start with the pros:<br />- The cooling bar. Never thought that I'd enjoy a cooling sensation while shaving. It is quite pleasant and took only a few minutes to get used to. It also cools much quicker than they note in the directions.<br />- The shave. Unlike past electric razors, you barely realize that it is cutting off your whiskers.<br />- The edger. The edging tool hooked up to this razor is really slick. It is durable enough to trim tough hairs, but also sensitive enough to trim nose hairs.<br />- The self-cleaning station. My son loves this the most as it makes all kinds of cool noises. It also has that barber shop smell to it while shaving that reminds you of the old guy who used to cut your hair growing up or the guy that lines you up at the barber shop.<br />- Less irritation & ingrown hairs. I am not sure what it is, but this razor reduced the number of ingrown hairs and irritation that I had following a shave.<br /><br />Unfortunately that the good also comes with some negatives. Some of these are universal, but others are probably for me or a sub sect of the population:<br />- The shave. I am a baby face and typically shave two times a week. With this razor, I was shaving every morning and lost the smoothness of the shave before I left the office each day.<br />- Weird angles. When shaving with the CoolTech I found myself stretching skin like you would shaving with a straight blade. This isn't awful, but really extended the shaving session and mitigated theconvenience of shaving without a sink full of water.<br />- Clean light. The razor has a water drop icon that turns on when the razor needs to be run through the self-cleaning system. Unfortunately this goes off after each shave and I am not sure if this is necessary. I have somewhat of an OCD thing and had to run the cycle every time I saw it. The most I went was two days, but did mostly because it was a nuisance to see. I cleaned the blades after each shave so seemed overkill unless you were shaving multiple people.<br />- Sink space. Now the razor is great, but takes up a lot of counter space. If you have a limited section of your bathroom, you might want to store in another area.<br /><br />Overall I would give the razor 3-3.5 stars, but am not sure that it is 100% for me. I like having a close shave last for a day plus, but do love that I have experienced less irritation than with the multi-blade traditional razor. Space isn't a giant issue for me and I think that I'll probably wind up mixing up between the electric and manual razors.
  131. The Braun CoolTec,(provided free to try from Braun)I used the shaver for the first time this morning and usually use a pre-shave lotion/splash for electric shavers. I didn't have to use anything at all! You experience this cold shave like rubbing an ice cube across your face. I didn't have to use the pre-shave splash. My facial hair grows in different directions and normally I would experience hair pulling with my other shaver, but not with CoolTec! I was able to repeat each area of my face multiple times and didn't experience any shave bumps at all. I love this shaver! It comes with a great shaver case for travel purposes! I highly recommend this shaver to everyone!

As a cheaper version to the series 7, this is not a bad razor at all and is a very great entry level shaver.

  142. I received the Braun CoolTec shaver system through program run by Braun. I was excited to try this product as I‚Äôve been on the hunt for the best shaving solution for years. I have used many razors and electric shavers over the years. I‚Äôve used Gillette and Shick razors as well as electric shavers from Norelco, Remington, Panasonic, and Braun. My best experiences with shaving were with Braun electrics. I had a Braun Flex Integral in the 90‚Äôs and most recently the Braun Series 7.<br /><br />As a Braun fan, I was intrigued by the CoolTec. The advertised cooling sensation that promised a more comfortable and irritation-free shave seemed to be too good to be true. Having sensitive skin, I was more than willing to try the CoolTec and give my Series 7 a rest.<br /><br />My first impression of the CoolTec was the packaging. It was securely packaged but didn‚Äôt require the jaws of life to open as many things do these days. The package contained the razor, the charger and cradle, the Charge and Clean station, cleaning solution, a cleaning brush, travel case, and user‚Äôs manual.<br /><br />The user‚Äôs manual was clearly written and concise. The CoolTec is seemingly designed with simplicity in mind and the manual is really unnecessary. There are two buttons on the shaver itself: a power button and a button that controls the cooling feature. The charge and clean station has only a power connection and a single button that activates the cleaning function.<br /><br />Now the important part: the shaving experience. I first noticed the build quality of the CoolTec. It is what I would expect from Braun. It‚Äôs well made and has the right amount of ‚Äúheft.‚Äù Not heavy, and not cheap feeling. I can honestly admit that this was the most comfortable shave I‚Äôve had. The cooling sensation works as described and irritation is non-existent. It seems to glide across my face better than any other electric I‚Äôve had and the coolness almost feels as though it‚Äôswet, but it‚Äôs not.<br /><br />As far as effectiveness goes, I find the shave to be a close as any electric I‚Äôve tried‚Äîeven my beloved Series 7‚Äîand it appears to take less time to do so. One thing I note is that the shaver head (the foil side) is wider than I‚Äôm used to and I had to alter my technique a bit. The head doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúflex‚Äù as I‚Äôm used to with Brauns so you have to pay a little more attention to the angle of the shaver but I don‚Äôt find this to be an issue. The side trimmer is effective and easy to use.<br /><br />Usually after shaving with an electric my face is red and slightly irritated for a short time but with the CoolTec my face is comfortable afterwards with no irritation.<br /><br />Cleaning the CoolTec is extremely simple with the Charge and Clean station. The razor has a light that illuminates if the razor needs a cleaning and you merely insert the shaver into the station and press the button. The cleaning takes three minutes and the shaver charges while in the station. It takes several hours for the shaver to dry but since the station is meant to store the shaver when not in use, this is no trouble. The shaver is dry by the next use. Automatic cleaning in the Charge and Clean station is very effective and doesn‚Äôt require much manual cleaning.<br /><br />You can also clean the CoolTec under running water. I have not yet tried this, but this is an excellent feature especially when traveling.<br /><br />Battery life is stated as 15 minutes when using the cooling feature. Since I have been using the clean and charge station daily, which charges the shaver, I can‚Äôt confirm how long the battery lasts.<br /><br />All in all I‚Äôm very satisfied with the Braun CoolTec system. I find it to meet its claims of ‚Äúputting irritation on ice‚Äù as well as providing a close shave from a well built product.

  166. This is my very first electric razor and was provided to me through a program run by Braun. I'm still getting used to it, as of right now I'm very satisfied but not quite sure if I'm ready to through away my old manual razor just yet.<br /><br />To properly test this razor I let my facial hair grow in for over a week.<br /><br />The first thing I noticed was how well the cooling element works. It feels great on my face especially in the hot shower. It feels like your rubbing an ice cube on your face as you shave. It's defiantly a different experience but the tech alone makes it worth purchasing. According to Braun they say the cooling element is to prevent razor burn and it does, very well. After trimming my facial hair there was no sign of razor burn anywhere, and I did not use any pre shave lotions.<br /><br />Another positive of the Cooltec over a traditional razor is how close it gets and how smooth it leaves your skin. I actually had a closer shave with the Braun I ever had from my razor, and it left the skin very smooth. After the shave, out of habit, I applied some aftershave lotion that usually burns after a shave. With the Braun I didn't fell a thing, meaning that it did not break the skin in any way shape or form.<br /><br />So for comfort and overall feel this is 5 out of 5.<br /><br />Unfortunately there are a couple negative aspects to this razor, but from what I hear they are an issue with most electric razors.<br /><br />It defiantly won't win any speed records; I found it much slower then my safety razor. I think with time and practice I may speed up the process a bit. Even though it is slower the convenience being able to shave without water or shave lotion almost anywhere makes the loss of speed almost worth it.<br /><br />Secondly I had a hard time with some spots under my chin. It took multiple passes to get some of those spots. I feel like it is partially my fault for not knowing how to properly shave with an electric razor, but still it was a little frustrating. This could also have been due to how long I allowed my facial hair to grow in order to properly test this razor. After a month or so ill update post a new review and see if I have been able to iron out these issues.<br /><br />Overall quality of shave 3 out of 5.<br /><br />Final verdict: 4 out of 5<br /><br />Great smooth shave with zero razor burn, but can be slow at times. I would defiantly recommend to someone who already has an electric razor because it is a heck of an upgrade in the comfort department. I would also recommend this to a traditional razor user who wants to be free of the soaps and aftershave and the ability to shave anywhere.<br />I hope this helped you decide!ittle frustrating. This could also have been due to how long I allowed my facial hair to grow in order to properly test this razor. After a month or so ill update post a new review and see if I have been able to iron out these issues.<br /><br />Overall quality of shave 3 out of 5.<br /><br />Final verdict: 4 out of 5<br /><br />Great smooth shave with zero razor burn, but can be slow at times. I would defiantly recommend to someone who already has an electric razor because it is a heck of an upgrade in the comfort department. I would also recommend this to a traditional razor user who wants to be free of the soaps and aftershave and the ability to shave anywhere.<br />I hope this helped you decide!

  170. After a few weeks of use, I thought I would add some more insight on CoolTec CT5cc shaving system, which was provided via a program run by Braun. The shave that the CT5cc gave me was more than adequate, and the popup trimmer was excellent on my goatee. It ran great for two weeks on a single charge (YMMV), and it is completely sealed so you can use it in the shower, another plus. The CoolTec technology is immediately noticeable, cooling as the foils glide across your face.<br /><br />Minor complaints are that the shaver will still miss finer hairs, so you will have to go over those areas multiple times. I counted a dozen strokes before it finally caught the hairs. The cleaning station/charger is pretty big for a shaver this size also but understandable since it cleans your shaver as well. Only problem with that is the cost of the cleaning cartridges kinda sting. I did get occasional snag that was initially painful, common with foil shavers, but the cooling technology helped with that.<br /><br />One other thing about the CoolTec technology. While it is amazing, the bar will actually HEAT UP if you use it for more than about 20 minutes. I found this out by growing out some decent facial hair to really test this shaver out.<br /><br />Overall, I have no problem recommending the CT5cc.

  172. I got my Braun Cooltec through a promotion with Braun, and I tried it out as soon as I got it. and I thought it was amazing.<br /><br />What's Good?<br />This isn't just another shaving gadget. It actually works.<br /><br />It cools your face as you shave, creating a really pleasant experience when you groom. The CoolTec technology means you're not having to reach for three different soothing balms after you shave (you should always be regularly moisturising, however).<br /><br />The amazing battery on the CoolTec means you only have to charge it for less than an hour once a week in a funky little charging stand that comes with the shaver.<br /><br />It's also waterproof so you can have a shave in the shower or just take it apart when you're done shaving and stick it under the tap to clean it. Finally, it's still light and easy to hold despite the added gadgetry within, making shaving easy.<br /><br />What's Bad?<br />Braun sells an excellent cleaning stand for its foil shavers, but even on a premium product like the CoolTec, it'll cost you extra. The CoolTec is already an awesome product, but it'd be better as the complete Braun gadget package.<br /><br />The only real issue that might turn you off the CoolTec is the fact that the cooling element seems to overheat after about 15-20 minutes of use. You'll have to leave it to (ironically) cool down after that before you can get the cooling benefit back. Thankfully, it still works like a normal shaver during that time.<br /><br />It's still a foil shaver. Albeit a very good one, it still misses finer hairs where face meets neck. Nothing a quick stroke with a disposable can't fix, however.
