  179. Received a Braun CoolTec Shaver via a program by Braun and am glad to have received it. I am a newbie to elctric shavers but this is a great electric shaver, that provides a non-irritating shave. For anyone with sensitive skin, one of the main issues with electric shavers is that they generate heat, followed by redness and irritate skin.<br /><br />Braun CoolTec, works a bit differently, just like other electric shavers it gets you a shave but Braun has added a cooling aluminum bar on the tip of the razor, set so that it glides against the skin and cools it off with proprietary Thermo Electric Cooling (TEC) technology. Thus, it chills your skin/face and reduces irritation. You just have to press the ‚Äúcooling‚Äù button to activate the cooling and keep the razor at 90 degrees when shaving. Cooling is On/Off and it come with one cutting/trimming speed. That‚Äôs fine with me as I got a clean shave.<br /><br />Other accessories include a trimmer that's great for trimming sideburns, beards, and mustaches and a self-cleaning and charging dock. The shaver stays charged for an hoursa and can get enough power from five minutes of charging for one clean shave. They have also provided a travel case and it also has a travel lock feature to it.<br /><br />It‚Äôs a pretty simple, effective, precise and for sure less irritating shaver.
  180. I was lucky enough to participate in a program ran by Braun, I have used the electric razor for a some time now and would like to provide some thoughts to help guide your electric razor decision. At first I was skeptical if the CoolTec feature is a gimic or not. I used to operate electric razors for many years until this past year. I gave them up due to having fairly sensitive skin and did not want to deal with annoying skin irritation anymore. After shave or lotions helped a bit, however the reason I like this razor is the skin irritation from this electric razor has been drastically reduced.<br /><br />Shaving Performance<br /><br />The shaver performs at a high level and with some time you will get results comparable to the Gillette and Schick disposable razors. This razor delivers a great day to day shave if you shave every day. My facial hair grows rather quickly and if I shave every day it provides a great shave. But if I miss a day or two then the thicker hairs do not get cut as easily and I usually have to shave with a throwaway razor again then go back to my daily routine. Having a higher speed for this specific purpose would be nice.<br /><br />Comfort<br /><br />Comfort for the CoolTec is paramount primarily due to the CoolTec sensation that is provided while shaving. The science behind this feature is that as you shave; your skin temperature goes up, thus causing irritation with further shaving. Keep your skin cool helps reduce this occurrence, therefore no need for aftershave/lotions! The cooling feature takes ten seconds or so to kick in, but it makes for very comfortable results.<br /><br />I am also a fan of the gripping points on the razor. It‚Äôs very comfortable to hold and you know exactly where to place your pointer finger and thumb.<br /><br />Convenience<br /><br />In terms of convenience the CoolTec has a cleaning base. This allows you you to place the razor in a base which will automatically clean and charge the razor. This removes any andall maintenance you may need to do because the shaver is cleaned and lubricated after each shave. Keep in mind these cleaning cartridges do run about $4-5/month, so it is an investment.<br /><br />Summary<br /><br />This is not the best razor on the market but if you suffer with skin irritation like I do then you don‚Äôt need all the bells and whistles like some of the other comparable electric razors on the market. Just keep in mind this razor is at its best when you use it on a daily basis. If you shave every 2-3 days then you may want to consider more powerful options.<br /><br />In terms of packaging Braun packages this German-made shaver very well and includes Carrying Case, Cleaning Base, Fluid, and Shaver. Braun does offer a 60-day return period, but I doubt you will need it!

  192. With my participation in a Braun promotion, I have used the electric razor for a some time now and would like to provide some thoughts to help guide your electric razor decision. I am a bit of a razor junkie, owning the Braun Series 7, Activator, and also a few models from Norelco. Since I have fairly sensitive skin, even though each razor performed well, all left varying degrees of skin irritation behind. I usually mitigated this by using after shave or lotions, but what this razor has done is very innovative and honestly has saved me a lot of money in aftershave and skin lotions. For the purposes of this review, I will compare to the Braun Series 7 because it is similar in design and branding, as well as a traditional Gillette razor because many will be coming from this setup.<br /><br />Shaving Performance<br /><br />The shaver performs at a high level and with some time you will get results comparable to a Gillette razor. Compared to a Series 7 the results are similar, but because the Series 7 has a faster motor, less passes are required, although this benefit also comes at the expense of higher prices. Each shaver has Braun Optifoil screen which is essential a set of oblong shapes on the foil to catch more hairs. I can attest that compared to many of Braun's older shavers, this feature does work very well. Battery life is very similar to the Series 7, giving about 50 minutes of shaving even is the CoolTec is activated. To give a good perspective, I have ranked them below:<br /><br />Performance - Series 7/CoolTec/Gillette<br />Results - Gillette/Series 7/CoolTec<br /><br />Comfort<br /><br />Comfort for the CoolTec is paramount primarily due to the CoolTec sensation that is provided while shaving. The science behind this feature is that as you shave; your skin temperature goes up, thus causing irritation with further shaving. Keep your skin cool helps reduce this occurrence, therefore no need for aftershave/lotions! The cooling feature takes ten seconds or so to kick in, but it makes for very comfortable results.<br />Compared to the Series 7 and Gillette razors, comfort is night and day for those with sensitive skin. With the Series 7, there is harshness to your skin which creates bumps or bleeding, I would assume due to both the speed of the shaver and heat level of the skin. The CoolTec shaves at a slower clip and cools the skin down, which means it will take longer to shave, but you will be very comfortable with that shave.<br /><br />Convenience<br /><br />In terms of convenience, both the CoolTec and Series 7 have cleaning bases. What this allows you to do is after each shave, you can place the razor in an accompanying base which will automatically clean and charge the razor. This removes an maintenance you may need to do (other than the 18 month blade change) because the shaver is cleaned and lubricated after each shave. It should be noted that these cleaning cartridges do run about $1 USD each week, so it is an investment. In lieu of this, you can clean the shave under running water and invest in a bottle of Shaver Saver to get the same results but with more manual intervention. Overall the shave base is nice in that my sink real estate is saved a bit by sprawling cords and shaver parts drying all over the place, and I feel the investment is worth it.<br /><br />Price<br /><br />The price component is a big differentiator for many, with nearly a $100 USD difference between the two razors.<br />What you will find is that the Series 7 is the Lexus of the group, with very fast performance, extra bells and whistles (three modes of shaving), and nicer aesthetics. This razor is excellent and honestly you can't go wrong selecting this on a deal.<br />The CoolTec shaver is very much a specialty razor. Essentially you will get the same results as a Series 7 because the foil is very similar. The difference will be in shaving time because of the slower motor on the CoolTec. What you gain is the ability to cool your face downand greatly increase comfort during the shaving process. This makes for one of the only electric shavers today tailor made for those with sensitive skin.<br /><br />Summary<br /><br />To summarize, Braun has a real winner here and a very big product differentiator from competitors. Being that the CoolTec is essentially a Series 3 with a cooling module, I can see them putting this feature on all Series models in future iterations because it works so well. Braun packages this German-made shaver very well and includes Carrying Case, Cleaning Base, Fluid, and Shaver. Of the 15+ shavers I have used in my lifetime (and some manual shaving too), this razor is by far the best because instead of making the motors bigger and faster, Braun decided to focus on comfort as well. Not having to spend countless dollars on aftershave/lotion alone makes this razor a great return on investment. Should you not like the razor, Braun does offer a 60-day return period, but I doubt you will need it!
  193. Works Great and is the best shaver i have ever used. It feels great on your face and doesn't cause any pain. I received the razor as part or a program run by Braun and I am really happy i have it. I recommend everyone to get one.

  197. I received this Braun CoolTec System though a program run by Braun. I have had Braun shavers in the past and have loved the clean and renew system. The fact is that my facial hair is course, grows fast, and the skin below all of this is very sensitive to razor burn and ingrown hairs. But enough about me. The active cooling technology cooling bar on the shaver seems to do the trick for me. I have used this shaver going on 3 days now, and there is no irritation, and when I am done shaving I have a baby butt smooth face. Which is good , since I usually only get that close of a shave with my Gillette Fusion blades. The first day I tried it, I had 3 days growth, and I gave the shaver a work out. It did a top notch job on my lip, cheeks, and chin. However the neck didn't get that short. I had a few stragglers, but that is true when using any electric shaver. So I nipped them down with my Fusion and off I went. Now the cooling bar on this thing is surprisingly cool. I know it probably is good for maintaining the blades, blah, blah, but it felt good on my face. I think that the cooling bar was actually what kept my face from getting irritated. So since day one, day 2 and 3 have been the same with one exception. The neck hair actually gets cut when I shave within 24 hours of my last shave. That amazes me. All of my past electrics, including the Braun's I have had never did so well on neck hair. This one does great. I do have one complaint for Braun, and that is to get the long hair trimmers on the side of the shavers of the future to actually cut all the hair they touch. The clipper side just isn't that great. It is just a minor complication, and will not keep me from giving this razor a 5 out of 5 star rating.
  198. I got this electric shaver a few days ago through a program run by Braun and it works great. I am a bald guy and always looking for a quicker shave for my head. I figured it does such a good job with my face I would try it on my head. Worked great!!! Any doubts in buying this for a close comfortable shave don't. It is a great product. The cleaning station works great also quick and leaves the shaver spotless. The only issue I had was the battery life. When you are shaving with out the CoolTec feature activated the battery life is 45 minutes which is great. When the CoolTec feature is activated the battery life is only about 15 minutes when shaving your face this is fine but when doing your head and face it cuts it kind of close. Other than that the product works great the foil blades clean easily if rinsed under warm water and if that doesn't work the clean station cleans it in about 3 minutes which is very quick. This shaver is a great product and leaves your face less irritated, I would have not used it on my dome if it didn't work so well on my face.
  199. I received the Braun CoolTec system from a program ran by Braun. I will say this is the best electric shaver I have every used. The first time I used it I noticed no skin irritation, no drag on the skin and over all a fairly close shave. Previous razors that I had used always left splotches, redness and a burning sensation. I will say that I get a closer shave with a traditional razor but I am considering using this day to day. The best benefit for me was being able to come off after work and get a quick shave in before going out that evening. You can get rid of the 5 O'clock shadow and not be left with any redness or burn marks. I would highly recommend the razor to anyone needing a good quick shave. The only reason I gave it 4 starts instead of 5 is that fact that I get a closer shave with a 5 blade razor.

So when I was offered to try the Braun CoolTech shaver CT5cc thru a program run by Braun, my natural first reaction was...\\"Its a lost cause on my face\\". Out of the box, Braun Cooltech shaver felt like it was build solid with no loose parts, ergonomic to hold, the main beard blade was on the top with two moving parts and the straight blade for trimming was on the back and located clearly out of the way. The shaver also came with a charge and clean system. Setup was easy and everything was provided to get you started right away. I let the system fully charge before I used it. I turned the shaver 'on' and the 'active cool'....I first started on the right chin, the shave felt totally different from what I thought it would feel like....the shaver felt cool and light on my skin and it was really giving me a shave....a close shaver for that matter. I slowly worked the shaver all over the right side and incredibly it was picking up those beard hairs of mine that grow in various directions with ease. The shaver seemed to adapt to my face contour really well, cutting thru different hair sizes well. Unlike shavers of the past, all the hair I was shaving off seemed to be caught in the shaver. I thought this was really cool and made things a lot less messy. This was just the right side, so now I had to see if it would hold the same performance for the left side and front neck area on the same charge. The shaver effortlessly performed the same way through out my whole face and neck, shaving off all my beard hair and giving me a close enough shave. The cool tech feature really does cool the shaving area and really did seem to keep off any skin irritations. I relate the significant reduction of irritation clearly to how cool the shaver really gets when you press the 'Active cooling' button. Once I was done shaving I placed the shaver on the 'Clean and Charge' station and the station started to clean my shaver.<br />I have to give this shaver a five rating, as it did pick up all my beard hair, gave me a close enough shave and did not cause any skin irritation. Electric shavers have now come a long way from what they were in the past. I personally think its high time we all had a good look at them again as an essential part of our everyday routine.....simply because they seem to have made my everyday life much easier, less messy, more hygienic, cleaner and fast.<br /><br />Pros: Clean and close shave, Gets even those stubborn hairs easily, Significantly lesser skin irritation, Fast charge, 4+ shaves per charge, Easy clean & charge, Trimmer included<br /><br />Cos: No attachments for keeping and maintaining a beard if you have one. \\"clean and Renew\\" system refills every three months.

Just a simple click of a button, and the cooling bar is activated, cooling down to a 44 degree mark, and provides a very soothing effect during my shaving activities. I have always shaved a &#34;dry run,&#34; and my skin reacts to additional products such as the lotions and gels that can be used with many electric razors. With the Braun CoolTec Solo, there is no need for additional product. The cooling bar provides that relief DURING the shave with no extra mess, time, or effort. My skin not only typically reacts to the use of additional products, but it is also very sensitive to the rub and warmth of the electric shaver. No matter how careful I may be, my neck most especially becomes very irritated, red, and blotchy. With the use of the Braun CoolTec Solo, that redness and irritation is gone. My face feels good during the shave and right after. No &#34;healing&#34; period needed between in order to feel comfortable again.<br /><br />On top of the cooling comfort, the adaptable three stage cutting system with the Sensoblade provides and excellent, very close shave. Not quite the absolute baby smooth fine feeling (across the grain, so to speak), but very close and very adequate for a day's work. The trimmer accessory is also one of the best I have had the opportunity to use. The charge stays good for days, even in using the cooling technology with every shave, every day for me.<br /><br />Overall, I am very satisfied with the Braun CoolTec Solo and would highly recommend one for purchase. This was the first foil topped shaver I have used in my adult life; I have always used a three headed spiral type shaver before. I have no complaints and would definitely recommend this one to at least try, if one is interested.t least try, if one is interested.

  211. I got this as an upgrade to my old Braun Activator 8600 when its trimmer broke. The old foils still work, but I need a trimmer to really hit some of the trouble spots. The CoolTec shaver definitely delivers on its promise of getting you a cool shave. There is a bar that sits in the middle between the foil elements that draws heat away from the foil and is very refreshing. I have had no irritation at all when using this shaver. Unfortunately, the shave that it provides is only decent at best, especially compared to my old shaver. It takes many passes to even get short hairs and it feels like the cool bar detracts from the shave quality by spacing out two of the foil elements. Since there is little irritation, it's often not a problem running over the same spot multiple times, but I eventually feel like I just have to give up and move on with my day. It's impossible to get some long hairs without a trimmer (something the old shaver couldn't do either). All in all, not a bad shave and the CoolTec has a very nice feel, but I expected more for the price. ============================== UPDATED - August 12, 2014 I've been meaning to write an update but haven't gotten around to it. I originally gave this product 3 stars because I did not feel it was worth the money but wanted to give it more time to see if I would get used to it. Since then, its performance has degraded into mediocrity and I've hated using it. The \\"CoolTec\\" feature is useless since the foils are unable to get some spots at all. Its only redeeming quality is it's barely functional trimmer (you can buy better ones for cheaper). The shave is inferior to my almost 10 year old Activator 8600. New foils might make this shaver marginally better, but I have no desire to waste any more money on this product. Strongly do not recommend.

I am really happy with the new 790CC...now if they could only add the Cooltec feature to the 790CC I think they would have the perfect shaver.

  215. I have had the chance to use the CoolTec razor for a few weeks now as part of a promotion from Braun and have to say that it is just okay. I have typically used a rotating head shaver for years and was a bit leary of trying a strip head razor. The idea of the cool bar integrated on it is a innovative and fantastic idea. To me, this is probably the best part of this razor and I really do like the way it feels on my skin. However, since I've been trying this razor out, I have had continual issues with getting a very close shave. It does pretty well on my face and chin area but I've struggled with getting a close shave on my neck. It has trouble grasping the hairs even though I stretch my skin areas as recommended. I often find stray hairs that have been missed and get longer. Even though I try shaving in multiple directions, before a shower, or after a shower, it doesn't seem to matter. I've never had this problem before with my rotating head shaver and will probably go back to using that.<br /><br />The idea of the cleaning system is a good idea, but takes up room that I just don't have and I don't like the idea of needing to purchase the cleaning solution on a continual basis. I have always just rinsed my shavers under the sink after each use and this has work just fine for years. Again, nice idea, but I believe a bit unnecessary and over-the-top. If I purchased this razor for the price it goes for I would be very disappointed I think.<br /><br />Overall, I give this 3 stars for being just 'Okay'.

I had about 3 days of scruff growing on my face. I turned it on first thing when I woke up, and it worked like a beauty. It cut right through all my facial hair smoothly with no snags or pulling. My traditional razor would always pull on my face after a couple days of facial growth. After about 5 minutes of shaving, my face was completely clean. The different cutting technology in this razor allowed for it to cut all my facial hair without putting the razor at weird angles. The cooling system works great in reducing the amount of friction or shaving irritation with this razor. I have had no irritation every time I've shaved with the cooling system on. Based on the cutting and performance of the razor I would give this product I would give this 5 stars. However, the cleaning system is what knocked it down a star. The cleaning system is sub-par, and doesn't properly clean the razor. Once I set it in the cleaning base, it would activate like it was going to clean, and then it shut off. I have still been unable to properly clean the razor like it's supposed to work. This is a great product, and I would recommend it to anyone wanting to get into a shaving system.

  224. I received the Braun CoolTec shaver via a program run by Braun. It came at the perfect time, as I was about ready to replace my more than 10 year old Braun Synchro 7505. My experience with the Braun CoolTec shaver was both positive and negative. Let me break it down for you.<br /><br />WHAT'S GOOD?<br />The main selling point of the CoolTech is that it's the \\"World's 1st shaver with active cooling technology\\". This feature is designed to cool your skin and reduce irritation. I found that this feature worked great. When you turn on the cooling feature, an electro-ceramic cooling element cools the skin as you shave. It cools quickly, works remarkably well and delivers the benefit it advertises. Every time I used the shaver my skin was left irritation free and it gave me a more comfortable shave than other shavers I have tried. This cooling feature does come with a tradeoff, which I'll get to later on.<br /><br />Braun claims that the adaptable 3-stage cutting system provides a closer shave. They're spot on. When comparing the shave I got from the CoolTech to the shave I have been getting from my Synchro - there's no contest. The CoolTech shaves closer and smoother. Certainly that's a feature that you're looking for in an electric shaver and this shaver has it.<br /><br />And here's another positive: all the hair stays inside the head of the shaver! I mention this because so many electric shavers \\"leak\\" shavings all over your sink and counter (my Synchro does). The Braun CoolTech traps all shavings in the head until you're ready to dump them. Nice!<br /><br />WHAT'S NOT SO GOOD?<br />While the active cooling technology is great and it does its job well, it comes at a cost. The cooling element is (as you might expect) sandwiched directly in between the main cutting elements. This \\"gap\\" between the blades makes for wider shaver head and an odd sensation especially when shaving up near the ears or below the nose. It feels that the shave would be more efficient if the two blades were together.<br /><br />I was never quite sure how to hold the shaver. I must have rotated it twenty times while shaving just to see 1) the most comfortable way to hold it and 2) the way to hold it that gets me the best shave. I have still not yet determined the answer to this conundrum but I will say this: It's not the most comfortable shaver to use.<br /><br />The long-hair trimmer may well be the worst aspect of the shaver. It's pretty much useless. The lack of power to the trimmer made it impossible to trim my sideburn (not thick at all). To test the trimmer (and to make sure it was actually getting power), I touched it to a piece of cardboard. It made almost no mark. You simply cannot use this trimmer at all. That means you'll need a second sculpting razor handy. That's a big negative.<br /><br />The Braun CoolTech package comes with a cleaning station similar to those that Braun has been using for several years. This was my first experience with the cleaning station and I found it to be very good. It cleaned the razor in about 3 minutes and allowed for a great place to charge the unit as well.<br /><br />SUMMARY<br />Having used the Synchro for over 10 years, it will take some getting used to using the CoolTech, but I'm planning on making that happen. I have had excellent results with Braun products and I have no reason to believe that, if properly taken care of, this CoolTech shaver will last me many years. It's hard for me to say that this is an excellent product due to the drawbacks I've mentioned above but the unique cooling technology is a great feature. If Braun were to change just a couple other things about this shaver, it would have a superior product on its hands.<br /><br />UPDATE: 12/17/13<br />Having used this shaver for several weeks now, I have upped my rating to 4/5 stars. The shaver really does deliver all it says it will. It keeps the skin cool and provided a close, smooth shave. I have gotten used to the weight of the shaver (heavier than many) and the split shaving head (split by the cooling ceramic). The cleaning system works perfectly - cleaning the shaver back to out-of-the-box condition. The long-hair trimmer is still the weakest part of this shaver. It's pretty powerless. The CoolTech is nice, quality shaving system and is definitely worth a look should you be on the market for a new shaver.d to the weight of the shaver (heavier than many) and the split shaving head (split by the cooling ceramic). The cleaning system works perfectly - cleaning the shaver back to out-of-the-box condition. The long-hair trimmer is still the weakest part of this shaver. It's pretty powerless. The CoolTech is nice, quality shaving system and is definitely worth a look should you be on the market for a new shaver.
  225. I absolutely love this shaver. I have had a number of electric shavers that claim you can clean them and the second i do that and follow the instructions they no longer work. With the Cool Tec shaver, which i received free from a promotion from Braun, all i have to do is press a button and the shaver cleans itself. It is great. The shave i better thsan my old electric shavers and since I do not have time to use a regular blade razor, this is my only option and it is great. I get a close shave, the cool tec option really helps with getting the hair close and it sooths the skin while shaving. All around I love this shaver. the only issue i would have is the price, i am not sure i would spen that kind of money on a shaver, but i do see the value in it.
  226. I was invited to participate in a promotion, to use and review this razor by Braun. I have been using this Shaving System for more than a month now, and I will say, it has provided me with a much more pleasant electric shaving experience. I have never really found an electric razor that performs adequately on my skin. I have extremely coarse facial hair that grows in all different directions, and they tend to pull my hairs, and nick my face. Not so for this razor.<br /><br />I have used a few Philips brand electric shavers with the same style foil. This razor managed to cut almost all of the hairs in one pass, whereas the Philips would take several, leading to an increase in irritation.<br /><br />Speaking of irritation, WOW. This cooltec system has greatly reduced the amount of redness, and soreness over my previous electric. The little strip of cooling surface feels great against my face, and it also seems to reduce the irritation. It really does cool your face a great deal.<br /><br />The razor is water resistant up to a few meters, like most, so you could use it to shave in the shower. I tried this, but of course the hot water negated most of the cooling effect. It has a very small cooling surface, so in my case, it wasn't able to keep up with the heat put out by my water. It still provided an impressive improvement in the amount of times I had to go back over an area of my face.<br /><br />I have really enjoyed using this razor, and may not go back to shaving exclusively with a DE Safety razor. The price seems very fair for what this razor provides:<br /><br />Less irritation<br />Quicker shave times<br />And I almost forgot to mention, IT CLEANS ITSELF!!<br /><br />There have been electrics around for a while that do this, so that isn't by itself that impressive, but it is VERY quiet compared to others that I have used (when cleaning). One issue that I had with this though, it occasionally emitted a very high pitched electrical whine while charging on the cleaning base. It annoyed my cats greatly.<br /><br />All in all, I really like this razor. If you are looking to try something new, have sensitive skin, or hair that grows in a lot of different directions, this one is definitely one to try.

  229. I received this shaving system via a program run by Braun. I want to start out and say that I have been a rotary electric shaver for the last 10 years or so. This was the first foil shaver I have used in a long time and I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The comfort of the styling grip was great, and the cooling sensation of the aluminum bar is even better. I normally don't have issues with skin irritation with electric razors but this is just more comfortable. The closeness of the shave was great on the face and around the chin.   230. I have been using a Braun electric shaver for several years now, so when offered the opportunity to participate in a trial program for some new technology I was more than happy to jump in. Right out of the box you will notice a difference with this system. The razor handle itself has been slimmed down from previous models making it comfortable to hold and manipulate around the curves your face. The cooling bar (which sticks up between the two foil screens) kicks in immediately, doing an amazing job at keeping down the irritation that normally comes with using an electric razor, especially in the area under the jaw bone. As expected the head comes off for easy cleaning and also comes with a cleaning solution helping the razor feel like new for every use.<br /><br />Included in the box is everything you see here including a cleaning brush and charging cord. The only complaint I have about the razor is the charging/cleaning base that it comes with. More specifically the power cord for that base. Its located on the back of the unit and is angled upwards, meaning that if its against your wall or mirror, its easy to bump causing the power cord to fall out.<br /><br />Apart from needing to be thoughtful as to the placement of the base, its a great system and highly recommended. If you do not currently have an irritation-reducing shaving system and are considering one, Braun CoolTec has the solution for you.
  231. Love it. Could be better. I got this for free from Bzzagent, and tried it immediately. I am a five blade razor kind of guy, so I was a little apprehensive to try a shaver like this.   232. I received Braun CoolTec shaving system for free from Braun as part of a trial program, and I was ecstatic to be receiving a $200 shaver from a well-respected company. I've had a Phillips-Norelco rotary shaver for years, and I've been meaning to replace it for some time. Suffice to say, it was nice to be able to try out this product for free. I've been using this product for several weeks, and I'm generally satisfied with it although it isn't perfect. What follows is a point-by-point review of this shaver, and for reference, I'll be comparing it to my old rotary shaver.<br /><br />Build: My old rotary shaver is very light and made mostly of rubber and plastic, so it was a bit of a surprise to hold the CoolTec, which has quite a bit of heft to it. That's no a bad thing though because the added weight doesn't make it cumbersome to hold. On the contrary, the shaver feels well-built and is very comfortable to hold.<br /><br />Shaving: This is obviously the most important aspect of a shaver, and this is where the results are a bit mixed. The best thing about this shaver is that it doesn't chafe your skin no matter how hard you press it against your skin, but in order to get the closest shave possible, you will have to apply a good amount of pressure. There was definitely an adjustment period for me when it came to switching from my old rotary shaver to this new one. My old shaver didn't require me to push down hard while shaving, and doing so would result in my skin getting chafed. Once I made the adjustment, I started to get better results from the new shaver. Another issue for me was the fact that it seems easier to maneuver my old rotary shaver. I keep a mustache and a goatee, but there are certain spots that need to be shaved around both areas that were a little more difficult using the new shaver. Another difference is that the CoolTec shaver won't cut longer hairs. This can be a good or bad thing depending on how you look at it. It allows you to do maintenance on your facial hair without worrying about messing up your look. However, once you get past stubble length, you'll probably need to you another trimmer/shaver because the CoolTec won't cut it. In the end, if you keep facial hair, this shaver will take some getting used it. However, if you like to keep a completely clean look, then I imagine the shaver would be perfect.<br /><br />Battery - Honestly, the battery life on this product is fantastic. I've used it just about every day for the past month or so and still haven't had to charge it whereas my previous shaver required a charge every 3-4 days.<br /><br />Cooling system - This really isn't that big a deal in my opinion because the shaver stays cool whether you activate the cooling system or not. However, if you like to have a cold shave, then you'll obviously like this feature.<br /><br />Cleaning - I have used the included Clean & Renew system yet, but it hasn't really been an issue given the fact that this shaver is really best for trimming stubble. There isn't much hair that going to build up under the blades, and it's easy enough to remove the top of the trimmer and rinse it out.<br /><br />Conclusion - Overall, I'm glad I was able to get a new shaver even if it isn't a complete replacement for my old one. I'm able to get a smooth, clean shave in areas that are easy to get to and have to make some adjustments in other areas. Still, for a product that I got for free, I can't complain too much.
  233. I received this razor through a Braun program. I usually shave with a regular razor and shaving cream but I figured I would give this electric a shot.   234. So I've used my new shaver that I received through a program run by Braun for a few weeks now and while it provides some unique qualities it certainly missed the mark on others. This was my first electric razor and the cooling effect is pretty nice. It is also nice to have something that I can travel with and also use in the car on my way to work for those days when life just pushes you to the brink. However, one of the things that I felt this razor fell short on was the fact that head doesn't tilt or move. Therefore I feel as though I have to go over the same spot several times in order to remove all of the hair. The cooling part keeps me from becoming irritated for sure, which would make the experience significantly worse, but having to cover the same spots multiple times makes for a long shave. It can take me 3-4 times as long to get all the hair removed as opposed to just using my straight razor. I also wish that you could begin cooling down the razor without actually having to turn the whole thing on. That might be a bit picky, but would certainly be helpful as well in the car.<br /><br />I like the cleaning system that comes with it, it makes it much easier than having to do everything by hand which I've seen some of my friends and relatives have had to do in the past. So the fact that I can just rinse it out, put it in the cleaning base and leave it until later is certainly nice.<br /><br />The long hair shaver/groomer on the back works just fine, it helps for straightening sideburns and around my neck line. It is also nice for around my mustache.<br /><br />The travel case that this shaver comes with is pretty nice as well, although it would be nice if it could fit the cord and plug as well. I don't think this would take too much additional space and would be nice to keep both together. Maybe even space to fit the charging base as well?<br /><br />Overall pluses would be: easy to clean and cleaning station works well, cooling effect is soothing on skin and keeps from getting irritated, nice travel case and the razor itself makes shaving in the car much easier.<br /><br />Overall minuses would be: non rotating/tilting head makes shaving more difficult and takes more time due to having to go over certain spots over and over again, razor doesn't begin to cool down without having to turn the whole thing on which in the car makes things more difficult and the case doesn't allow room for charger cord and base.

  236. I received the Braun CoolTec shaver from Braun to try out and it couldn't have come at a better time. I was in the market for a new electric shaver as my old Philips Norelco was on its last legs, and I wasn't sure if I was going to buy another one. I have been using the CoolTec for the past 45 days and have been very pleased with the results so far. As with any shaver, there are good things and not so great things about the shaver.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- The shaver charges is no time at all. My Philips Norelco would sometimes take a whole day to charge fully, whereas the CoolTec seems to charge in a matter of a couple of hours.<br />- The shave is very clean and is closer than my old electric shaver could get.<br />- I love the CoolTec cooling strip. I've always had somewhat sensitive skin that can get easily irritated by both electric shavers and straight razors. Typically with a new electric razor, it takes several weeks or months for my skin to not turn red and irritated. I never had any irritation problems from Day 1 with the CoolTec. The cooling sensation it leaves on your skin when you shave is awesome and feels good. I was amazed that I never had any irritation and it is because of the cooling bar.<br /> - It is easy to use and easy to store in your travel bag<br /> - It is also very easy to clean in the cleaning system that is provided and I like knowing that my shaver is getting a full cleaning and being sanitized without any effort on my part<br /><br />Cons:<br />- When you have the cooling bar turned on, the charge on the unit only lasts 15 minutes or so and after that you can't use the cooling feature again until you charge it (but at least it charges quickly)<br /> - The indicator on the shaver that tells you when it needs to be cleaned seems to be a bit too sensitive and a bit of a scam to get you to clean it more and buy more cleaning cartridges. The cleaning light literally seems to come on after every single shave even if I have just cleaned it. The instructions say you should clean it about once a week and I typically wait 1-2 weeks between cleanings so that I do not use up too much of the cleaning solution. It's a bit pricey and I can't see myself buying it too often. If I cleaned it every time the light came on, I would go through a cartridge that is supposed to last a couple of months in just a week or two.<br /> - The shaver doesn't seem to do a great job on my neck hairs. Most electric shavers I have owned in the past never did a great job on my neck hairs and I seem to always have to go over the same area several times to get those last few stray hairs. The CoolTec is no different in that regard and I seem to have to spend a lot of time on my neck to get it completely shaved.<br /><br />Overall, while it is a little bit more money than some of the Philips Norelco electric shavers and a few other brands, I do think it is a much better value with the CoolTec included, particularly if you have sensitive skin and electric shavers tend to irritate your skin.<br /><br />I would recommend the CoolTec over the Philips Norelco and I will continue to use it well into the future.

  247. I was thrilled when my Braun Cooltec in the mail thanks to a program run by Braun. I had been anticipating this new type of electric razor from Braun for quite a while. When I opened the package I knew that this was a high quality piece of manliness. After opening the box, like it was Christmas morning, I assembled the cleaning and charging base. One thing that might be good to know is that the cleaning and charging base takes up some counter space.<br /><br />The Braun CoolTec Shaver comes with the razor, the cleaning and charging base, one alcohol cleaning solution, a small travel charging base, a traveling case for the razor and a small brush for additional cleaning assistance.<br /><br />Anyone who is interested in purchasing this razor needs to know that it comes with an alcohol cleaning solution that is installed into the base. You can purchase replacements from many places; I found them for 2 for about $10. Also it recommends replacing the foil and cutter every 18 months, I have found the replacement cost around $40. So if the price of the razor is a concern it will be good to note that there will be additional future fees to consider.<br /><br />I couldn't wait to try out the Cooltec technology. The information said that it helps with irritation; every electric razor I have used tends to irritate my face due to my beard hair going in different directions. I was happily surprised that there was no irritation or hair pulling and the Cooltec provided a cold, refreshing feeling. I was able to get a close shave with minimal effort. It also has a built in trimmer to help clean up your beard, goatee etc.<br /><br />The cleaning option is great and it only takes a couple minutes to have a fully clean and lubricated razor ready to go. The Razor is supposed to tell you when it needs cleaning, so far the icon has turned on after every use. I feel like this might be a bit unnecessary since I am currently growing a beard and am using this razor to clean up the stubble onmy neck and checks. I am not sure how quickly the cleaning station will go through the solution, but it will cost to replace and I enjoy using an electric razor so that I don't spend as much on disposable razors. This comes off a bit like a tactic to get more of my money. Personally, I won't use the cleaning solution after every use but this is the only real downside to this wonderful razor.<br /><br />My only other small complaint is that it seems that the razor doesn't want to stay down on the charger but that could be me not placing it down in the base far enough. The times I have used it the charge hasn't been an issue so it might be built it to turn off the charging when completed.<br /><br />Overall I have been incredibly impressed with the Braun CoolTec. It definitely makes me feel manlier and my wife is a fan too. After trying this wonderful shaver, I would recommend it to anyone who was in the market for a new electric razor. I can definitely say that looking hot has never felt so cool!

  249. When I received the Braun Cooltec through a promotional program by Braun, I was right in the middle of growing out my beard for Movember. It had been about 2 weeks worth of growth. I couldn't really stand the beard anymore, so I thought it would be a good time and pull out my new Cooltec shaver.<br /><br />Evidently this shaver is not designed to deal with longer hair, with the exception of the trimmer on the back, but I was not going to use that on my whole face. After making a bunch of passes in a couple of spots with the foils, it hardly made a dent. I'll give it the benefit of the doubt and say it isn't designed for long hair only short lite stubble (like 1-3 days worth).<br /><br />After shaving with my normal razor, I came back in a couple of days to try the Cooltec again, this time with only minimal stubble. This attempt was more successful although still had it's share of issues. I found it very difficult to get into the curvier areas of my face and neck and feel like I had to make multiple passes in multiple directions to get any kind of good shave.<br /><br />The biggest problem that I had though was getting into the intricate areas, like my sideburns. I found it very difficult to negotiate the kind of shave I was looking for. One last thing, it didn't seem to be any quicker than my normal shaving routine. I figured since I didn't have to lather my face and rinse so often it would be quicker.<br /><br />The unique feature of the cold bar in between the two foils was somewhat interesting, but fairly lackluster. The bar did get cold, but feel it made very little difference in how the shave felt. Although I don't have much to compare it to, never really having used an electric shaver before.<br /><br />It did provide a good shave, but there were a few areas that I needed to go back and touch up.
  250. I received this equipment in a Braun campaign. I haven't used Electric Razors since my teen years, when my beard was weaker and technologies not so well developed. The new Braun CoolTech delivers a perfect shave and finally comparable to manual razors. I've been using it for about a week now and haven't noticed any major difference compared to what I was no traditional razors.<br /><br />I found the low temperature feature to really facilitate shaving. Not only is a nice feeling on your face as I think it cools the skin for an optimal shaving.<br /><br />The recharging dock is really easy to use and the cleaning fluid guarantees a more thorough cleansing of your equipment. The hard case is a great addition for some who travels frequently like myself. Taken together, I'd definitely recommend the Braun CoolTech to anyone who is used to Electric Razors and for those interest in switching.
  251. I received the Braun CoolTec CT5cc System via a program run by Braun. This shaver features a Braun's new CoolTec aluminum cooling bar which causes a cooling sensation when shaving. It feels great on the face and I do not feel any irritation after using it.<br /><br />I do feel that the shaver could be improved. I previously used the Braun 9595 shaver, which has both a battery and hygiene indicator. I wish the CoolTec shaver also had these features. Also, because of the cool bar, the shaver head is quite large, which makes it difficult to shave between my nose and top lip. The shaver is also a bit heavier than my previous shaver.
  252. I received the Braun CoolTec razor as a part of a program run by Braun. I have had terrible luck using electric razors in the past. They usually make raw hamburger out of my neck skin. I would not say I normally have overly sensitive skin either. After receiving & charging up the Braun CoolTec, I took it for a test drive. I have not been able to do the full beard yet, because I am waiting for Movember to be over. I did trim up my neck & checks & it worked great. It did not make raw hamburger out of my neck so I definitely think it is a five star compared to all electric razors I have ever used. When it comes ot an extremely close shave it is lacking, so I gave it 4 stars. The cool tec is awesome because it keeps your skin from getting too hot/warm and more irritated.
  253. I have never been a guy who liked to use a razor period. I typically always had some sort of stubble on my face... that is until I got to try out this Braun electric razor. Typically when I did shave I always had those expenisive multi-blade razors, that always seemed to rust out or just start to pull the hair out. I had never used an electric razor, but i am now a convert. I recieved my kit and was taken back by just how much Braun provided in the package. They gave the razor, a very nice travel case, and small travel sized travel charger as well as an amazing charge and clean station. Everything was very intuitive for set up and use.<br />On my first shave I was taken aback. I have had some sort of facial har for the last ten years, so I didn't completely clean shave, but this razor is the perfect match. The long hair trimmer is perfect for that hard to maintain and trim mustache and upper lip hair. This is the first trimmer that I have used that was useful, without giving me the nose-need-to-sneeze-tickle that all the others seem to do. Also the trimmer is easily utilzed and easier to get into the tight little lip crevaces that larger razor and trimmers have issues with.<br />As far as the non-goatee areas this razor left my skin with an incredibly close shave, with little effort. As I said before, I had always been a guy who was stubbly because I hated shaving, but now I am all in for my Braun electric razor!

  257. I was provided a Braun shaver to evaluate for a few weeks through a Braun company test program. I have used the shaver for 3 weeks now and will give you the pros and cons of the shaver system. Good things first. The cooling mechanism the starts cooling as the shaver is turned on is a nice feature. For someone like myself by that has sensitive neck skin this cooling feature felt great while shaving and reduce irritation. The shaver has a sideburn/trimmer as part of the shaver which is convenient, not requiring an additional piece of hardware. This shaver does a decently close shave for an electric razor. The cleaning system is very good and does a thorough cleaning job while charging the shaver. Now for the cons. The shaver is on the heavy side which makes it rough on the wrists while holding it (assuming from the cooling mechanism). The trimmer is at an ackward angle so it makes trimming a bit of a challenge. The shaver doesn't have a incremented indication of battery discharged so it makes it difficult to guage the battery life. Overall I like the shaver system and cleaning system. Despite my negative comments it does a good clean shave for an electric shaver. The weight of the shaver and awkwardness of the trimmer are almost unnoticeable after a couple of weeks of use. I recommend this shaver for anyone with sensitive skin that deals with painful irritation from shaving. The cooling feature is worth the purchase.
  258. Background:<br />I've been using Braun shavers for years (decades) on a daily basis to shave my coarse facial hair. Currently swear by the Braun 8985 shaver (with the old \\"skinny bladed\\" cutter block refills) whose life expectancy is long overdue. I'm excited to have the privilege to test the Braun CoolTec CT5cc shaver that was given to me for evaluation and review by Braun.<br /><br />The Cool:<br />It's being advertised heavily and it'll be the first thing you'll notice right away on your face, the cooling factor. The cooling bar between the two shaver heads does work quite well and made my face shiver. It's winter and I'm not used to rub a cold piece of metal over my face. For me this feature hasn't improved the comport level of the shave and I actually used the shaver more often with the cooling bar turned off. BTW, since the cooling bar is aluminum it's still a bit cold even when turned off. I'm curious though how this shaver feels once hot in the summer. Maybe it's just the wrong time to introduce the shaver?<br /><br />Power/Charging:<br />Because the shaver can be used as a wet shaver (in the shower) there is no plug for the power cable on it. Instead it has two contacts that rest either on the cleaning station or the charging cradle. This has two negative effects. You can't shave while the shaver is plugged in and you need the charging cradle while traveling.<br /><br />Cleaning:<br />Another travel disadvantage is the head design which doesn't allow the cutter block to be brushed out. The cutter blocks are attached permanently in the head assembly and can't be separated from the foil. The old Braun 8985 allows me to do this and this was the sole reason I didn't take the CoolTec shaver with me on a recent trip.<br /><br />The Shave:<br />In general the shave is comparable to the Braun 8985 with the main difference being that the head is large and spread out due to the cooling bar in the middle. In my opinion the shavers feel is much like the Philips/Norelco shavers which I don't prefer because of the large head area that touches my face. The heads of the traditional Braun shavers have always been wide but narrower so I could easier shave below my nose and follow the contour of my neck. Navigating a Philips/Norelco or this CoolTec over my face is annoying and takes more effort to ensure that every part has been shaven well.<br /><br />Things I haven't done:<br />A wet shave. Rinsed/cleaned the shaver with water (no cleaning station).<br /><br />Alternative Uses:<br />The cooling bar works really great and I bet it's great to chill your drink (and shake it) with the shaver. No need to dilute good drinks like a bourbon with ice cubes. Unfortunately, I already used the CoolTec and don't really want bourbon with shavings. If I get another one I'll explore this option more. ;)<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />While I don't prefer the shaver it's not shockingly bad. I'd still look at one of Braun's other shavers to avoid the blocky head of the CoolTec.
  259. I received my Braun Cool Tec Men's shaving system through a program run by Braun. I am a razor guy and I cannot believe this shaver changed my ways! I have always had problems with electric shavers in the past since I have sensitive skin. This shaver is not your normal shaver. It literally stays cold to not irritate my skin with the heat I had suffered from in the past. I love how close it shaves and use it all the time. Forget the shaving cream guys! Make it quick with this great shaver. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because I wasn't very pleased with the flip side to the razor. The side burn shaver/ trimmer is not precise and it doesn't allow me to outline my beard evenly. I guess because the head of it is so small. All in all thought its the best product out there. It even cleans itself after you use it and its charging! What more can you ask for?
  260. A couple of weeks ago, I received the Braun ¬∞CoolTec Shaver in the mail from Braun, free of charge, under the guise that I would speak about my experience. This does not impact my opinion.<br /><br />First, a bit about the Braun ¬∞CoolTec Shaver. What is so revolutionary about this product is that it is the world‚Äôs first shaver with active cooling technology (the revolutionary aluminum cooling bar gets down to a chilly 44¬∞ - the temperature of a typical refrigerator)! By keeping your skin cool during shaving, the ¬∞CoolTec shaver minimizes redness, burning and itching sensations and leaves skin cool and refreshed. I'm excited to see if this is true as its one of my main issues with electric razors. Also, apparently, this shaver is the only shaver accredited by the Skin Health Alliance (whatever that is)!<br /><br />Unfortunately, my receipt of this product happens to coincide with Movember - a time where I am not shaving to support men's health. Due to this, I have not being able to experience all that this product has to offer yet. However, I was so eager to see what this was about, I decided to &#34;trim up&#34; just to see what this cooling felt like. So, with full beard, I used the &#34;powerful long hair trimmer&#34; on the Braun ¬∞CoolTec Shaver to trim up. I must be honest, it didn't work amazingly. I have some pretty long, tough beard hair and the long hair trimmer didn't seem big enough, nor powerful enough to make any headway. I had to pull out another trimmer that I use regularly to really get rid of the heavy stuff. But then...I was able to experience the ¬∞CoolTec Shaving system as I used it to clean up my neck. Honestly, I'm not sure how I feel about it - at first I'm taken aback by the different sensation, but it feels nice. I think I'll like this when I give a full face shave. Shave could be a bit closer, but overall it gets the job done.<br /><br />So, at this point, the initial judgement is still &#34;wait and see&#34;. This haspotential, but without using it on my entire face, I just can't give a perfect opinion. No-Shave November ends this Saturday at which point I expect to do a full-shave and fully experience this product at which point I'll produce Part II of this review.

The cooling technology at first is very surprising and then it feels great to shave with especially early in the morning to wake you up =D. Also, who doesnt like a razor that cleans itself? It does a great job and fits very well in my hand for being a larger guy. I recemend you purchase this razor a significant other.
  262. I'm a 15 year user of a Norelco circular blade shavor, and I was excited to be a part of a program that allowed me to try out something new. I never would have changed on my own simply because I dealt with what was familiar. I really didn't know what I was missing. This program came at the right time. Taking part in Movember, and have to keep the right trim going.<br /><br />Let me tell you about my normal shaving routine. I shave every 2-3 days, and when I do, I shaved with my regular Norelco shaver, then go over everything again with my Gillette ProGlide. I do this for two reasons:<br />1) I just like the closeness of a razor, but going every 2-3 days the hair is too long to go at it with the Gillette first.<br />2) The electric razor alone doesn't do a good job around my neck, and I always get razor burn. (This is a big pain point of mine, the Norelco leaves my neck completely red and itchy, and it still doesn't get the hair very well because the grain on the right side of my neck goes a different direction and is really hard to get without the ProGlide.)<br /><br />Now back to Movember. This razor did a great job on my neck, and gave me a real close shave. No, it's not as close as the ProGlide, but close enough that I skipped the ProGlide a number of times. Best part, no razor burn! That alone is enough to not go back to my Norelco. Plus, I love occasionally skipping shaving with the strait blade.<br /><br />Now for the cooling system in the Braun CoolTec system. I expected it to just be a gimmick. To my surprise, I really like it. It feel great on my skin! It's a great sensation, and I really love using it. Is it contributing to no skin irritation on my neck ... I really don't know, but I do know I like it. One complaint, I keep accidentally turning it off because that button is right below the thumb rest when I'm shaving, and I must be used to holding the Norelco a little lower, so I keep turning it off. Don't let this stop you though, this isn'tthe reason I gave it 4 stars out of 5. Another pro is the trimmer on the back. It works much better than my Norelco, so I'm happy with that feature, though I don't expect much from it. If it does the job, I'm happy.<br /><br />The reason I gave it 4 stars rather than 5 is because the one thing I thought the Norelco circular blades did better was handle the shave when hair got a little longer (i.e. 4 days + without shaving.) It just won't cut the hair very well, and I keep flipping between the trimmer in the back and the front blades to try to get it. The flip side of this is even with the hair a little longer, there is less pulling on the hair as it shaves than there was with the Norelco.<br /><br />In conclusion, yes, I like this razor, and I would recommend it and have recommended it to friends. I still think it beats the pants off of of my Norelco (though to be fair, it's a little older model.) I don't know if it's the circular vs. strait blades, the CoolTec or a newer model, but what I do know is I have MUCH less skin irritation, especially on my neck and for me that is a VERY big deal. And I love the feel of the cooling bar. I still like to go over it with a my Gillette ProGlide razor every once in awhile, but it's nice to not feel like I have to.

  266. I was really excited to try the Braun CoolTec shaving system as part of a promotional program by Braun and after about 3 weeks of using it, I can honestly say it meets up to my expectations. Here are my thoughts about the product and its performance:<br />- If you are determined to get the closeness of a manual razor, such as Mach 3 or Hydro 5, you will probably be disappointed in this shaver. However, if you have realistic expectations, such as comparing it to other electric shavers, none of which will shave as close as the best manual razors, then the Braun CoolTec may be a great choice for you.<br />- I have used many types of manual and electric shavers. I shave every day and while I like the closest shave I can get from a manual razor I am willing to sacrifice some closeness for a still-great shave while avoiding irritation and speeding up the process. The Braun CoolTec definitely delivers when compared to my Norelco Speed XL (rotary) and Remington dual foil shaver. I experienced a shave as close as those other shavers, but the comfort of the Braun CoolTec surpasses them, since the cooling bar actually works and doesn't let the shaver irritate my skin from heat generated by the blades... a problem I've occasionally had with my other electric shavers.<br />- I like that it came with a two different charging stations -- one for cleaning/charging (also a nice feature) and the cradle for just charging. I wish the shaver could operate with the power cord, but it's really not a big deal since it charges so quickly. I don't use the self-cleaning dock more than once a week because I'm so used to popping the head off and tapping/brushing the shavings out. However, it does clean really well in the cleaning station, so this is a great feature for me to periodically renew the shaver.<br />- The shaver feels really nice in my hand -- it's solid, a comfortable weight and has nice grips.<br />- The foils do pivot side-to-side which is adequate for the contours of my face. Noneed for anything more than that.<br />- The cooling bar is great, but regular charging (every 2-3 shaves) is necessary for it to work. The shaver will continue to operate, but it will automatically shut off the cooling feature if its charge becomes to low. The cooling bar does take extra space in the unit's head, so the foils are noticeably further apart than my other foil shaver, which is fine on the face and neck, but not as great above the lip.<br />The bottom line is that this is a great system when compared to other electric shavers.I give the Braun CoolTec two thumbs up for quality, comfort and innovation. It is definitely my new favorite shaver.
  267. The cooling bar works wonderfully! I had very bad razor burn, using traditional blades. Within a week of using the CoolTec, my chronic razor burn was gone, and it shaves just about as closely as a blade.
  268. I want to start out by saying that I am, as of the past few years, a fan of the braun shaving systems as a whole. I recieved a similar shaver a few years ago for Christmas and it was one of the best money saving gifts I have recieved to date. I will also go on to say that this shaver compares very well to the one I had revieved as a gift in the past.<br /> I would like to start on a good note, it is waterproof! This is an amazing feature. I am not a stickler on where I preform my grooming routines, but to have the ability to shave in the shower and not get stubble all over the bathroom is, in a word, genius! For most of my adult life I have used an expensive 5 blade razor for the mere fact that I could shave in the shower. With this shaver I get the luxury of doing just this. No mess no fuss. Another plus, it cleans itself. The razor I have used for the past few years came with the comodity as well, but to have become acustomed to the cleaning system I'm glad that the Braun CoolTec shaver does as well. Yet another plus is the life of the battery. It seems to go on forever on a single charge. I shave close about 3 times a week and I'll say that I probably charge my shaver about once every 4-8 weeks. This is a huge plus on my end, and the fact that it has a battery guage telling you how much life you have left in the shaver is great too. As far as the CoolTec technology goes, I could take it or leave it. Since I have been using a Braun electric shaving product for some time I have learned the ways of their products. Maybe if I were a new comer to the worl of Braun electric shavers I would appreciate the new feature much more.<br /> Now on to the negatives. I have found with both Braun shavers that I have used now that I still have to shave with no guard on a beard trimmer to get a &#34;no pull shave&#34;. If I let my beard grow for more than a few days the shaver pulls and irritates my skin no matter how cold the guard gets. It has become a routine. Shave with a beard trimmer with no guard and then finish with the Braun electric razor. It is what it is and still saves me hundreds on disposeable razors, so it is a reality I have become acustomed to. On the note of a beard trimmer with no guard, the precision trimmer is an OK feature but not my favorite. I think I may of used this feature 5 times or so in the past few years but I find myself being clumsy and making mistakes with it. Maybe based on the fact of where it is located on the razor or due to my hand eye coordination in the mirror! Either way It wouldn't hurt my feeling if it were not included on the next razor I purchase. The other thing that I'm not keen on is how long the cleaning solution lasts, how much it costs and how it is refilled. First off the solution gives you a good 5-10 cleanings depending on how often you clean it. It IS a great feature because it does enhance the performance of the razor as a whole. The cleaner does however seem to run out much faster than it seems it would. This wouldn't be a problem if the replacement solution wasn't as expensive as it is. The instruction manual says that water is ok to use to clean it out but that the solution is recommended because it does lubricate the shaver and clean it the best. I wish that they sold the solution in a smaller package so you could keep the original solution chamber. A small bottle to refill it i feel would be both environmentally and economically suited.<br /> All in all I feel Braun is a solid brand and the Braun CoolTec shaving system is an all around good product. I would recommend Braun products to anybody that is looking for a quality product that will last them for years. The pros definitely outweight the cons. Purchase this razor for yourself or a loved one and it will preform to expectations.
  269. The Braun CoolTec Men's Shaving System has been a very good shaver. I was provided with the shaver to try via a program run by Braun. I have used a variety of shavers in the past, and I always struggled with either razor burn or the feeling of a shave that was not very close. Braun CoolTec seems to have resolved both of these issues giving me a shave as close as a bladed razor and the cooling sensation seems to help razor burn. I like the versatility, the travel component/charger setup, and the fact that you can use it for a dry shave or a wet shave in the shower. Overall it is a very good electric razor.<br /><br />A couple of items that could be improved in my opinion are that the sideburn shaver does not cut a clear defined line, which makes my sideburns look a little ragged; the cooling mechanism works, but I would really like it produce a much colder sensation; and the cleaning solution/catridges seem to be used up very quickly.
