I have had a razor with the cleaning technology for years so I am used to it. When I heard about then new cooling technology I was a little suspicious that it was \\"gimmicky\\" but decided to try it anyway.<br /><br />First, the cooling technology actually works and it works well. I have little or no irritation after shaving and you can actually feel it cooling your face as you shave. It's pretty cool, pun intended.<br /><br />The cleaning system works great as I am used to with my other razor.<br /><br />As an added bonus this razor is very, very quiet in comparison to the others I have used by Braun in the past. If fact, this is the quietest razor I have ever heard and this is almost as impressive a new feature as the cooling system itself.<br /><br />Another bonus is that it comes with two caring cradles. One is the big cradle that houses the cleaning system and the other is small an sleek so I can clear my counter and not have the bulky cleaning system taking up space.<br /><br />The travel case that comes with the system is a great improvement over others in the past. It is stylish and sleek and zippers up rather than being a bulky plastic case that I am used to travelling with.<br /><br />There are only two potential negatives that I have with this product that could affect some people.<br />- First, there is a large gap between the two foil cutters where the cooling element is located. After a week of use this still feels awkward because when saving my lip and chin only one of the foil cutters can shave the upper lip. Kind of hard to explain but I still do get a close shave, with some maneuvering.<br />- Second, my shaver didn't come with a brush to clean it. I have brushed from old razors but this would be a bigger deal if I didn't because I am one of those that like to keep my things very clean, especially are razor that I rub all over my face.<br /><br />I would recommend this to anyone who is used to electric shavers and especially to anyone looking to get one for the first time.. The cooling element really works and it would easy the transition from a real razor to electric.
  276. I really enjoy using the Braun CoolTec Men's Shaving System. The cooling technology is what I really love about this shaver. I've been using a disposable ravor before I started using the Braun CoolTec. When I was using the disposable razor, I would always use it before I showered because I would have less irritation that way. After using the Braun CoolTec, I havent experienced any irritation. The cooling effect is soothing to my face that sometime I don't even want to stop shaving. I even tried going back to my disposable razor and couldn't handle the irritation anymore.<br /><br />What I also really like about this is the cleaning system. I've owned other electric razors with cleaning systems and this one seems to be the best. Other systems would clean, but not as good as the Braun CoolTec. In other systems that I've used, there would always be hair still in the device and sometimes I would run it twice and it wouldn't get all the hair out. The Braun CoolTec system leaves the razor spotless. Believe me, I check the razor everytime to see if hair was left over.<br /><br />The only gripe that I have, and this may be an issue with every other electric razor is that I have to go over the same spot multiple time because it does not cut every hair in one swipe. When you're in a hurry, this is definitely an issue. This is the only reason I would prefer a disposable razor over an electric razor.<br /><br />Other than that, I'm really happy with this razor. This electric shaver was provided via a program run by Braun and I'm basing this review in comparison to a disposable razor and one electric shaver that I've used in the past. It's a great razor, and if you're looking for something that actually feels good on your skin, you should really check this out.
  277. The Braun CoolTec was provided to me free to try by Braun, but I didn't let that bias my review in any way.<br /><br />Well, this feels like a great expensive razor, from the weight to the quality of the materials. I like the textured rubber coating. When you get all the cool accessories in the box, it really feels like the product is worth the money spent. I also like the cleaning system and the travel case. When using the razor the cooling effect was really strange, but in a good way. The cold was good against razor burn, but I always thought warm was the way to go when it comes to getting the closest shave. This shaver is definitely better than all of the electric shavers I've had in the past. However, even with the CoolTec's cooling technology, it is still just a twin foil shaver. It doesn't irritate my skin as much as other electric razors, but I still prefer my regular razor for closeness of shave. Even with stretching and pulling my face I was unable to get a shave as close as a blade. I tended to start out with the electric, and clean at the end with my blade. I have a REALLY thick facial hair, so perhaps those without as genetically thick stubble, would find it better. Also, its good if you're on the run, travelling or need a good daily shave. For extra close shaves on special occassions, I would suggest finishing off with a blade shave.<br /><br />If you use electric razors and need a new one, this one (Braun CoolTec) is worth the $200, you still get a good shave but with the cooling effect that reduces irritation.<br /><br />One thing I really love is that this shaver was very easy to clean. Just flip of the top and run it through water. The design doesn't have many crevices that will trap hair. This is my first wet/dry shaver, and I love that I can rinse it off in water. However, I am a bit cautious about using it in water, because we have very hard water here, and I'm afraid that over time, it may dull or destroy the blades, foils and other parts of the shaver...BUT since we have the cleaning system to fall back on every once in a while, I don't worry as much. I feel like the lubricants undo the harm my hard water does to the razor as long as I run it though a full rinse cycle every couple of weeks or so. I wouldn't use the cleaning daily, as they are pretty expensive to change out.<br /><br />One of the annoying things is the Clean light. The razor has a oil drop icon that turns on when the razor needs to be lubricated or cleaned. Unfortunately this goes off after each shave and I am not sure if this is necessary unless you are sharing the blade and want to know if it has been cleaned and sterilized since the last person has used it. I think its more meant to get you to use cleaner regularly so you will buy replacement cartridges. Its a nice light, and the bells and whistles are really impressive. I love the color scheme, and the LED lights that are super bright and futuristic. The charging is super quick.<br /><br />The Precision Trimmer is something that tends to be useless in my experience on all electric shavers. I have never had one that actually cuts the thick hairs on my body. I guess it would work with men with thin hair, as my sideburn hairs seem thicker than the openings in the teeth on the trimmer.<br /><br />Overall, I love the shaver. I hate shaving in general because of the time, and the razor burn I get from traditional blades. When I use the Braun CoolTec, I can get a quick shave and run off to whatever I need to do. I wouldn't use it when I want an extra close shave, because I feel only a blade, shaving against the grain can get my face baby smooth. Overall, I say that if you want an elective razor, you should go with this one. If you're gonna spend money on a shaver, why not spend a little more and get a really good one?
  278. I'd been looking to upgrade my electric razor for a while now. I don't use an electric too often, but my old Norelco just wasn't going to cut it any longer for my needs.<br /><br />In what turned out to be perfect timing, I was able to get my hands on a new CoolTec shaver via a Braun promotional program. Out went the Norelco, and the Braun is now making its home near my sink.<br /><br />The shaver feels good in my hand, is balanced well, and easy to use. I do find that its a little too easy to turn off the cooling feature with the location of the button on the handle. Speaking of the cooling feature - it's definitely a uniqe experience. I find that it does help soothe any irritation to have the cool bar cross over my face as I shave and really like how it feels. My 2 year old also thinks its fun to watch daddy shave with his new razor.<br /><br />I like the ease of the charging/cleaning station and how it makes it easy to care for the unit. The cleaning fluid also smells nice and you get a slight whiff of it once you start shaving the next time. I've not had to replace a cartridge yet, so I can't tell you how that lasts.<br /><br />If i could change anything, it would be to adjust the location of the button for the cooling button, and perhaps adjust the size of the openings in the foil to fit a thicker whisker like mine. I find I sometime have to go over the same spots again to get everything, especially on my neck.
  279. I received the CoolTec shaver through a program run by Braun, and man am I glad I did! It is awesome! I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an electric shaver! Effortless and comfortable. Easy to use and gentle on your skin. Excellent battery life. The cleaner works great. The cool bar in the shaver really helps. I would highly recommend it to anyone that is a first time shaver buyer in look for a great and painless shaver.
  280. When I got asked to participate in a Braun promotion I had high hopes. I currently was using a small Gillette razor but I had been getting frustrated with the width of the blade but still liked the shave. I was exited to try out the new CoolTec system because I thought it would speed up my shaving process. My first time shaving, the cold touch of the CoolTec metal cooling bar on my face really surprised me. I knew it said it got cold but I guess I just didn't expect for it to feel almost like rubbing a piece of ice on my face. It ended up being a little to cumbersome for me the and trying to shave my chin was an awful experience. Determined to keep an optimistic outlook I decided to use it several more times. It felt amazing shaving my cheeks but when I would shaving my jawline and chin it would just snag hairs and burn my skin. I don't think this is the right razor for me but it does have some really cool features. That cooling bar is really nice and the cleaning system is awesome. It comes with a really nice case for it and smaller charging cradle. I would definitely love to see the cooling system in more razors but until then I think i'm sticking with my Gillette ProGlide Styler.
  281. I hadn't bought an electric razor in over 5 years and had switched to buying blade cartridges, which can be a hassle and can start to cost a decent amount after a while. I was in full beard mode when I got my CoolTec through a program run by Braun. That gave me a chance to test the mettle of the pop-up trimmer in the back which was sturdy and took beard to stubble quite quickly. From there the main razor did the rest, getting my face smooth with no effort. It took me a few tries to figure out how the coollness button worked, but once I did it was quite the revelation. A cool feeling on your face instead of a burning sensation is awesome. The only issue I ran into was shaving on my neck (which I've always had issues with). The cleaning system seems to work pretty well and the carrying case is nice and sturdy. I've taken it on three trips so far and haven't been concerned with it breaking. If you're thinking about buying a new shaver, you could do way worse than this one. Clean, cool shave, great trimmer with some neck negligence.
  282. I took place in a program by Braun that allowed me to test out this razor. I have to be honest I thought the CoolTec idea seemed a little gimmicky at first and having used electric razors in the past with no luck I anticipated being just as disappointed. Boy was I wrong. This razor literally gave me the closest shave I have had since I was a teenager. My facial hair is fairly thick and I almost always get razor burn on my neck. This razor eliminates the burning sensation making it feel as though you are rubbing a cold can of soda over your face with each passing stroke. The cleaning station that comes with it is great and really does keep the razor blades feeling new. My only issue (if that's what you want to call it) is the cleaning solution refills for the base are a little pricey, but I think they are worth it in comparison to not using it at all. All in all I am very impressed and highly recommend you giving this product a shot. I doubt you will be disappointed.
  283. I got to try the CoolTec system thanks to a program by Braun. The technology and built into these shavers was impressive: lithium ion battery that charges fast, waterproof and washable, LED display and self cleaning. I liked the Braun shaver because it was easy to use, except for refilling the alcohol cleaning solution. Everything else was great, I could shave and just rinse the shaver under the sink and put it back in the stand. It was nice to have it simple. The alcohol refill is the part which should be optional because it's just a hassle this shaving system doesn't need. The long hair trimmer works great, but it's nothing innovative; other electric razors have this feature. My facial hair is moderate to light, so I mainly groom instead of shaving everything and the Braun CoolTec can cut close enough for that.<br /><br />Overall the active cooling technology works, but I wouldn't call it a game changer. A regular razor and the right shaving cream could probably duplicate the effect. However, the Braun CoolTec is a solid choice for an everyday, no hassle electric razor.
  284. I recently received the Braun CoolTec Men's Shaving System via a program run by Braun. I usually get a lot of irritation on my chin and neck from using electric, but pressing the cooling button and waiting a few seconds truly works, and it feels like a smooth cool metal bar touching your skin as you are shaving.   285. I have used the Braun CoolTec Men's Shaving System everyday for a month now. I have very fast growing, thick facial hair. The most important features to me were the cutting blades (shaver, trimmer), and unfortunately these was also the most disappointing features.<br /><br />Pros<br /><br />Can use it in the shower. Don't have to worry about making a mess all over the sink and counter. Didn't seem to make the shave any better or worse.<br /><br />Easy to clean. Just pop the top off and tap it in the sink or trash then just take the brush and do a few swipes on the unit and done.<br /><br />I like the CoolTec cooling band, it seems to cool your face right away, feels nice.<br /><br />Cons<br /><br />I had little luck getting all my hair to my satisfaction. I tried every type of pressure (light-hard), every direction (360), varying speeds (slow-fast), still wasn't able to get all my hair. Most of the hair that I wasn't able to get was along my neck and my side burn areas. I shaved everyday as to mitigate the length of the hair. My hair grows fast so maybe i should have been shaving twice a day, but i thought that would be excessive. I have to go back over my face with a Gillette razor after to get all the missed spots.<br /><br />Improvements<br /><br />Power plug when plugged into the main unit easily pulls out, even without moving the unit. Also the placement of the power socket on the main unit is awkward and makes it difficult to place the unit on the counter. This should be moved and also hold tighter since the power cord is not very long and any pull of the cord, pulls the cord out.<br /><br />Trimmer smaller and doesn't work as well as previous Braun models, i have an old one from about 5 years ago and love the trimmer.<br /><br />When you have the main unit with the cleaning solution in, you can't move it around without spilling the cleaning solution. This should be sealed so you don't have to worry about moving the main unit.<br /><br />When using the trimmer the CoolTec band should automatically shutoff.<br /><br />Conclusion<br /><br />I was overall disappointed with the quality of the shave this razor provided. The razor and trimmer just didn't work well enough to be the only razor in your arsenal.
  286. I first got the Braun CoolTec Shaving System via a program with Braun for free and I was quite surprised with all that came with it. This was my first real electric shaver so I had no idea what to expect. Having a separate charging dock that takes the exact same cord was nice and convenient. The Clean&Charge station also did its job as expected; I haven't been dissatisfied with it not cleaning well enough.<br /><br />With all that said, when it came down to the actual shaving, it just didn't cut it (no pun intended). When I think electric razor I think quick and easy, but this was far from what happened. I had to go over the same areas over and over to get all the stubble gone. Even then, it wasn't as close as a shave as I'm used to with a straight razor. The CoolTec part of this all was nice; I didn't notice any razor burn or irritation.<br /><br />All in all, I probably wouldn't recommend this razor. If you are serious about shaving and your facial hair in general, I'd suggest a straight razor.
  287. I'd never used an electric shaver before I got involved with a program run by Braun to use this. At the time I was shaving my face with a razor. I tried using the shaver on my my neck a few times and it didn't even touch the stubble that I had. Ended up using the razor again.<br /><br />The only other thing I could mention is that the plug the fits into the wall sticks straight out and doesn't lay flat on the wall like other plugs might.   288. The Braun CoolTec shaver almost seemed too gimicky when I first heard of it. Cooling mechanism on the face? The typical logic is a warm/hot surface as it helps loosen things up for the shave, so wouldn't the cooling have the opposite effect?<br />That may in fact be the case. The shave is less than stellar. However, the cooling tech does in fact do one thing right, and that is prevent/reduce the razer burn you'd normally have. The cooling bar was suprising at first, but quickly felt very good against what would otherwise be irritated skin.<br />I have fairly sensitive skin, so I don't tend to shave often, and mostly just trim it down when I do anything. I'll only typically shave when it's a semi-special occasion. When I received this razer from Braun as part of a promotion, there wasn't really any special events occurring for me, so I just went with it.<br />The shave, again, wasn't really all that effective. It took multiple passes to get some areas smooth, and with some areas that are more problematic with other shavers, this one too had issues getting those clean. Eventually I stopped shaving, as I couldn't keep going anymore. But at the end, my face did not have the typical burning feeling.<br /><br />The charger bases(two, one for travel, the other with the cleansing solution) was a nice touch. The cleansing solution is more antiseptic than &#34;washing&#34;, so if that's important, then the base will benefit you. You could easily forgo the cleansing solution once it runs out if you are not worried about that(or use on occasion rather than every time?). Also, the razer itself is probably one of the better setups for waterproof/cleaning that I've seen. Very obvious rubber protecting the internal portion from the hair/water that might get in there. Very easy to clean out without little pockets of hair being perpetually stuck.<br /><br />I think this shaver sits in a niche market, those who don't need to shave often, or can't due to sensitive skin,and don't need a perfect shave when they do. If that fits your profile, this may be the equipment for you. If you need to shave daily, or like completely smooth skin, then you may wish to pass on this.
  289. I was looking forward to getting and using this razor. I was very disappointed. It does not shave close and the trimmer is almost useless. My old Braun was great which is why I bought this one. Sorry I did.

  292. While that doesn't exactly seem like a very satisfying sensation, I'll take a cool & comfortable face over the burning and irritation I have experienced with other electric razors. No bumps, no itching at all!<br /><br />I also like the long-hair trimmer which is great for keeping my sideburns neat and trimmed.<br /><br />The only reason I didn't give this product a full 5 stars was because the shave still didn't rival that of a manual razor.   293. I am not usually one for electric razors but I received this razor as part of a program from Braun.   298. Let me start off by saying that I received the Braun CoolTec Shaving System for free as part of a promotion from Braun. That said, what follows are my honest thoughts on the product.<br /><br />My first use of this product was less than inspiring. It was at the beginning of December, my first shave after the month of MoVember. (Mustache-growing to raise awareness for men's health issues during November... I go one step further and just stop shaving altogether.) I used electric trimmers to trim off the longer beard hair, then followed up with the CoolTech shaver. Admittedly, I am new to electric shavers, but this thing seemed to have trouble knocking down my stubble. Multiple passes were required along my chin, and especially on my neck. Even then, the closeness of the shave was not what I'd expected. I noticed that there were patches that the shaver missed, even after covering the area multiple times.<br /><br />At first, I didn't really notice the CoolTech feature. After a couple passes, the cool sensation did feel soothing on my skin. That sensation lasted well after I completed shaving. A good thing too, considering I had to go over my face so many more times than I would have with a traditional razor. I experienced the same sensation after other uses of this shaver as well, and that is something I really like about this product.<br /><br />The head of the shaver seemed to clog up pretty quick when clearing heavy stubble. This problem was not so noticeable on subsequent shaves when my beard-growth was not as advanced. At any rate, the cleaning station seems to do a pretty good job clearing the head of cut hair. My feeling is that as the head ages though, its efficiency will only diminish. Seeing as how it already requires multiple passes to get a good shave, I don't see this being my first choice on a regular basis.<br /><br />I tried to use the slide-out hair trimmer on the back of this unit, and I'd have to rate that part as a miserable failure. It did absolutely nothing. Perhaps I wasn't using it correctly. Maybe mine is defective. (Not a good way to promote your product if it is...) Or maybe the slide-out trimmer needs further evaluation by the brains at Braun. Whatever the case may be, I ended up using a traditional razor for fine trimming around my sideburns because this product just wasn't accurate enough for the job.<br /><br />Overall, this is a good product, but not a great one. It feels sturdy in your hands, and it mostly does a good job. For the price that this thing retails for? I expected a lot more. I haven't had a chance to look at what a replacement cleaning cartridge for the cleaning station goes for either, and they recommend replacement about every eight weeks with regular usage. Seems like a lot of money to me... but I am kind of cheap anyway. I will wrap up by saying this: Had I not gotten this shaver for free, I wouldn't have it. Had I spent a $100+ on it, I'd be a little angry. Will I continue to use it? Probably just to change up my shaving routine. I think I prefer the old reliable razor and shaving gel over this high tech gizmo though.<br /><br />**Update**<br />I've had the Braun Cool-Tech electric shaver in rotation for a few weeks now. I have to say that on a day to day basis, this thing works very nicely. It keeps the stubble down, and it leaves my skin feeling cool and soothed afterward. I still have to make repeated passes over certain portions of my face, mostly around my mouth and on my neck. There are some spots I even have to break out my regular traditional razor for because this thing just won't cut the hair close enough. I've tried the precision trimmer on the back of the shaver several times now, and still consider it a failure. It is very weak, and doesn't do a good job for precision cutting.<br /><br />If I go a few days between shaves, this thing is pretty much useless. If my stubble gets longer than 1/16th of an inch, it feels more like the shaver is pulling the hairs rather thancutting them. The shaver heads clog quickly too, and more than once, I've had to stop shaving to run the device through its cleaning cycle before finishing my shave.<br /><br />On the topic of the cleaning/charging station: Its huge. It takes up so much space on my counter, and the cord sticks so far out from the wall that I am considering the product's removal from my bathroom. I hate clutter on the bathroom counter and with this thing in place my side of the counter looks almost as bad as my wife's side. The cleaning process runs through quickly and it seems to do a good job. I still haven't looked into replacement cleaning cartridges, so I can't speak to how much those are. To be honest though, I don't know that I will continue using this shaver long enough to need a replacement.<br /><br />My final thought on this product: I'm glad I got it for free, because if I would have spent my hard-earned cash on it I'd be very disappointed.
  299. I got the Braun CoolTec shaving system as part of a program run by Braun. I previously was using another brand of electric razor but downgraded to a trimmer and Mach-3 after my friend's puppy chewed it up. Needless to say, I can go either way with electric razors: I like the convenience but appreciate the close shave a traditional razor provides, with that said, I find this has given me the closest, smoothest shave I've had from an electric razor in a long time. My girlfriend actually commented on how smooth my shave was. I also like that the razor comes with an attached trimmer for doing side burns and keeping me beard neat if I grow it. In honesty, I haven't even used the cooling technology once, as I've found that I don't need it. Hence, I give the product 3 stars because its a good razor but I'm on the fence as to whether or not its worth the extra money for cooling technology that I don't actually need. If you have really sensitive skin then it might be worth it.
  300. When I first received my Braun CoolTec shaving system through a program that Braun is running, I was a little pessimistic as to whether or not it would be any different than any other electric razor. I was also questioning whether or not it would be able to provide me with an irritation free shave. After three weeks of using it, I can honestly say that I am extremely pleased with the results. Normally, I tend to get some cuts and almost always have some razor burn and/or bumps with ingrown hairs. With the Braun CoolTec those problems have been either eliminated or minimized. For example, I have not had any incident of razor burn as the cooling bar on the CoolTec razor seems to provide my skin with the protection it needs. Also, the bumps and ingrown hairs have not been occurring at all. In terms of cuts, I do have a couple of cuts, but that is just due to my negligence at times.<br /><br />Overall, I have to admit that the Braun CoolTec has surpassed my expectations, and I'm looking forward to its continued benefits
  301. I was excited to use this product as it was provided via a program run by Braun. I was skeptical of it at first, I've always used hot water for shaving. I've never really been convinced of electric razors either. This product made me a believer! The cooling technology reduced my shave bumps and redness. My skin felt cool and smooth after each shave. I can not go on enough about the auto cleaning either. Such a time saver!
  302. I received this razor from a program run by Braun to try it out. I currently have a series 7 Braun razor that I normally use but have put that aside to test this new razor out.<br /><br />Pros:<br />I like the CoolTec technology to reduce razor burn and irritation<br />The self-cleaning seems to work better than my 7-series self cleaner<br /><br />Cons:<br />It just does not appear to shave as well as my 7-series<br />Getting it into the recharger station sometimes takes a little fiddling<br /><br />Now a direct comparison to my current 7-series razor. I does appear that this razor does not run as high of an RPM as my 7-series. There is a noticeable difference in the sounds when they are turned on. This razor does its job on my face but my neck can be a pain to shave sometimes and I end up going back upstairs to hit a couple of trouble spots that apparently I missed. For longer hair, I find it always better to use a trimmer to shave down as much as possible before using this razor for finer hair shaving. If I shave every day, it does the job nicely because it keeps hair growth to a minimum, but if you like to skip a few days at a time between shaves, it can take a while to get that smooth skin.<br /><br />The CoolTec is a neat feature, though. I like having the coolness run along my skin as electric razors tend to heat up while running for a while and I don't like a warm razor when trying to shave. The cooling bar removes that effect so shaving with it is quite comfortable.<br /><br />If this cooling bar was matched with my 7-series, I think it would be a great match, but as it is, I will probably go back to using my 7-series most of the time and save this one for maybe vacations when I don't want to bring my more expensive shaver on the road.<br /><br />I give it 3/5 stars because it's a good razor, but not something I would be bragging about to everyone.
  303. I received the Braun CoolTec Shaver via a program by Braun. I have been using the Braun Series 5 electric razor for years and it has always provided a close shave, however my skin would always get irritated, especially around my neck. So the prospect of a Braun razor that would provide a clean, close shave and minimize skin irritation was something I was truly excited about. I have been using the Cooltec razor for several weeks and I have mixed feelings about its performance. The cooling strip is an excellent idea and really did reduce the skin irritation that I typically had to endure after shaving. The cooling bar feels great against your skin while shaving. My issues with this razor are with its shaving performance. I found that the razor performed poorly when cutting facial hair unless the hair was extremely short. If you do not shave everyday, it takes quite a long time to get a close shave and sometimes you actually have to use the clipper on the back of the razor to trim the hair to get it short enough for the razor to cut it. My old Braun razor gave me a clean, close shave even if I skipped a few days of shaving; with the CoolTec I have to shave everyday or it becomes a real hassle.<br /><br />If Braun could improve the cutting performance of the CoolTec razor, this would be an excellent product. I would recommend this razor to anyone that has to shave everyday. It does provide a clean, close shave without skin irritation provided that you remember to shave everyday and do not let your facial hair get too long.
  304. The new CoolTec system is unlike any other shaver I have seen. Upon contact with the skin, there is an immediate cooling feeling on the skin. This cooling of the skin seems to have kept my skin from becoming irritated when using the razor.<br /><br />The only drawback was that it seems the product did not have super sharp blades. Quite possibly it was due to the fact that I have thick grained hair follicles though as I have not had much luck with foil shavers in the past.<br /><br />I did like that this shaver had a cleaning system as I am always worried about how to properly care for electric razors. It also had a nice travel pouch to carry the shaver with me outside of the house. The only drawback to the travel system is it did not have room for the travel charger. When I took it on a trip with me, I had to take the travel base along with the charging cord and the charger where I have had many in the past that just requires a simple cord.<br /><br />Overall, while it was often slow to cut, I found the cooling effect was still well worth the new technology and was glad to get the opportunity to try the shaver through a trial program with Braun.
  305. I have been looking for a new electric razor and I was really excited to try the Braun CoolTec Men's Shaving System.I was able to experience the Braun CoolTec Shaver via a program run by Braun.   306. I was offered a Braun CoolTec shaver for free as part of a Braun promotion in which I was supposed to try the product and give a review of my thoughts on the shaving system. I used the shaver for about a month and a half prior to my review.<br /><br />I used the shaver almost daily and it seemed to work fairly well. I was used to using a manual shaver prior to receiving this razor. The CoolTec shaver does not give you as close of a shave as a manual razor, so if you are using a manual razor that will take some getting used to. However if you shave on a daily basis this isn't that big of a deal. The shaver gets a close enough shave that it feels smooth going with the grain, but you can feel a little stubble going against the grain of the hair.<br /><br />The main thing I like about the CoolTec shaver over a traditional cartridge shaver is it seems to be a bit quicker. There is no need for shaving cream or water. It allows me to shave while doing another task if I am in a big hurry getting ready for work. The CoolTec system also feels great on your face, although I must admit it is a bit of a gimmick. The CoolTec system isn't anything that would make or break my decision to purchase this shaver. It feels nice, but it doesn't really do anything for the shave, end of story.<br /><br />In conclusion this is a great shaver as far as electric shavers are concerned but as you would expect, it will not give you the close shave that you get from a wet shave. Would I recommend this shaver, yes. Is it the best shave I've ever had, No. You have to decide for yourself what is more important, a baby smooth shave, or the convenience of an electric shave with the Braun CoolTec system.

  314. For starters, let me just tell you that when it comes to shaving I have tried nearly every type of razor to ever be conceived, and very few have ever passed the test of a great shave. Whether it's not a close enough shave or just being too harsh on the skin, there is almost always some part of the shave that comes up sub-par. So when I was received a Braun CoolTec razor through a program run by Braun, I was skeptical to say the least.<br /><br />My first impression when I received my CoolTec shaver in the mail were that aesthetics were simple, yet sleek. Also I liked the fact that the shaver was waterproof, had a cleaning station, and had a cooling bar to combat razor burn.<br /><br />On my first use I immediately fell in love with the cooling bar. It was very soothing to the my skin and definitely helped with razor burn. I also enjoyed the capability of being able to just bring it into the shower and get two things done at once. But as for the closeness of the shave I was quite disappointed. For one, it took me much longer than usual to complete a full shave, and secondly, it just wasn't as close as I'd like it to be (this probably wont be problem for most people seeing as I have to shave twice a day just to keep a clean face, but for me it's crucial).<br /><br />I didn't want to base my review off of one use so I made sure to use the CoolTec for at least a full month before writing a review. After the month I found it easier to use the shaver to shave the main majority of my facial hair and then switch a disposable razor or a straight razor to finish up the hard shave areas. All in all the razor was pretty good, it didn't get the closest of shaves, but it did help with the razor burn which to me is a big plus, and therefore I would recommend it to a person that has the same problem with razor burn or just doesn't have to shave as frequently as I.
  315. I haven't been a big fan of electric shavers as I unfortunately have sensitive skin that reacts adversely to them. I've tired a few different brands in the past(Norelco I believe) but haven't found any that work for me and had more or less sworn off ever using electric shavers again. However, I was presented an opportunity to receive a free Braun CoolTec Shaving System through a program that was being run by Braun and figured I'd give it a shot(it was free, what did I have to lose, right?)<br /><br />Upon opening the box I was quite impressed. Looked like a lot of machine and a very quality product. I read through the instruction manual(yeah, I'm a geek) and was excited to get it started up ready to use. Now, I will add here that I was coming off of a no shave November and had a little bit of half beard going. So maybe I shouldn't have been surprised when it didn't give me the closest shave of my life. First impressions..........LOVED the CoolTec part of the shaver as it completely left my skin feeling &#34;cool&#34;(duh) with no irritation at all. However, I was not impressed with closeness of the shave. I had patches of &#34;stubble&#34; that I just couldn't seem to get no matter how hard I tried to go over them. As a result, I pulled out my shaving blade and took care of the problems.<br /><br />After a couple of days I gave it another shot and once again amazed by the cooling affect. I should insert here that in all of my other experiences with electric shavers I would experience &#34;burns&#34; that would later turn into blisters(a lot like some cold sores). With the Braun CoolTec system this hasn't been a problem. But.........again a problem with getting all of the stubble around my jawline and neck area.<br /><br /> At this point I thought I would be leaving a poor review. Thankfully I persevered and continued to use my Braun. Maybe it was because I had been used to the &#34;blades&#34; of the three rounded variety and I wasn't used to this system, but after about a week I had figured the Braun out and it was shaving like a dream.<br /><br />What I love about the system now: It is a quick close shave, and as I mentioned above, the cooling system is amazing! It also comes with a self cleaning unit that does the trick and keeps it sparkling and sanitary. The Braun CoolTec system is incredibly simple and easy to use. For the most part, it just involves pressing a few buttons! I have not had to replace any of the cleaning packs yet and haven't researched the cost, but I'll jump that hurdle when I get there.<br /><br />Overall, I'd have to say I'm pleased with my Braun CoolTec shaving system...........after learning how to use it!
  316. The cooling helps a lot. I have very sensitive skin and almost always just a razor, however with the CoolTec I can use an electric shaver a lot more often without the irritation. Especially when compared to a Panasonic.   326. I was very excited to purchase the cool tec shaver, as I was hoping it would be the \\"magic bullet\\" in my desire to get a clean, close shave with minimal irritation. I should start however, by saying that I've been using electric shavers for the better part of 30 years. I've stuck closely to foil shavers as rotary just didn't work for me. I have got a quick growing dark beard with a lot of grey. I have used many Braun's including the Series 7, which I feel is still the best Braun available.<br /><br />I am currently using a Panasonic ES-LA 63, which in my opinion, may be the best shaver out there for the price / performance.<br /><br />On to the review of the Cool-Tec. Firstly, this is a series 5 shaver as noted on the box. That's not a good thing when you need a very high speed shaver to get the tough areas that even the Series 7 had challenges with. The Cool-Tec, is a larger shaver and comes with the cleaning system from Braun, which I am less a fan of after using the Panasonic which I simply wash out under the sink. As for actual shaver performance, for me it is a middle of the pack shaver. It definitely had its challenges getting the tough hairs on the bottom of my neck and just under my jaw line. Although you feel the cooling action of the aluminum bar, its still no replacement for a good pre shave lotion like Lectric Shave or an actual shave gel or foam which I currently use with my ES-LA63 with great results.<br /><br />So hoping for no irritation - that is not the case with this shaver. As with any shaver it takes a few weeks to get through the irritation period, however as I have purchased many electric shavers over the years, I know within 1-2 shaves what the shaver will be like in this regard. Braun suggests not using any lotion or pre-shave and that just didn't work for me. I had massive red blotches on my lower neck area.<br /><br />I did ok by my chin and upper lip area however that was tempered by the fact that it took quite a few more passes to get it to that level.<br /><br />Again, comparing to my Panasonic, it was no match.<br /><br />Conclusion:<br /><br />I will be:<br /><br />1. Returning the Cool - Tec<br />2 Sticking with the Panasonic brand as its 13,000 RPM motors work a lot better for my beard.<br /><br />If you don't want a wet shave, I would go with a Series 7 well before buying the Cool-Tec.<br /><br />Also, I would highly recommend Kiehl's shave lotion as it does a tremendous job coupled with the Panasonic shavers.<br /><br />[[ASIN:B00E1HI7J4 Kiehl's Since 1851 'Close-Shavers Squadron' Brushless Shave Cream]]

  330. I recently received a Braun CoolTec CT5cc electric razor through a program run by Braun. Before I received this product I really did not feel that the CoolTec technology would really effect the feel of shaving very much. After my first time using this razor I can say that it actually does make shaving feel much more comfortable.<br /><br />The razor gets a full charge after only an hour of charging, and lasts much longer than I need for a shave. If you happened to forget to charge it after your last use it only takes a few minutes to charge if you only need it for a quick shave.<br /><br />Shortly after turning the razor on you can definitely feel the cooling sensation on your face. The cold feeling the razor gives off is actually quite intense, and much more noticeable than I thought it would be. It definitely made shaving feel more comfortable.<br /><br />As someone who has been using a regular disposable razor to shave for a while, I can say that there was a less irritation than I normally feel using the CoolTec razor. Afterwards, I felt that I got a really close shave, and was very satisfied with the end result.<br /><br />The only thing I was not completely satisfied with was that I had trouble with stray hairs and patches. A couple of places took more than a couple of passes to get to. I did not feel that this razor did an amazing job shaving hair that was growing in every direction. It did take me a little longer to shave than normal, but the end result did not feel any different. It was a close, clean, and cool shave.<br /><br />I really love the clean and charge station that came with the set, it is easy to keep the razor clean, and even easier to keep it charged. Without this cleaning system I would only be using water, and I wouldn't feel that it was as clean afterwards. The razor is waterproof so you do not have to worry much about giving it a good cleaning.<br /><br />I would recommend this razor if you you have want a comfortable shave, and enjoy using electric razors.

  332. I just received this new CoolTec electric shaver thanks to a program by Braun and so far it's pretty awesome.<br /><br />The first thing I noticed right away was the cooling system on my face. I was a little skeptical about it at first, but it's legit. It's almost like rubbing an ice cube on your cheeks, if that ice cube also gave you a close shave. Now, my skin doesn't normally get incredibly irritated when I shave, but it also doesn't normally feel GOOD after a shave like it does with the CoolTec. And no creams or gels necessary.<br /><br />As for the shave itself, I have no complaints. As with most electric shavers, you're never going to get as close a shave as you would with a traditional blade, but this comes pretty close. I usually only use electric shavers and I have to sometimes go over certain hairs several times to get them. But this shaver is pretty good at getting most of them the first time. And if you do need to go over the same spot a couple times, the cooling thing keeps your skin from getting irritated.<br /><br />As a side note, I've only had this for a week but weirdly it seems to be getting BETTER each time I use it. Not sure if the blades are breaking in or my skin and the razor are becoming friends, but I'm noticing a better shave the first time around which is saving me time AND my face is staying smoother longer during the day.<br /><br />Lastly, there's the cleaning station. Now, admittedly I never really cleaned my previous electric shavers outside of holding it under some running water to clean out the hairs and have never really had a problem with that, so it seems the cleaning station was a bit excessive. But it does keep the razor clean which is a nice bonus. The only downsides are it's a little bulky in terms of the amount of space it takes up on your sink. And the cleaning process itself, while quick, is a little loud. But those trivial issues pale in comparison to the clean, close, COOL shave this thing gives. I would definitely recommend this product.

  334. First things first, I'm not a fan of electric shavers. At least I wasn't until the first shave with this razor. I've had both foil and rotary electric shavers, yet both types disappointed me and I kept returning to my safety razor. This razor however, has taken me back into using an electric shaver.<br /><br />The major marketing point of this razor is the aluminum cooling bar, which I was slightly concerned about at first, fearing it would be uncomfortable like someone holding a cold hand to your face. Upon the first use, however, I realized my fears were not founded at all. The cooling bar feels great on the skin, and there is no skin irritation whatsoever when using this shaver. The shave is extremely smooth and very close, even without using a preshave lotion. I absolutely love the Clean & Charge station, it's a very modern looking station yet would fit in well in any bathroom. I've found that popping it back into the station is far more convenient than plugging the razor in and leaving it on the counter,plus the automatic cleaning makes it feel like a brand new shaver every day I pick it up and shave with it.<br /><br />If you're looking for a new shaver, the Braun CoolTec would definitely be my suggestion.

  336. The Braun CoolTec adds yet another feature onto Braun growing list - a cooling function. Is it worth it? As I use the cooling function intermittently, I can't speak to how much it runs down the charge compared to not using it.<br /><br />As with some previous Braun models, this include the built-in cleaning system, and is very convenient to clean your razor at the push of a button.   337. I usually hate shaving, and especially with shaving machines, however, for the first time, it didn't feel so bad.<br /><br />Above all - Braun's CoolTec (provided to me by a program run by Braun) looks good and of high quality. You can def see this is German engineering.<br /><br />The stand is solid and the cleaning functionality is really cool and actually work.<br /><br />As for the shaving part - I tried it twice. The first time I had not-so-short facial hair, and it was not fun (to say the least). I realized that no matter what, shaving machines are not meant to tackle lengthy facial hair.<br /><br />The second time I tried it - I didn't shave for 2-3 days, which was reasonable for using a machine. Indeed it was better than any other shaving machine I used (although last time was about 5 years ago). The shaving experience went fairly smooth, and the cooling element actually helps not feeling the 'plucking' action.<br /><br />For anyone that is used to use a classic shaving machine - this is surely a good product.
  338. I have tried using electric razors several times in the past and every time, I used it once or twice and then returned or re-gifted it. The irritation was so bad that I couldn't wear a collared shirt for days afterwards.<br /><br />When I saw the promotion that Braun was running to try out the new CoolTec, I did some research. It seemed that the new aluminum cooling bar may be the answer to my previous problem. I figured that I have probably spent at least $1000 dollars on razors in my lifetime and I still have a long way to go so if this new system causes me less irritation than it's worth a shot.<br /><br />I have been using it for about 30 days now and I am very pleased. The irritation is minimal. The aluminum cooling bar creates a cooling sensation that tames the irritation. The adaptable 3-stage cutting system and SensoBlade provides a close shave with minimal passes. The Clean & Charge station keeps the unit clean. I like this new system so much that I recommended it to my best friend of 20+ years.
  339. So, I've been a loyal Braun customer for many, many years. My current Braun doesn't have a fancy cooling bar, but it does a great job with my morning shave, so I was interested to see how well the new Braun CoolTec system worked in comparison.<br /><br />My Braun CoolTec system was provided to me via a program run by Braun, so my financial investment wasn't a consideration, as it would be for others.<br /><br />On the whole, I would recommend the Braun CoolTec to a family member or friend if they have a little more to invest in their shaver system - short term and long-term.<br /><br />Short-term, the CoolTec doesn't necessarily warrant an upgrade if you already had a great Braun shaver.<br /><br />Long-term, the Clean&Charge station, while providing some healthy conditioning of the shaver, is a long-term expense, too. I've gotten used to brushing my Braun with the provided brush, keeping it neat and clean. That's one of the fantastic things about any Braun shaver - the parts are very easy to clean. I used to have a Remington shaver, and cleaning was more tedious due to the way the motor assembly attached to the shaver head, and it really tore up my pores.<br /><br />As I've never experienced redness or irritation with my previous Braun, I wouldn't be inclined to recommend the Braun CoolTec system if it doesn't solve an existing problem. If I did experience redness or irritation, I can see how the really &#34;cool&#34; cooling bar might help, and the 3-stage cutting system might be a more comfortable shave. However, the end result - a smooth, clean shave - is achievable with most Braun shavers.<br /><br />So, before buying a Braun CoolTec system, consider whether the great new cooling bar technology will solve an issue you might have with redness and irritation. Also, consider your budget and the great many other Braun models available at a lower cost.<br /><br />I'm giving the Braun CoolTec shaver a 4-star rating because it's yet another Braun shaver system to consider favorably against other options.
  340. Update to original review -<br /><br />After using this shaver 2-3 times a week for the last 3 weeks I have formed a new opinion. I still like everything about the unit except it's ability to provide a decently smooth shave. The Cooltec is still pretty neat, and I appreciate the chill as I scrape the lightening fast razors across my face, It's just that the shave isn't really that close. I change my facial hair fairly regularly, going from full beard to clean cut, and all points in between. When I want an area of my face to be hair free, it has to be hair free.<br /><br />The system is a nice package, and having it provided through a program run by Braun was great! Overall I'd say for the quality of shave (it is a shaver, right?) it is a little overpriced. I think $89.00 is a closer ballpark.<br /><br />Get the Braun Cooltec if you do a full face shave on a regular basis and don't like the burn of your existing equipment. And by all means reread my original review as most of it still applies.<br /><br />------ Original ------<br /><br />I always get very excited to try new technology, and because of a program run by Braun I was provided with a CoolTec electric shaver to try.<br /><br />First impression is that the thing is cool, cool as in really neat. The packaging is pretty and gadgety. You will want to open it right away. When you do open the box you will see more parts than expected. Fumble through it all and you realize there's nothing to worry about. Everything you want and nothing you don't.<br /><br />The unit itself has a great feel, very weighty and grippy. The same can be said of all the components. Thick plastic and rubber all around. And I have to mention that the included cleaning brush, very short and stubby, is actually useful.<br /><br />My shaver didn't have any charge on it but that's fine because you get a full shave's worth of juice in 5 minutes, just as the instructions suggest. Another note about charging is that you don't have to worry aboutrunning the power all the way down before recharging, a plus to me as bathroom outlets are usually a little crowded.<br /><br />The shaver provides the same above average closeness as many high-end systems but, there was literally zero irritation. No bumps, redness, burn, anything. It honestly feels like a treat when using. And afterwards was the biggest surprise. It doesn't feel like you've just ran razors all up and about your face. These things don't provide a totally bald shave but that microscopic hair that is left is feathery soft. Not like others I've tried which left stubble. Very nice.<br /><br />I used the Clean&Charge station, even after shaving just once, to get a feel for how it works. I've never had an electric with this feature before but was pretty happy with the operation. Removing the shaver is a little clumsy because it's so snug while inside but not a big deal.<br /><br />Overall I'm very happy with the Braun CoolTec system. I recommend confidently.

  344. The main attraction of this shaver is the CoolTec System which really works. The cooling bar in between the shaver blades does a good job cooling the skin to circumvent shaver burns and other skin irritations. A small catch is that it doesn't immediately start cold. It takes around 15 to 30 seconds to get the cooling bar cold enough to work it's magic. Once it's cool though, the cooling sensation is a very nice feeling while I shaved.<br />I've had a Panasonic electric shaver previously and I'm afraid that shaver is going to be put in storage. The Braun shaver is as good as the Panasonic and shaves as close as most electric shavers can.<br />The system also has a clean and charge station with a replaceable cleaning fluid that installs super easily at the bottom of the station. You just press a button and the bottom part extends down for you to slide in the cleaning fluid container and then you just press it back up and into the station. There's only one button on the top to start the cleaning cycle. Keeping it simple is always a good thing.<br />One downside of the Braun shaver is that you are unable to plug the shaver straight to the charger/power cable. You can only charge with the station or a small cradle thing that the charging cable plugs into. So that's one extra item to pack if you are traveling long enough to have to recharge it. On the other hand, since there's no way to plug a cable into the shaver, there's less chance of any electrical accidents because you can use this shaver in the shower. The last thing you want is a wet shaver that might cause a short when you try to charge it before the charging part fully dried out.<br />I did not use the trimmer on the side as I do not keep or maintain a sideburn or mustache.<br />Lastly, the shaver also comes with a little brush and a sturdy shaver-shaped travel case which is handy in avoiding getting hair 'crumbs' on other toiletries.<br />The electric shaver was provided to me via a program run by Braun.

  349. I'll admit I was a bit skeptical when I received this shaver. I have also always preferred a rotary shaver because I did not get a good shave with the last foil shaver I tried. So my expectations were not very high for this shaver, but I was very pleasantly surprised with my experience!<br /><br />The CoolTec feature is a very nice sensation. The aluminum cooling bar is not cold, just cool. As I said, I didn't think I suffered from razor burn, but after using this shaver, I noticed that my skin is not as red as it is when using other shavers and it is noticeably less dry. Braun has solved a problem that I didn't even know I had!<br /><br />The shaver is a good size, looks very sleek, and provides a nice, close shave. I have to make a couple passes over some areas to get all the hairs, but I have always had to do that with any shaver I have used, so I think it is less an issue with the shaver and more a problem with the thickness of my facial hair. The Clean and Charge station makes it very simple to keep the shaver clean and ready for use the next morning. To conserve the cleaning solution, I have only been running the cleaning cycle every three days and have had no problems so far.<br /><br />My one complaint about this shaver is the charging mechanism. When I am at home, I can just drop the shaver into the Clean and Charge station and it will charge automatically. When I'm traveling, however, I can't just plug the shaver into the wall like I have with any other shaver I have owned. Instead, you have to bring along a charging &#34;shell&#34; that the power cord attaches to and then sit the shaver in the shell to charge. It's not a huge deal, but it's an extra item that I have to pack and keep track of while traveling.<br /><br />Other than the minor annoyance with the travel charging, I am extremely pleased with this shaving system. Now that I have experienced the CoolTec feature, I don't want to give it up!<br /><br />**I received this shaver via a program run by Braun.**

  354. I've been using Braun's self cleaning razors since the Syncro line, currently using the Pulsonic 790cc-4. While I think the 790cc-4 is the best razor ever made, like a moth to the flame I had to try the CoolTec razor. Positives: the cooling bar really works and the razor gives a reasonably close shave Negatives: the cooling bar requires the shaver heads to be further apart, to make room for the cooling bar, making shaving more difficult and uncomfortable, the shaver performance is poor when compared to the 790cc meaning that it takes a lot longer to shave, as a result the shaver head would otherwise heat up if you didn't have the cooling bar. Since you can shave closer, faster, and more comfortably with the 790cc-4 I'm sticking with that, but would be happy to buy a new top of the line razor with shave performance similar to the 790cc which includes the cooling tech, however, there is some work to be done by Braun. The cooling technology should be built into the razor head system to keep the shaver head cool, it doesn't actually need to touch the skin (unless that's the only way it works). This way the shaver head can remain more compact without warming up while shaving. If the cooling tech does need to touch the skin then maybe they can make the center cutter the cooling bar (i.e. cool the center cutter) to keep the shaver head as compact as possible. My two cents, your mileage may vary.

  357. I got the Braun CoolTec razor as part of a promotion for no charge from Braun. It is what I'd call a middle of the line electric that does a decent job with a nice feature to &#34;cool&#34; your face while shaving. The cooling sensation is more is less the same sensation you'd get by pulling a can of Coke out of your fridge and rubbing it on your face. Not freezing, but also not sure it is really doing too much to make my skin feel any better. The built in charger and cleaning system does a great job of taking the hassle out of shaving. It will wash, sterilize and dry it all in a single button.<br /><br />All in all, I am a big fan of Braun electric razors (have used the 360 Complete 8985 for about 5 years and the 790cc for the past 3 or so), but those razors just shave so much closer than this model. It really struggles to get neck hairs on only 24 hours of not shaving. I found myself doing many more passes than I did with the 790cc and actually caused more irritation. If you can afford the higher end model, I would definitely say you should skip this one and move up to the 790cc.

The mornings are the most hectic in our household and often times, I have to shave with one hand while the other hand is helping with my kids get ready. The Braun provides a close clean shave and does not make too much noise. The chamber is easy to clean and the battery life is very good. I do not keep it charged in the cradle constantly but rather charge it every 3 to 4 days. The are a couple of negatives in my opinion and one of them is that the cord for the battery charger is very short. I wished it were longer so that I could place the cradle further away from the socket to charge as right now, it has to be directly next to it or else it will not reach. I also wished they would make the handle of the cleaning brush a bit longer. If you have big hands, it is hard to hold such a tiny cleaning brush in your hands to scrape out the loose hairs.
  363. Since I was in college, in the early 1990's, I have used blade razors. I used the Gillette Fusion Razor for the past several years. I was given the Braun CoolTec system to try. I have stopped using blade razors and have never been happier. I stopped using electric razors because they never cut my course beard hair close enough, so I spent a lot of time going back over areas that I had already shaved. Often this lead to in-grown hairs and razor bumps that hurt. Also, cleaning the razors was impossible. It chopped the hair so that whenever I opened the shaving head I would spray whisker dust everywhere. Once I switched to blade razors I got a very close shave in fewer strokes and fewer in-grown hairs. However the expense of using blade razors is becoming quite cost prohibitive. I received my Braun CoolTec System through a campaign run by Braun, so while price was not a consideration in the long run it will still be cheaper than continuing to use blade razors.<br />What do I love about the Braun CoolTec system. First, is the closeness of the shave. It does as well as the blade razor, but it does something the blade razor could never do it cools the skin on my face. The CoolTec bar actually cools as I shave. It feels great. The cool feeling as I shave is so refreshing. I am done in half the time of shaving with a razor and with twice the comfort. The cooling effect comes in very handy when I go on a shaving holiday. (When I choose to not shave for a couple of days.) The Razor does tend to pull the longer hairs out, but no worse than shaving with a blade. The benefit is the CoolTec bar. It cools the skin between each shaving head.<br />Another great thing about Braun system is the cleaning and charging station. I no longer have to take the heads off to clean the razor blades. I shave, put the razor back in the base, press a button and it cleans and charges the razor at the same time. If I am traveling, I can just rinse the blades under water. It is fantastic.<br />I may never go back to using blades again.

However, on general day to day shaving, it gets the job done and feels great doing it. If you have the money to spend, I would recommend this razor.
  366. Shave 5 star - may not be as close as other systems, but my need is to be able to shave daily at all.<br />Amazon disclosures re: product - 0 stars - Can't return it because cleaning solution flammable.<br />Amazon customer service - 5 stars - took care of my problem and made what I was sure was going to be a frustrating ordeal into a pleasant experience. Good job Amit.<br /><br />I understand not being able to return the \\"flammable\\" cleaning solution.<br /><br />I had my doubts I would be able to use this because I haven't been able to frequently use any shaving system, ever.<br /><br />It works well, but mine came with a nick in the cooling bar so I figured I would exchange it through amazon.<br /><br />NOPE. can't select the product to return with a note about it containing hazardous materials. I guess I will pursue it over the phone or through Braun, but this a real F-you to not disclose that when ordering.<br /><br />Update, went through help to find a chat window and customer service rep made everything ok.<br /><br />The razor. I can understand how those who can use any razor would say it's not the best shave. I still feel a barely noticeable stubble. My problem is, no matter what technique, razor, blade, cream, lotion, pre treatment, method, I have used in the past, if I shaved more than 2x per week I would get a horrible rash. If I have a special event on a saturday, I literally would not shave for at least 4 days and then just before I put on my shirt and headed out the door I would shave and hope I didn't break out. Many times sunday morning I would have a slight rash.<br /><br />With this system, I let it run a minute to get cold and then shave every morning. one time when it felt a little sensitive, I stopped, took off the cartridge and just ran the cooling bar over my face. no breakout, no problems.<br /><br />I can't tell you how nice it is to have a shaving option now.<br /><br />When I first started using it, I noticed what others commented about re: not cutting a lot of barely too long hairs. I used some of that feedback to trim each of those with the clipper and then shave them. after a couple days, no stray long hairs.
  367. Well, after finally deciding to get a new Braun shaver I ended up settling with the Cooltec. SO on to my thoughts the thing that sold me was the cooling feature which I do like. The mediocre about the Cooltec would be the shave I would give a &#34;meh&#34; as in it has troubles along the jaw line and the pop up trimmer seems to do nothing?   368. I'm new to electric shavers after nearly 30 years of shaving with various Gillette blades. The blades just got to be annoyingly expensive, so I thought I'd give electric a try. I've been at it two months, and I have a few thoughts.<br /><br />* The cooltec feature works well. I haven't had a hint of razor burn. It actually feels nice to shave. I couldn't be more pleased with that feature. My skin seems healthier. I can't really quantify that, but it seems that way.<br /><br />* The shave isn't nearly as close as a razor. Nor is it faster. It's slower and not as good of a shave. I have never had 5 o-clock shadow, but I have it now. I also found like a half inch whisker on my neck that I had apparently missed. No amount of angling would shave it, so I had to break out the razor.<br /><br />So it's a comfortable, less-expensive (in the long run), slower, not quite as close shave. Meh... it's ok.   369. I was provided this shaver by Braun to test in early November and have been using now for 2 months. I really like the performance of the shaver and the resulting smooth skin. Not a fault of the shaver but more due to my skin/hair I shaved twice a day (morning and evening) to keep from needing to &#34;touch-up&#34; with a regular razor. Comparatively this razor shaved to a much smoother level than other shavers I've used in the past.<br /><br />The shaver charge lasted nearly 7 days using the CoolTec functionality for all the shaves. If travelling for extended time without ability to charge you could eek out a few more days if you turned off the CoolTec.<br /><br />The travel charger worked pretty good, but the kit I received only had 1 power cable that had to be shared between the travel charging sled and the cleaning/charging base.<br /><br />The cleaning /charging base did an excellent job of cleaning, far superior to rinsing with water alone. There is a slight oddity in that Braun has designed this with the shaver at an angle when cleaning/charging (I believe to allow for the cleaning solution to drain from the shaver more efficiently) that does mean you may have to occasionally reposition the shaver to get the shaver charging. This is not a big deal, just something you have to be conscience of.<br /><br />Overall I really like this shaver and will continue to use it.
  370. What a great shaver!<br /><br />The cool technology is great and helps with the irritation that shaving always brings. I love the ability to clean the shaver at the push of a button.<br /><br />The travel case is great and I use it a lot as I often stay overnight at my job.<br /><br />Love it.
  371. I received the Braun CoolTec system to try out as part of a Bzz Campaign. I love Braun and I was so excited to be able to test this razor. After using it for almost a month, I must say I have very mixed feelings about this razor.<br /><br />First the positives...the razor looks cool and is totally comfortable to hold an maneuver while shaving. While I was skeptical of the CoolTec aluminum cooling bar, it is one of my favorite features. This bar, placed between the foil blades, instantly cools to around 40 degrees, giving a cooling sensation to the skin as you shave. It is really a unique feeling and seems to significantly cut down or eliminate the power razor skin irritation/burn. I also love the cleaning and recharging station. When you are finished shaving, you set the razor in the station, push a button, and in 3 minutes the razor is clean, lubricated, charged and ready for the next shave. For these reasons alone (cooling bar and cleaning station) I gave it 4 stars. However...<br /><br />The negatives...this razor sounds like a lawnmower. It is so loud that I won't use it early in the morning for fear that I will wake up my wife. Also, I found that the trimmer was almost unusable. It is on the back side of the razor, and when deployed, it stays concealed behind the razor as you try to use it. I wish the placement had been different as I found I was switching to a different razor to trim my moustache, sideburns, etc.<br /><br />But the biggest thing to me is: How did is shave? And I must say this was the most disappointing thing about this razor. Don't get me wrong...it shaves. But it does not give a close shave. If you like that still rough/stubbly feeling...this is your razor. If you like that clean smooth feeling...this is not for you. I tried up and down, backward and forward, with the whiskers and against the whiskers, shaving and re-shaving...but I was never able to get a close smooth shave.<br /><br />I almost gave this razor 3 stars. But because its a Braun, and it does have some cool features (pun intended), I like it....i just don't love it.
  372. I've had many electric razors in the past (including older Braun models) so when I received the CoolTec as part of a marketing campaign from Braun I was a bit skeptical. I have Very coarse beard hair and sensitive skin so I usually end up going back to clippers pretty quick after trying a razor, and just forgetting about a close shave.<br /><br />I opened my CoolTec at the end of Movember so I had a pretty dense forest of hair on my face. Trimmed down with some clippers, and then gave the razor a try. I was able to shave my entire face in a quarter of the time it took with my old Braun razor (less passes), and even after not shaving in over a month my skin wasn't really irritated. I could actually feel the cooling bar on my neck so I know it wasn't just a gimmick.<br /><br />The other plus for the CoolTec is the self cleaning base. With my thicker beard hair I've become accustomed to having to clear the blades of manual razors after every stroke. The CoolTec didn't clog or bog down at all, and after the self cleaning cycle the blades were complete clear.<br /><br />The only downside I've seen to the CoolTec is that it doesn't handle hair with any amount of length. I can't really hold this against it though since no other razor I've seen can handle longer hair (1/8th - 1/4 inch) with any competency. So if you let your hair go more than a few days/week I would suggest going over it with some clippers first. After than the CoolTech will give you one of the smoothest shaves you've ever had.

However, I think it's dumb that they force you to spend money every few months replacing the cleaning system fluid. The shaver feels too cold to the touch, and maybe I can't figure out the correct way to use it, but it feels very awkward to use, and doesn't give a close shave.   375. I've been using this e-razor for just over a month now. Braun sent this to me to test out and give an honest review on it.<br /><br />I felt like one needed a degree in aeronautical engineering to operate this when I first opened it up. WOW at the stuff! WOW at the reading material! Once you start looking over everything though it began to make sense, and was rather easy to work with.<br /><br />Let's start of with what it has:<br />Counter station- This thing is nice. Kinda big, but it's easy to use. It's got a cleaner built into it, which does rather good. The cleaner is a bit noisy though. Charging is easy, just drop it in and press. A beep will let you know it's charging. I have yet to test out the battery life as I charge it every time that I use it. It has a cleaning fluid reservoir that needs to be changed every so often (I have yet to change mine). The buttons are easy, the readouts are simple.<br /><br />Accessories- Brush: simple, brush, works. Case: Form fitting, tough. Another plastic holder type thing: I think it's used for just setting your e-razor on the counter.<br /><br />So now to the razor itself. Dual wide heads do a good job of shaving. I'm personally a fan of the regular razor and cream but it eats my face up if done to often. The electric razors help to keep a smooth looking face and no burn. Blades are suppose to last a long time (2 years I think?), 1 month in for me and they are staying strong. I've tested this out with a variety of stubble from the 5 o'clock shadow to a few days worth of growth. It does well with both, but too long and I'm sure it wouldn't work to well (numerous days). I never really got that tugging/pulling feeling with this razor (think hair plucking), so props to it on that.<br /><br />Cleaning of this razor is easy, just slide off the blue sleeve remove the heads, shake over a can, and it's clean! Touch up with a brush if needed. The base/stand does a great final job of cleaning.<br /><br />Nextis the cooling strip. That's what the big hype about this is, the cooling strip. No razor burn, feels fresh, cool, light. Well yeah, it does. Run it for a minute or two then touch it with your finger, it's freezing! I personally never really got razor burn with an electric shaver, so this was kinda....pointless for me. Did it feel neat? Sure. If I had sunburn on my face, it would feel great.<br /><br />Overall: I liked this razor, but I can't justify the price of it for that &#34;cool&#34; cooltec strip. Other people here might need it, if so, it is cool (literally, cold). It did a good job with making your face look clean shaven, but a swipe of the hand told me it was just short enough not to really see (I like my face baby smooth after a shave, like slick, straight razor hot towel kinda smooth). I have other brands of e-razors and they do a bit better job then this. I would personally recommend looking at other brands for a razor first. If others fail you, then fall back on this one (after all it did do it's job in the end, just not for the price).

  383. I received the 5cc model from a program run by Braun. It's certainly a high-tech well manufactured piece of equipment and is extremely comfortable to hold, use and shave with. I keep having to clean up with a cartridge razor to get an actual good shave out of the device.
