  385. (You can skip to the cons below): I have been using rotary shavers (Norelco) for 25+ years. I just bought myself a new norelco a few months ago because I thought I broke my previous one. Disappointed to see the newer one did not cut as close, fixed my old one and used the new one as back-up. My wife bought me this Braun as a gift, not realizing my history with lift and cut razors or that I had just spent money on a new one that I was keeping at work as a back-up. I had a Braun foil razor like this one 20 years ago and stopped using it for the same reasons I will cite here. I guess I was hoping technology would have improved these razors over the years and I was hoping I would be getting something better than I had, but:<br /><br />-Noticeably way LOUDER than my Norelco three head shaver both when shaving and using the trimmer. I close the bathroom door lest I wake up other people in the house in the AM.<br />-Trimmer sucks. Odd curve to it and small shave head make it difficult to do a straight trim on sideburns<br />-Shave is inferior/inconsistent. Not close. Leaves &#34;dots&#34; of hair and you can feel patches in your face that you just can't get smooth out with the shaver.<br />-Horrible on the neck area. Can't get under and just below the jawline on the neck. Can always feel/see stubble there. just doesn't cut it.<br />-Takes me 3x as long to achieve an inferior shave over the Norelco<br />-Cool-Tec button is in a bad spot. I consistently accidentally hit the button while shaving, turning it on needlessly. I gave up on turning it off and just leave it on, resulting in it going on and off throughout my shave when I hit the button.<br />-The cleaner/charger port is HUGE, takes up a lot of counter space.<br />-Travel charger is a &#34;cradle&#34; that you can only use if it is laying flat, taking up more room. Also, it is touchy, and the razor does not secure or snap in place, so any minor bump will knock it out of &#34;charge&#34; mode. Ask me howmany times my wife's hair dryer or curling iron have knocked it out of charge mode!<br /><br />You can press as hard as you want, go against the grain, etc., but I can't get a close shave with this.<br /><br />The cleaning system is a nice gimmick, but not necessary or worth the expense of having to buy replacement cartridges of solution. I used it once and noticed that it vibrated itself off of the charge &#34;nipples&#34; so that after cleaning it sat in the dock all night not charging because it wasn't making contact. A brush and some rubbing alcohol and about 1 minute of your time will clean this. The Cool-Tec feature is also a gimmick. It does noticeably emit a cooling sensation, but as the manual will tell you, using this feature makes the battery drain quicker. I would never buy a razor with features like this, I think it's silly and a way for the manufacturer to jack up the price. I mean seriously, when all said and done, this is a $20 razor!<br /><br />Bottom line, this is a don't buy. Maybe these style shavers work for some guys, but for me, a high quality 3 head lift and cut would be my second choice (old school lather and blade razor my first if I had the time). Oh and ladies: I don't care how well you think you know your man, electric shavers are one of those things you should not give as gifts!!!
  386. It's not what I was expecting but it's ok!
  387. In my 25 years of shaving, I've seen a lot of gimmicks come and go and most of them really didn't add anything to the shave. Braun's CoolTec is different.<br /><br />For the past year I have been dry shaving with the highly rated top-of-the line Norelco Sensotouch 3D 1080x and I have never really been satisfied with it, especially for the price. The shave has never been very close, and I found the rotary heads somewhat irritating. By chance one day I came across the Braun CoolTec shaver in a local big-box store and was instantly intrigued by the active cooling technology. I really didn't want to drop the cash on another high-end shaver after investing in the Norelco but the CoolTec was just calling to me. A few days later I found it on sale at a good price and bought it on impulse, fully expecting another gimmicky razor with a mediocre shave that would be returned shortly thereafter. Boy, was I wrong. From the first shave I found it faster, closer and definitely more comfortable than the Norelco.<br /><br />In the box you'll find the razor, cleaning station, power cord, zippered travel case, charging cradle, one Clean and Renew cartridge, cleaning brush and manual.<br /><br />The cooling bar really does cut down on irritation and just plain feels good on the skin. It's hard to describe the sensation...it's not ice-cold, but it's like rubbing a cold spoon on your face. It does take a few seconds for it to reach maximum coldness so I start with my cheeks before moving to the more sensitive areas on the neck. It should be noted that using the CoolTec feature does cut down on battery life, but if you recharge after frequently it's really not an issue. Pushing the \\"snowflake\\" button toggles it on and off, and I like that the razor remembers this setting when you turn it off. After shaving with the CoolTec feature, I honestly feel like I don't even need aftershave balm.<br /><br />The only other button is the power button, which also glows to indicate the battery level. Green when it's full, red when it's getting low. There is also an LED indicator that lights when the razor needs cleaning, and another that tells you when it's travel locked. Fit and finish are excellent, and the lacquer finish is very nice (I got the blue version). The razor is a bit on the large size, but feels very good in the hand. Unlike other reviewers, I don't find that I need too many passes for a good shave, a lot fewer than the Norelco in fact. I also owned a Panasonic Arc 4 before the Norelco, and I would say the Braun CoolTec shaves nearly on par with the Panasonic and much closer than the Norelco. Having said that, keep in mind that every guy's beard is different and your mileage may vary.<br /><br />I haven't used the pop-up trimmer very much yet, but it gets the job done. Again, much better than the tiny slide-out trimmer on the Norelco. This shaver is also waterproof, so you can use it in the shower if you like. I prefer to shave dry before showering.<br /><br />The cleaning station works well and leaves the razor with a fresh, clean scent. I really like that there is a soft \\"beep\\" sound that lets you know the razor is properly seated in the base. I have heard others complain about the cost of refills, but each refill is only about $5-$6 and lasts a month or more. For me, around a buck a week is a small price to pay for a clean, sanitized razor every day. Not to mention it also lubricates the blades which makes them last longer. Speaking of blades, the replacement cartridge for the razor is quite a bit cheaper than the Sensotouch 3D replacement and is rated to last 18 months rather than 12.<br /><br />This razor may not have all the bells and whistles of the 790cc or Sensotouch 3D 1080x models, but I have finally come to the realization that I don't need those...all I really need is a great shave and the CoolTec delivers.reen when it's full, red when it's getting low. There is also an LED indicator that lights when the razor needs cleaning, and another that tells you when it's travel locked. Fit and finish are excellent, and the lacquer finish is very nice (I got the blue version). The razor is a bit on the large size, but feels very good in the hand. Unlike other reviewers, I don't find that I need too many passes for a good shave, a lot fewer than the Norelco in fact. I also owned a Panasonic Arc 4 before the Norelco, and I would say the Braun CoolTec shaves nearly on par with the Panasonic and much closer than the Norelco. Having said that, keep in mind that every guy's beard is different and your mileage may vary.<br /><br />I haven't used the pop-up trimmer very much yet, but it gets the job done. Again, much better than the tiny slide-out trimmer on the Norelco. This shaver is also waterproof, so you can use it in the shower if you like. I prefer to shave dry before showering.<br /><br />The cleaning station works well and leaves the razor with a fresh, clean scent. I really like that there is a soft \\"beep\\" sound that lets you know the razor is properly seated in the base. I have heard others complain about the cost of refills, but each refill is only about $5-$6 and lasts a month or more. For me, around a buck a week is a small price to pay for a clean, sanitized razor every day. Not to mention it also lubricates the blades which makes them last longer. Speaking of blades, the replacement cartridge for the razor is quite a bit cheaper than the Sensotouch 3D replacement and is rated to last 18 months rather than 12.<br /><br />This razor may not have all the bells and whistles of the 790cc or Sensotouch 3D 1080x models, but I have finally come to the realization that I don't need those...all I really need is a great shave and the CoolTec delivers.
  388. I rated this 3 starts based on the product alone.<br />I just switch to braun after reading in consumer report that it was the best line for shavers. Before this I had a norelco for 10 years, when it kicked the bucket, I decided to try braun. I was hesitate because I wonder how a electric razor with a straight cutting method would work around the adams apple.<br /><br />Before I continue let me say that, I work in the spa industry and am fully aware of all thing steps need before shaving, I am a mix race hispanic/african american male with, medium course hair. This is also where the cooling back comes to play, it helps relieve the sooth the skin for irritation.   389. I've tried many electric shavers in the past, and honestly I've never been impressed with any of them. Then along comes the Braun CoolTec shaver with active cooling technology! A little pricey on the front end, but hey, you get what you pay for!<br /><br />I've now been using my Cooltec daily for 3 weeks and I love it! Zero discomfort issues, no razor burn whatsoever, and I get a comfortable close shave every time. A little difficult around the base of the neck, but otherwise amazing!
  390. I just received my cooltec shaver from Braun through a special program and was instantly impressed by the look and feel of the shaver. The cooltec comes with a clean and charge base and a smaller charging stand. After setting everything up it didn't take long for it to charge at all. During my first shave I noticed it didn't cut as closely as I would have liked on the first or second pass over my skin but after working it around for awhile I got the desired result of a smooth shave. I was impressed with the cooling feature as it actually felt really good on my skin and boy did it get cold. As promised I felt less skin irritation after using the cooltec shaver. I'm hoping that with time I'll get a closer shave on just one pass, but the cooling feature makes this shaver worth a try for anyone that suffers from skin irritation after using electric shavers.
  391. When I received my Braun CoolTec System (provided via a program run by Braun), I was very excited. I've never been an electric razor guy but I was excited to see how this worked.<br /><br />First off, let me say that I've stuck to disposable razors over the years because every experience I've had with electric razors have really burned. I have very sensitive skin. But this looked promising!<br /><br />My first impression was that there were a lot of pieces. Most very big and bulky. There's also a warning on the box about flammable liquid. There's a little assembly required and the fear of starting a fire loomed but I pressed on. I got everything together and started the charge. It takes about 45 minutes and is surprisingly loud.<br /><br />Once completed, I was ready to give it a try. The razor itself is rather large but easy to use. It comes with a carrying case and travel charger but, for me, it's a little too big to travel with. The cooling effect is great and I'm happy to say that it did not burn my skin at all (and I've used it a few times). Here's the bad part though. I haven't been able to find a way to only run the razor over my skin once. There's a lot of going over the same spots over and over again to get all the hair. And I had to do a lot of skin stretching as well. So it takes a significant amount of time more to shave than with a disposable.<br /><br />Conclusion - Although it takes me more time, I do get a very close shave with no burn and that's important. Would I be willing to switch and give up my disposable? Not yet but I'm not giving up on the Braun CoolTec System either.
  392. Braun let me try this razor out. And here are my findings. Over the years I have gave electric razors chances. I mean the idea of being able to shave without using water and shaving cream sounds good. Especially if you are on the go or in a hurry. Being a person of very sensitive skin I never quite found one that really didn't irritate me and leave me looking and feeling like I had hives. Sadly, this one isn't much better. The cooling effect can really be felt and while you are shaving it puts you under the notion that you aren't irritated but as soon as you are done the itch and redness come back. One thing I always took as a truth was the more hot the skin was the better a shave you could get. The pores would open and thus allowing more hair to protrude giving you a better shave. The cooling bar kinda defeats that. They're getting better, but not quite there yet.
  393. I was fortunate to receive this item via a program with Braun. The shave itself is excellent. My face grows very thickly, and the hair grows in more than one direction. The concept made sense, but I didn't expect it to feel this much better. I think the Braun team should drill down and share the science behind the cool... why it works... with consumers. All I know is that it does work, and works well.

I enjoy the cooling sensation but sometimes I feel that it be a little too cool for just getting out of a hot shower. Lastly, being fully waterproof is a huge plus that I honestly didn't expect. It makes cleaning a breeze and overall allows the whole experience to be worry free. Great product that I would recommend to any plastic razor user! Thanks Braun!

  398. I had not used an electric shaver for many years, so perhaps I expected too much. I had an opportunity to try a electric shaver with the Braun ¬∞CoolTec System via a program run by Braun.   400. I recently received a Braun CoolTec System electric razor via a review program run by Braun. I have been using electric razors for about 15 years now, but I have only owned Norelco razors, so I was interested to try out a new brand to compare.<br /><br />I have only been using the razor for a week, so this review will be focused on my initial impressions. I'll update my review in a few weeks after I have used it more.<br /><br />I have to say that the unboxing of the razor was a delight. It was immediately evident that the manufacturer has observed problems with other razors and has systematically attempted to solve them.<br /><br />First and foremost - it came with a travel charger! It's a small thing, but these razors with base stations can be tricky. For the last few years I have used a Norelco system that has a base charging and cleaning station. When I go on longer trips, I cannot use my razor as there is no way to charge it without bringing the base station, which I would never do. This Braum system has a base station, but also a small travel charger, so I can bring it with me wherever I go. I am currently on a three week trip, so I'm excited to see how it goes.<br /><br />Second, the base station is smartly designed. I noticed this out of the box because the instructions said to fully charge the razor before using it. My old razor's base station had a motor that dropped and raised the razor into the cleaning solution, which was loud and annoying. I usually charge the razor on Sunday nights so it's ready Monday morning for the week. I have to remember to do it well before bed time, because my wife can hear it even through the closed bathroom door, and if the door is open the bright flashing light bothers her too, so it needs to be done before we go to sleep. This base station doesn't have the loud moving parts, and it doesn't have bright flashing lights. Also, the cleaning solution comes in a cartridge that is supposed to last quite a while - no more buying new cleaning solution every month (bye bye recurring order on Amazon)!<br /><br />Third, the razor came with a nice little soft-covered hardshell case for travel. The razor also locks for travel, so it won't turn on in my bag and run out of batteries on the plane or freak out a TSA agent. I have arrived at a destination with a dead razor more than once. Thank you Braum for considering us travelers!!<br /><br />The only negative comment I have about the unboxing was that the instructions weren't super clear. They were typical old-school folded paper instructions with multiple languages and minimal graphics. A razor is pretty intuitive, but it would have been nice to see clearer instructions on connecting the cleaning solution cartridge, using the travel charger, and manual cleaning. Maybe a quick start guide with color pictures/illustrations.<br /><br />Now on to using the razor:<br /><br />I actually left for a long trip the day after I received it, so I have been using it from hotels on the road. I have now tried it at the sink wet with shaving cream, in the shower with shaving cream, and dry.<br /><br />Dry was definitely not a good shave for me, and it left my skin irritated. At the sink was fine, but still a bit irritating. In the shower the shave was great. It was smooth and painless. I felt like this razor moves over my thick stubble around my chin much easier than other razors.<br /><br />It is taking some getting used to having a razor that moves in two directions rather than any direction like the Norelco heads. This also makes shaving right under my nose more difficult. I think I'll have a better sense for this in a few weeks, so I don't want to comment more than my initial impression here.<br /><br />The cooling bar is AWESOME. What a great idea. I have very sensitive skin, and very thick stubble. That cooling bar just feels so good. Even though it eats up the battery much faster, I can't imagine that I will ever turn it off.<br /><br />So, so far I love the razor. It solves multiple problems, especially for frequent travelers and those with sensitive skin. I look forward to using it over the coming weeks and giving a more in-depth review of actual use.<br /><br />Edit, 45 days later:<br />I am still enjoying this razor after almost two months. It doesn't provide as close of a shave as a non-electric razor, but it shaves as close as any other electric razor I have owned in the past. I will be keeping this razor and getting rid of my Norelco. As mentioned previously, it is a pleasure to travel with, especially in comparison to razors I previously used. It is also much easier to clean.
  401. I got a chance to use the new Braun CoolTec System provided via a program run by Braun.   404. Disclaimer: I received the Braun CoolTec System via a program run by Braun.<br /><br />Cooling Bar:<br />The Braun CoolTec Shaver includes a cooling bar on the shaver that is supposed to help reduce skin irritation while shaving. Upon turning on the shaver and applying it to my face, I did not notice a significant amount of cooling on my face. However, after shaving for about a minute I noticed a cooling sensation on my face where I was shaving. At first, this sensation felt different on my face but I immediately got used to it and it felt great on my face. You have the ability to turn off the cooling bar while shaving if you do not like the feeling of it, but I really liked it.<br /><br />Skin Irritation:<br />While shaving my face using the CoolTec shaver, I felt no discomfort or irritation. When I was done shaving my face, I felt a very little irritation on the lower-right portion of my face. However, this irritation lasted only about a minute and I did not feel any irritation after that. My face did not get red in any areas and I have yet to feel any itchiness or irritation since. This was great for me because I usually shy away from electric razors as they really irritate my skin during and after my shave.<br /><br />Closeness of Shave:<br />Another reason I normally do not use electric razors is because they rawly get a close enough shave for my liking. The Braun CoolTec razor definitely surprised me by providing a very consistent and close shave on my face and neck. I felt my face in both directions after completing my shave and it was a very similar result as I get from using a manual razor.<br /><br />Clean & Charge Station:<br />The Clean & Charge Station that is included with the Braun CoolTec System was a very nice addition as it can get very old having to clean out all the little areas that fill with hair in an electric shaver. I use the cleaning station after immediately after every shave and find it does an excellent job at removing hair from the razor and keeping it very clean and sanitary.<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />In conclusion, I am very impressed by the Braun CoolTec System and would definitely recommend this to a family member or friend looking at getting a new razor. This shaver also drastically improved my opinion of electric shavers and how much technology has been improved to alleviate irritation while getting a nice, close shave.<br /><br />Positives:<br />Very little to no skin irritation<br />Very close shave<br />Cleaning station<br />Attractive<br /><br />Negatives:<br />A little bulky<br />Takes a little longer than manual razors

  409. I had been on a long hiatus from my last electric shaver for a handful of years and have been using a Gillette Fusion handle with replaceable blades. So, I decided to look into a more long term solution and when the opportunity came up to try the Braun CoolTec System through a program rub by Braun, I took a chance and said goodbye to my manual shaver. I had been trying to use the last dull blade as long as I could and literally it took twice as long to shave my beard.<br /><br />When I started about a month ago, I was in the thick of Movember and keeping my beard under control while unleashing my Mo' was priority number one. You'll have to be willing to go over those areas around the edges of your sideburns and facial hair (ie moustaches, goatees) several times and when you are first starting you may find a few straggling hairs. You may think that this takes longer, but you are saving time cleaning your blade and applying shaving cream/aftershave. The first time, I used it I did not know what to think about the cooling bar and I could not feel it right away, but once it kicked in it really felt nice and cool. I'm used to that feeling of scraping my face while shaving, but I hardly notice anything with this shaver. While using the system, I have not experienced any clogging while getting the same close shave I did from my previous razor. It may take a few more passes on my face, but I never have to stop and clean it off. When I am done, I like the option of either manually cleaning the shaver with tap water or using the Clean&Charge station. I was caught off guard with how much little bits of facial hair is left behindin the hub and all I had to do was press a button. That is super convenient, but there is still a little clean up if you want to remove that hair.<br /><br />It takes some practice and you need to counter space to set up the Clean&Charge station, but my face is just as smooth as when I used my Gillette razor and I have not had any cuts or irritation since I started using it. I'd definitely recommend that others use this system with the knowledge that it is a transition if you have not used an electric shaver before. But the Braun CoolTec System is definitely Cooler than expected and I am not just talking about the cooling bar.

  420. This is a cool idea for an electric shaver. I have issues with this system actually trimming all of my facial hair which is typically just stubble (I do not have a beard or goatee) my neck and chin are the most difficult areas to shave (I still have to go back when done and use a disposable razor to shave the strays left behind.<br /><br />I have to start the cooling liquid application to the razor before I get in the shower as it takes a few minutes and it runs multiple cycles which is also a bit annoying.<br /><br />The plug for the base charger for the razor does not actually firmly fit, it is extremely loose and falls out upon touching the cord or base.<br /><br />I received this Braun CoolTec system through a promotion from Braun and I am great-full for the opportunity to try and use this however I am disappointed in what I received. I would defiantly not pay for this system. So although I wouldn't purchase this for others of you it might be something that is right up your alley, I am just not a fan of electric razors and this did not sway me to start liking them.
  421. I used the razor four times before I came back to write a review because I wanted to give it a fair go. I‚Äôve always been a cartridge razor user because I‚Äôve never had a clean shave using anything else due to thick facial hair. I also have sensitive skin, so I was excited for the CoolTec experience. I‚Äôll start with that; the CoolTec strip is as advertised. It made a very noticeable difference during my shave and I had no skin irritation when I was done. I do have to wonder though if part of the reason for the lack of irritation was the lack of a close shave.<br /><br />On my cheeks, the razor worked well, but as soon as I moved below my jaw-line, the razor struggled to get close. I know that I‚Äôm not going to get anywhere near a cartridge razor shave with an electric, but this wasn‚Äôt close to acceptable. Even against the grain, the shave was very uneven and patchy, to the point where I had to shave with my old razor when finished to even things out. The attached trimmer tool was also not strong enough to make much of a difference.<br /><br />The cleaning and charging station is very nice. It‚Äôs not so big that it takes over my sink space, but the foil and blades come out like new each time. When it‚Äôs not due for a cleaning, the charging station is even smaller and very manageable.<br /><br />Unfortunately, the only thing I wasn‚Äôt happy with was the shave, which doesn‚Äôt bode well for a razor. For someone with thinner hair, this might work well for you.
  422. I received the CoolTec razor through a promotion run by Braun. I've been a Series 7 user for a few years now (I use a cartridge razor about 70% of the time - shaving daily), and have always been pleased with that product. The CoolTec is different in a few ways. Obviously, the latest innovation is the cool bar on the razor head. I actually really enjoy the bar, as it makes my face feel wet, like with a cartridge razor, as I shave. On my face, the razor works great and provides a shave comparable to the Series 7 and a cartridge. I will say I use a cartridge most of the time, because I have a heavy beard, and a cartridge has always been far superior in providing a close shave on my neck without causing irritation. The Series 7 is the best electric razor I've used on my neck, but still falls short of matching a cartridge. The CoolTec razor lags behind the Series 7 in this key area, as it takes a number of passes from different angles to get a close shave on my neck. Overall, I think the CoolTec system would be great for someone without a very heavy beard like me, as the cool bar technology provides a very positive improvement to the typical electric shave. The charging station is very nice looking, and much better looking than my Series 7 unit. The travel case for the razor is also a big upgrade over the Series 7. The only other problem with this razor is the plug on the back of the cleaning station. For some reason, I'm not sure if my unit is typical, the plug just does not fit very snugly into the base. I have had the plug fall out a couple of times with little to no movement. That said, I have gotten the plug to stay for the most part, and that quirk has not damaged my positive experience with this razor!

The &#34;cooling&#34; has prevented any irritation and the cleaning process is top notch.<br /><br />Now, I not only feel good after a shave, but I get a good shave and actually use a perfectly cleaned shaving system.   424. I have had terrible experiences with electric razors in the past, so if it hadn't been for a promotional program from Braun I wouldn't have tried this razor. The primary issue I've had with electric razors in the past was extreme irritation. From my first use, I noticed that the irritation was minimal and it has only improved. The cooling bar is a nice touch, and does seem to improve the overall experience. As long as I shave everyday, this razor seems to provide a pretty close shave in minimal time. However, when I let my hair grow for 2 days or more the growth seems to be more than this razor can handle in a reasonable amount of time...and I don't grow facial hair exceptionally fast. I went 3 days without shaving, and it took me about 15 minutes to complete my shave...and after all this, there were several patches that the razor couldn't pick up for some reason. I tried every direction with different pressures to no avail. Final negative is that my razor's cleaning indicator comes on after every use. This may be normal, but I see cleaning cartridge refills substantially adding to the cost over time. I am happy enough with the overall experience that I cancelled my weekly delivery service for disposable razors, but if I had paid ~$200 for this system I would be a little disappointed.
  425. I received the Braun CoolTec System through a program with Braun after having used the Panasonic ES-LA93 for a few months.<br /><br />Let me start off by saying that for the previous decade, I had been a loyal Braun user ‚Äì first the predecessor to their 500 series and then the 790 series until just this year. While those Braun shavers worked well, they had weak points that kept failing ‚Äì the cleaning system broke several times, the foils would tear easily (I have thick beard hair), and then the plastic would deteriorate around the head of the shaver, eventually causing the entire shaver to fail. So I switched to Panasonic ‚Äì and was willing to give this new Braun CoolTec a try to see if they‚Äôd come up with something more durable and consistent.<br />Initial impressions: the Cooltec shaver is beefy but quite ergonomic and easily to hold while shaving. Its head does not swivel (which is a downside as discussed later), but it is quite easily to manipulate up and down the face and into those nooks and crannies. The ‚Äúcooling‚Äù bar is nice, and when you first turn it on and it starts to get frigid, it does make your face feel quite ‚Äúrefreshed‚Äù.<br /><br />But how does it shave?: I tried the Cooltec as my daily shaver for three weeks. It does not pull or cause irritation, and it is quite nice to have that cooling bar go over the freshly shaved areas. That said, I have to go over those areas several times to catch all the escapee beard hairs and find myself putting a lot of pressure on the shaver ‚Äì so I am not sure if the foil will last as long as it otherwise would. It does the job, though certainly not as close and clean of a shave as the old Braun 790 or the new Panasonic. The reason: the head does not swivel so it misses those hairs that point in weird directions and you have to change the plane of your shaving frequently in order to get those stubborn whiskers.<br />The cleaning system is nicer than the run-of-the-mill Braun, quieter, and faster. The shaver is also washable (though not a wet shaver), so you can get it clean pretty easily and only use the cleaning system once in a while (those solution packages are expensive!).<br /><br />Overall impression: The shaver is good ‚Äì certainly worth the lower price that Braun charges, and I‚Äôd say a better value than their top of the line 700 series. And it appears, at least initially, the shaver is better put together and more durable (we‚Äôll see how long the ‚Äúcooling‚Äù bar lasts). But, it is a shaver that is mid-range when it comes to a close, clean shave. I‚Äôve returned to my Panasonic LA93 as its much smoother and is a wet shaver for those long mornings when I am too lazy or just want to multitask in the shower. But I will use this Cooltec as my travel shaver as its much more compact, certainly good enough as a daily shaver, and ‚Äì since I fall for almost every gimmick ‚Äì has a cool bar that makes my face feel nice in the morning.<br /><br />Will update if any problems arise‚Ä¶.

It's not too bulky and it's easy to use.<br />The travel case and charger are also a nice touch. It uses the same charger as the base unit so no extra wires/cords to keep up with.<br />They are also sturdy and of good quality.<br />The cleaning pack solutions last a pretty reasonable time and refills are not to pricey.<br /><br />The Not So Cool Stuff:<br /><br />The CoolTec didn't cut as good as I wanted it to. I went in all directions. I tried both wet and dry shaving and I was a bit disappointed. Granted, I have thick facial hair, and it cut some, but nowhere near the close shave that I was hoping for.<br /><br />Should you buy?<br /><br />If you have been using electric shavers over the years and they have worked well on your face, then I would recommend the CoolTec by Bruan. The CoolTec shaver has a nice quality build, it's easy to use and clean, and the travel accessories are perfect.<br /><br />However, if you have thick or coarse facial hair, then you may want to research some other electric shavers as this one didn't do well on my face.   430. First off, I'm a part-time early adopter. Sometimes I'm cutting edge (pun intended), other times I'm a bit behind the curve. I had a chance to try out this electric razor as part of a Braun program and was fairly pleased with the results.<br /><br />I've been around the block with razors, with everything from disposable to battery-powered expensive razors, to electric razors. With the CoolTec razor, I certainly FEEL like this thing is from the future...maybe from the set of Demolition Man, right next to the 3 shells.<br /><br />As a razor, it does its job. Keeping in mind you'll NEVER get as close a shave as with a regular razor, it does a fairly good job for an electric. It's a little tough to get all the last stubble on the neck, but no better/worse than other models for that. The rest of your face will be a piece of cake.<br /><br />The cooling bar is nice. I say &#34;nice&#34; because I've never had an issue with razor irritation, so I can't say if it helps. It is refreshing to have that coolness while you're shaving, and there's a bonus on/off switch to turn off the cooling if you're trying to save battery.<br /><br />The base, for me, is probably the coolest thing about the system. When you're done shaving, put the razor in there and hit a button. It'll whirr and buzz a bit for about 5 minutes, but when you use the razor the next morning, it feels as new as the first time you fired it up. You can pop the top off the razor and see for yourself that the cleaning works. If you're on the fence about this model, the base might tip you over- it's definitely a &#34;plus.&#34; Of course, the necessary &#34;minus&#34; is that you'll have to buy refills of the cleaning compartments, which adds up over the life of the product. You could skip the fluid, clean it yourself, and save some money, but then you won't feel like much of an early adopter, now will you?<br /><br />In all, no complaints about this razor. It works, feels nice, and the base keeps the razor clean and lubricated for you every morning. I've only had this about a month, but this thing feels sturdy enough to last you a long time.

  432. First thing's first. I received this shaver for free to write my review of the product. There are several things I like about the shaver and the items it is packaged with: holder/charger/cleaner unit, small brush, cleaning solution, cradle, travel case.<br /><br />Travel case is handy and well made. The small brush is useful to get the small bits of hair out of the shaver mechanism. Not sure that the cradle will be used much, just put the shaver in the charger/cleaner or the travel case and be done with it.<br /><br />The unit charges quickly. The hair trimmer on the back side of the shaver is a nice touch. It is made of a non-slick material so you can easily push the trimmer up and lock in place. When the cooltec is activated by the &#34;chill&#34; button, it does feel really nice. The &#34;chill&#34; can be turned on or off to your preference. The shave resulted in a little irritation on the side of the neck but was not too bad. The shaver can be charged in the same unit that cleans it. The cleaning solution is touted to be more hygenic than just rinsing with water. Don't know but being able to clean while charging is nice. When plugging the cord to the charger/cleaner unit, the plug did not seem to be very securely attached but it charged just fine.<br /><br />To clean the foils, the top of the shaver comes right off to allow you to clean the hair out of the mechanism easily. The shaver has some heft to it and seems to be solidly made. All in all a good shaver. However, I just can't get the same shave that I can with a regular razor. When I shave with an electric, there are always spots of small stubble left. Probably not the fault of this shaver, since this happens with any electric razor I use. I still prefer a regular razor.

  450. As a fan of electric razors (the convenience of being able to quickly shave for those mornings when you just don't have time to shave with a regular razor), I have found that many times I'm forced to shave my neck area first, then my face due to the skin irritation I received from an electric razor that quickly warms up after only 20 seconds of use. That was until I tried the Braun CoolTec System. This new razor allows me to freely shave my face and neck without having to worry about the red streaks of skin irritation from a warm razor surface. The CoolTec electric razor has a cooling area between the blades that is very cool to the touch and gives a soothing sense as the razor glides over my skin.<br /><br />I've also found that the Braun CoolTec doesn't leave the microscopic hairs all over the sink after a shave either. The self cleaning dock does the work that I often times found messy to do myself and ensures that I'm getting the closest shave possible with a cleaned razor.<br /><br />Braun heard the cries of my irritated skin and provided me with the CoolTec to try for myself through their program to help guys just like me. Because of the new CoolTec razor, I can leave for work in the morning knowing that I don't have those red streaks to hide on my neck nor do I have to explain how they got there.
  451. I normally use just regular disposable shavers, and although im not a huge fan of electric shavers, I was excited to try the new Braun CoolTec Shaver. I was lucky enough to receive one via a program run by Braun. Watching the adds for it, and reading what it can do, it sounds like a pretty awesome product. But unfortunately I found in practice its pretty lack luster. Its simple enough to set up/clean/use and what not. But for actual shaving. It just doesnt work particularly well. Letting your beard grow for anymore then 3-4 days and your pushing it as it just has trouble handling it. As a matter of fact I actually thought that perhaps I was giving a broken one with a dull blade or something at first as thats how spotty my shave was. But reading the reviews it seems others have had the same problems. So if your looking for a close shave this isnt it. It also has trouble getting getting more awkward areas and angles like your chin giving you a spotty shave. For the cooling portion of it. It does work, it does feel cool, and is pleasant(although I was also expecting more out of this as well). But considering again how spotty the shave is and how often you have to go over the same area I think this kinda makes this point not as great as if the actual shaver it self worked. There is a side burn trimmer which is convenient. Would I recommend it to a friend? I suppose yea if after hearing the negatives about it they still wanted to check it out. But for full price? I find it hard to justify buying this personally. Also one of the main perks I think of a electric shaver would be the whole saving money in the long run. And quick and easy use. But this is actually just the same if not more time consuming since the shave is not close. I suppose the pluses of this would be if you want a five o clock shadow that sort of atheistic good look to your jaw.. albeit spotty this will give it to you since you wont get a clean shave. And of course you will feel a bit of a cooling sensation which is nice... Anyway cool idea on paper, but in the end unfortunately does not work as well as I would have hoped.
  452. I received this razor via a program run by Braun. I have not used an electric razor in many years, both because I was not impressed with the last model I used and as one who shaves their head I was under the impression that they simply weren't a viable option.<br /><br />I decided to give the Braun Cooltec an honest chance, first using it to do some touch-up work after shaving with my regular razor, then progressed to using it to touch up my face and neck after work before heading to events/functions, finally working up feeling like I could trust it to shave my face and neck completely.<br /><br />I consider myself very picky about my shave, especially on my head - I take a great deal of time to make sure that it perfectly smooth. Though initially skeptical, I found that the Braun CoolTec able to deliver results that I consider satisfactory. the heads are very good at following all the countours of my neck, face, and head. As an added bonus, I enjoyed the feeling of the cooling bar on my skin. It made the time spent shaving as enjoyable as I think it could be.<br /><br />My only complaint about the Braun CoolTec is with the integrated trimmer. There are actually two things I did not like. First, the trimmer is not very strong so it takes a very long time to trim coarse facial hair. Second, either the trimmer or that area of the razor throws off a lot of heat - so while you are sitting there, annoyed with the amount of time it's taking to trim your 'stache, you're also dealing with the added frustration of the heat.<br /><br />Still, despite from the trimmer being inadequate for my needs, the CoolTec seems to be a great razor that delivers a comfortable and close shave even to the standards of someone as picky as myself. Changed my opinion on electric razors completely.<br /><br />Definitely worth checking this out if you're in the market.

The razor worked good in the shower and after use I just put it in the charger and it cleans itself. the only thing that I do not like about the razor is if I do not shave with it for two days I have to use a blade razor to shave. the Braun works good got maintaining short facial hair but not so good on longer hair. This is still the best electric razor I have used.

  456. After years of rarely shaving, I decided to try The Braun CoolTec Shaving System. Compared to my Norelco electric razor that I had years ago, it is fantastic. The cooling bar in the middle of the razor is very refreshing. Since I only shave once every few weeks, razor burn and irritation are fairly common but with this razor the irritation is minimal compared to other razors that I have used. The charging and self-cleaning stand works quite well but the replacement cartridges seem a bit pricey. It also come with a travel charger which will come in handy due to its low profile. The beard trimmer feature is not as well designed as on some other electric razors. All in all though, as far as electric razors go, the Braun CoolTec is top notch.<br /><br />* This electric shaver was provided via a program run by Braun

  460. I was excited to receive my Braun ¬∞CoolTec System via a program run by Braun and was very excited to try the cooling feature that was well hyped up. The results, however, were mixed. Overall, it's a good shaving system and gets the job done, but it's not revolutionary.<br /><br />Pros:<br />1. The Braun ¬∞CoolTec shaver minimizes shaving irritation. My face felt much cooler and did not sting, compared to a straight razor.<br />2. The cooling feature is cool and it makes my face feel good after the shave (even if it's all in my head).<br />3. Works anywhere, even in the shower. The waterproof design makes shaving easy and carefree, wherever I decide to shave.<br />4. All the parts, pieces, and accessories are high quality.<br /><br />Cons:<br />1. Does not shave as closely as a straight razor, but that is true with all electric razors, in my experience.<br />2. The precision trimmer seemed more like an afterthought. It's too small and too weak to compete against dedicated trimmers and does not complement the main shaver.<br />3. The system is too bulky, from a large and uncomfortable-to-hold shaver to a space-hogging cleaning and charging station.<br />4. The shaver is quite noisy when in use, and so is the cleaning and charging station when it's cleaning the shaver. Not too big of a deal unless I'm shaving or cleaning in the middle of the night, which I don't do.<br /><br />The cooling feature is indeed really cool (pun intended), but if you want a perfect shave, I would suggest a straight razor or a different electric razor. Braun delivers an all-in-one system with the ¬∞CoolTec, but unfortunately it doesn't excel as a razor or a trimmer.

I can't get over how neat the aluminum cooling bar feels! It really does make a difference. I've only experienced very mild irritation once with this razor and that was probably my fault for pressing it too hard to my face the first time I used it as I didn't know how easily and effectively it would cut the &#34;little hairs.&#34;<br /><br /> The razor itself is extremely comfortable to hold and does a great job of staying evenly pressed against my face when I'm shaving. Other razors have caused me to have to hold it in awkward positions to get an even shave, but not this one!! I am also very impressed with the ease of mobility with the travel case.<br /><br />Aside from the sleekness of the razor, and the awesome cooling sensation that seems to actually keep the irritation away, this entire system is very well-designed and stylish. Its so nice to have a charging system that cleans the razor at the same time! Braun has come out with a great product and it is working great for me.   464. I received this shaver as a promotional program run by Braun. I'm not much of an electric razor guy, but I was actually quite impressed this one. Out of curiosity, I put it in the charger/cleaning system and let it clean before I shaved for my first time. It only took about 5 minutes, maybe less. With my first use of it, I was already impressed on how cold the razor actually got. The only issue I had was after I cleaned it, when I shaved, there was some cleaning fluid that dripped from the shaver after cleaning. However, I cleaned it again after my first use and the next time I shaved with it, there was no fluid leaking. So, this can easily be solved by letting it dry after its cleaned. I'd recommend to have it cleaned after you use it and then just let it dry while it charges at the station until your next shave. Other than that, I didn't have any issues. It gives quite the close shave and it feels as if your using an ice cube to do it. I also like that it has a retractable razor on the back in case you need to do a major shave and not just a clean up. I would definitely recommend this product.

  480. I've been using the CoolTec electric shaver by Braun that I received through \\"BzzAgent\\" campaign run by Braun for over a month now and my opinion is that it's an ok/average electric razor. It took a month for my facial hair to become accustomed to the new razor. The cool strip that is suppose to keep your face from becoming irritated from shaving works, but for me, a guy who doesn't have sensitive skin, the drawbacks aren't really worth the benefit of this razor. Because of the design of the razor head with the cool strip, it doesn't give a really close shave without a LOT of passes over your face. And I have some spots on my chin and neck where my beard is really difficult to cut. Also, the razor is a bit big and bulky and a little bit much to conveniently hold and maneuver around your face while shaving. Not to mention that the size of the shaving head is so large it's not easy to shave your mustache area. I nick my upper lip just about every time I use it if I'm not careful. The self-cleaning feature is really nice and works great. The charge lasts about a week and that is with the cooling feature turned on. The charge actually lasts longer than a week, but after about 4 or five days it doesn't have enough of a charge to operate the cooling feature. Over all I give this razor about 3 ¬Ω stars out of five.

  484. I have been using a Braun 8000 series razor for quite some time, and was fortunate enough to receive a new Braun CoolTec razor as part of a Braun promotion for testing and review. This review is a part of that promotion. The first thing I can say is that the CoolTec technology does in fact work. It actually works extremely well. The first few times that I used the razor, it felt like the foil was wet, as if the cleaning solution hadn't yet fully evaporated. It messed with my mind for the first week. It is a very soothing sensation and really did eliminate razor burn and the need for aftershave lotion, for me, anyway. The cleaning station is a little sleeker and modern-looking than my 8000 series station. The package also came with a cleaning solution pack, as well as a travel charger and carry case. The travel charger uses the same cord as the cleaning station, and acts as a charging cradle. You can not simply plug the cord into the razor. The travel case gives the razor a very snug fit, however, there is no room for the charging cradle, or the cord, as my 8000 series case does. I have not tried it yet, as I am paranoid of dropping it in the shower, however, this is a wet or dry razor.<br /><br />This razor does have some drawbacks. I would rather not have the charging cradle, and would prefer to be able to plug the cord directly into my razor for charging and shaving. I would also want the case to be able to hold the cord to keep everything tidy in one place when traveling. As it is, you have to remember to take three items, as opposed to one case with the razor and cord inside. The razor does not come with a plastic shield over the foil, which I would have liked to have included, as foils and cutters are so expensive. I would appreciate a fifty cent plastic guard protecting a $40 foil and cutter.<br /><br />The razor is not nearly as powerful as my 8000 series razor. I approximate it takes me 30% longer to shave in the morning. I do gain comfort, but something about having a cake and eating it too. There is no tilt head feature which I use 100% of the time with my 8000 series razor, and the side burn trimmer is very narrow, and without being able to tilt the head out of the way, difficult to use precisely. I have not been impressed with the side burn trimmer at all, I actually use the one on my 8595.<br /><br />My overall impression of this razor is one of hope. I am thoroughly impressed with the CoolTec feature. If I had that in my 8000 series razor, I would absolutely love it. I have no idea how much I paid for my 8595, or when, but after having tried out this razor, would pay $30-$50 more to have the CoolTec bar on it. I am hoping that Braun is satisfied with the results of the CoolTec and decide to incorporate it into their entire razor line. I have very little knowledge about competitive brands and products (how many times in your life are you in the market for a new electric razor?), but this could indeed be a game changer for Braun.<br /><br />I hope this review helps.
  485. I received this razor via a program run by Braun. The cooltec system definitely works.   488. This gets a 5 star rating because it's the first razor I've ever found that actually works as good as they say that it does in the ads. I've been wanting to switch over to electric shaving since long before I could grow a beard; it looked so cool in all the movies and &#34;Grandpa does it while he drives his car to work&#34;. I was sold on the dream. When I finally got the beard, and asked dad why he DIDN'T use an electric razor, he explained that he could never get one that worked right. I was stuck with safety razors, but the electric razor dream never died, it would reemerge every couple years as a slick new razor ad struck my fancy. And every time, without fail, I would be savagely disappointed.<br /><br />Enter the Braun CoolTec; Made in Germany, winner of the reddot award, and the coolest looking looking device I have seen in a while. I was drawn to the design, and when I read about the technology I couldn't help but think that maybe this was the shaver I have been searching for. The 60-day money back guarantee sold me, I figured I could just get my money back when it didn't live up to my expectations. I opened up the box, set up the ingenious cleaning station, and charged it for an hour. Then the moment of truth, would this thing actually shave good? Amazingly, YES. And it's very very cold while it shaves, which makes it infinitely more comfortable. The cleaning station does all the cleaning for you, and everyday my shaver smells and operates like it's fresh out of the hygienic shaver factory back in Germany.<br /><br />This is the shaving dream, and I'm living it. (It's around 5 bucks a month to keep the cleaning solution flowing, but for now, it's worth every of those 500 pennies.)
  489. I did not receive the CLEANING CARTRIDGE (170ml), as it should be included in the Standard Packaging.<br />It is definitely a bad idea choosing the Frustrating Free Packaging.

  493. The shaver meets my expectations. I have used electric shavers since 1990, and this one works well. The cooling bar helps keep shaving irritation on my neck down. I wish it had the pivoting head of the older Pulsonic that I had, but it still gets the job done.
  494. I'll preface by saying that I had virtually no experience with electric razors prior to this product. I owned a three-head Norelco from over 10 years ago that was horrible...I had been using blades until I received this as a gift a year ago.<br /><br />First, I'll preface by saying if you want any type of facial hair (beard/stubble, chin strap, goatee, etc.) this product will be useless for you. The pop-up trimmer is only appropriate for evening out sideburns; precision facial hair detailing simply cannot be accomplished with this razor.<br /><br />Aesthetically, the razor looks great. It feels solid and sturdy, and is comfortable to hold. It looks really cool in its cleaning base, as well, sitting there looking like the sword in the stone when you're not using it. That cleaning solution does its job really well too; the foil feels great after being cleaned, and on top of that it comes out smelling like lemons, which is awesome. Battery life is a non-issue; you'll have more than enough juice to get you through even a lengthy shave (which is one of this razor's main downsides...more on that later).<br /><br />The main selling point of this Braun is the CoolTec system. Basically, an aluminum element situated between the cutting foils gradually becomes cooler as you shave. It actually works great. The cooling sensation feels pleasant on the skin, and there's definitely less irritation than the old Norelco that I previously used. Since its an electric, you won't be nicking or cutting your skin as you shave, either. After about 15-20 minutes, however, the cooling element will cease functioning and need to be...erm...cooled down before being used again. That's not a deal-breaker, though, and overall, this product provides the most comfortable shave I've ever had, and for that it deserves praise.<br /><br />What is a deal breaker is the quality of the shave you get from this product. This is going to be subjective, since everyone's facial hair grows differently (directionof hair growth, rate of hair growth, thickness/coarseness, etc). My facial hair grows in pretty quickly and relatively coarse.<br /><br />Firstly, if you have anything more than a two-day old beard, this thing in general is going to be miserable unless you trim down your stubble first. The quality of the shave is quite uneven and immensely disappointing. The shaver does well on the cheeks/jaw and chin, and does an okay job on the upper lip area (provided you use a blade to get the hairs just under your nose). However, it fails miserable in the area underneath the chin, and on the neck. There are always a handful of hairs and/or clusters of stubble that seem to be outside of the shaver's ability, even after multiple passes. I've tried shaving dry and using Lectric Shave, and I still have the same problem. You may need to follow up with a pass of a traditional blade to ensure closeness, which kind of defeats the purpose. This increases your shaving time to inconvenient lengths.<br /><br />I'm not going to say this is a bad product. The cleaning base and CoolTec functionality are wonderful features to have in an electric shaver, and they really do work as advertised. The shave is serviceable (if uneven), which isn't bad, but you'd expect more from this relatively expensive electric shaver.<br /><br />If you want a clean-shaven look, and as long as you shave every day (every other day at the most), you'll be okay with this razor and may even love it. Everyone else should approach this product with caution. One year later, I still use mine sporadically when I want the aforementioned clean-shaven look and don't want to nick up my face. At all other times, I'll be using a blade.
  495. great product<br />the cooling feature is a nice feature I use it each time<br />and cleaning system does a great job cleaning the unit.<br />I would recommend this product.
  496. I recently got to use the Braun CoolTec electric razor that was provided to me via a program run by Braun and I must say I am surprised by how much I enjoyed using it. Often times I have had problems with skin irritation whether I used a manual or electric razor, shaving cream or gel, hot water, or any other method to minimize razor burn.<br /><br />At first, I didn't think this CoolTec system would really make that much of a difference but it was a relief to find that I was wrong. It gave a nice smooth close shave and the cooling that comes off of such a small strip for the CoolTec system calmed my skin as I shaved.<br /><br />I have to say there were a lot of things to like about the razor and the CoolTec feature: close shave, calm skin, cool feel, quick charge, familiar Braun charging and cleaning station, etc.<br />The only thing I think is not perfect about this is I would have wished that the cooling strip was a slight bit wider, but overall still well above expectations and I would certainly recommend this product to others.<br /><br />UPDATE:<br />After a few weeks of use I still stand by my original review in that it is a nice close shave and the cooltec feature is an added benefit. I like the size and feel while holding the razor and it is quick and easy to clean and charge.<br /><br />One negative point I have is that I am a little disappointed in the long hair trimmer feature on this electric razor as I have used other Braun electric razors previously and the long hair trimmer worked just fine for sideburns or if I didn't shave for a few days and let my beard/mustache grow out. Other than that I am still quite pleased with the razor and think that the cooltec feature is a nice addition to an electric razor.
  497. I have always flip flopped back and forth between electric razor and blade. I usually tend to use the blade during summer and the electric during winter because all the electric shavers I've used have heated up after the first 45ish seconds of use. Hot face + hot shaver = bad shave and irritated skin.<br /><br />I received this as part of a trial program from Braun. As a person who is always warm (I live in shorts year round), the idea of having a cooling electric shaver intrigued me.<br />After receiving it I opened the box and started putting it all together (it comes with a few thing). Right off the bat I noticed that the power plug for the charging/cleaning pod did was not a tight fit. It easily came out of its socket. I'm not sure if it was designed that way (maybe safety reasons) or if mine was a defect.<br /><br />A few thing I noticed before while assembling:<br /><br />It is a bit bulky/heavy. My Panasonic (similar setup to the Braun) weighs 6.1oz while the Braun is 9.9oz. This is understandable since it has a cooling function.<br /><br />The cleaning solution that was supplied smells like cheap vodka.<br /><br />It feels nice in your hand, but i feel that the on/off and cooling button should be switched (my thumb rested right on the cooling button).<br /><br />When charging it MUST be sitting face down at an angle (strange).<br />Charging time was surprisingly fast, straight out of the box it has no jiuce, and about a half hour on the charger the indicator light went off and it is ready to go.<br /><br />The First Shave:<br />As soon as I hit the button I noticed that it has a lower frequency buzz than my Panasonic.<br />The cooling function is defaulted to On so it started cooling right off the bat. The cooling comes from a metal bar in the middle of the two screens. After letting it run for 10 seconds, I touched the bar and it was surprisingly cold. I figured that it would have been slightly colder than the shaver head, but WOW, it feels likeyou touched the inside of your freezer.<br />I started in on my first shave, and the cold sensation is very nice. I wish that the shaver head itself was a bit narrower (too much of a gap between the screens, but the cooling bar had to go somewhere.<br />My face felt nice after the shave. The best way I can equate the cooling feature is if you put a cold can of soda on your warm face/forehead. It felt really nice!<br />Left a few long hairs on my face, but not many.<br />It has a side-burn/hair trimmer on the back that worked nicely.<br /><br />After i was done i took of the screen and brushed away the hairs using the supplied brush and put it in its cradle for its first cleaning.<br />One push of the (only) button on the cradle and it started its cleaning cycle. The cycle ran for about 5 min (shorter than the Panasonic) and it was done. Upon inspection of the cutting head, it is as clean as before i used it.<br /><br />Final thoughts:<br />I am going to use the crap out of this during summer (too bad its November now). The cooling feature works amazingly well. I can imagine it took quite a bit of engineering to fit a cooling system into a shaver. All in all, its a great shaver!

One is for cleaning and the other is for portability. The cleaning dock is great and very quiet! I use it in a bathroom that is about 20 feet from my sleeping kids (5, 2 1/2 and less than a year old). It doesn't wake them or even make them stir.<br /><br />The portable station is very compact and does not have any latching mechanisms. I find this to be great for quick one handed access to the razor. However, I can see how some may not like the lack of a latch to hold the razor in the charging station. To be clear, the cleaning station DOES have a latch, but the smaller charging station DOES NOT.<br /><br />The only reason I give this razor 4 of 5 instead of 5 of 5 is because the trimmer attachment leaves MUCH to be desired. However, if you have a trimmer already (like I do), then the trimmer attachment is a VERY minor aspect of the overall razor.<br /><br />Disclaimer: The shaver was provided through a program run by Braun.

This seems to be an all or nothing approach when it comes to shaving.<br /><br />All in all, this product is great for men who do not need a very close shave and for men who suffer from razor bumps or skin irritation when shaving.   514. I received the Braun CoolTec Shaver system from a program run by Braun. As a man with very sensitive skin, I was hesitant yet intrigued to try out the shaver. I have tried several different electric shavers and razors, but most of them end up causing moderate to severe razor burn.<br /><br />I received the CT5 cc model which includes the &#34;Clean and Charge&#34; station. Setup was easy straight out of the box and I went ahead and ran the cleaning system while it was charging. The cleaning process itself took around 3 minutes, but it was suggested to let it dry for a few hours before using the shaver. The cleaning system itself has been very nice and very convenient. I have been able to just throw it on the &#34;Clean and Charge&#34; station after each use and not have to worry about it being charged or cleaned when I went to shave next.<br /><br />After being cleaned and charged, I tried it out for the first time. For the first shave, I did what the instructions suggested and did a completely dry shave. After trimming the longer hair with the handy long hair trimmer, I was pleasantly surprised with how smooth the shaver went across my face. There were one or two pulls around my chin, but it was smooth other than that. The aluminum cooling bar was nice, but was not shockingly cool. The next morning, I shaved while in the shower. It was even smoother in the shower with a damp face than it was dry. I was immediately aware of the cooling bar and it added a whole different level to the shaving experience. The face on my skin stayed cooler than the rest of my body which led to a very enjoyable shaving experience. One this to be careful about if you do shave in the shower - the cleaning solution in the &#34;Clean and Charge&#34; station is comprised of alcohol and perfume. I made the mistake of leaving my mouth open while shaving part of my face and got a very bitter taste in my mouth. I was confused as to what it was at first, but realized that it was probably residualcleaning solution that had dried on the blades, only to be re-wet and shaken off when used with water. If you do a dry shave, this should not be a problem. Before trying this shaver, I used a five-bladed razor but could not shave against the grain because of the sensitivity of my face. This shaving system allowed an extremely close shave and I was able to go against the grain without any problems.<br /><br />My biggest test for this shaving system was whether or not I would get razor burn in the few hours after I had shaved. I was incredibly pleased that I did not receive any razor burn or other types of irritation after using this system. I have made this shaving system my new primary shaver and will be recommending it!
  515. I was lucky enough to receive the Cooltec razor from Braun last month for free as part of a trial program. I will admit, the razor gives you a very close shave, but there is typically a lot of pain involved in the process. If your facial hair is longer than the average five o'clock shadow, the razor pulls the hair quite a bit for a less-than-comfortable shaving experience. The cooling bar is pretty cool and helps to some degree, but I find that other Braun models - such as the Series 7 - achieve the same or similar results with less pulling.<br /><br />Also, the first time I used the cleaning station, I set it at night before going to bed and the thing kept running through the night and was still going when I woke up 7 hours later. There were also no lights on to indicate what exactly was supposed to be happening. All in all, the cooling technology was a great idea, I just think it should be implemented on a better quality razor.<br /><br />UPDATE - I've been using the razor for a few weeks now and, overall, I like it and will continue to use it as my main electric razor. The cleaning system still malfunctions from time to time, but it's not very difficult to remove the head and brush off the cutting blades. If you've got some dough and want to buy a unique razor, I don't think you'd be disappointed with the Cooltec.
  516. This is a great product. At first I was unsure if it had fully charged since it makes so much less noise than any electric shaver I have previously had. Somehow they managed to keep all the shaving power, but make it much quieter. It provides a great shave, and immediately starts cooling once it's turned on. It feels great and is a nice change from other shavers that feel like they're going to burn your skin by the time you get done shaving. Every generation of new Braun product keeps getting better. My only concern with this one is the price of a replacement head. Since the cooling tech is all integrated with the blade, I'm sure it's going to cost quite a bit when I need to replace it. This shaver looks great, and since it doesn't have a port to plug it in, you can actually use it to shave in the shower. A great time saver when you're running late. I love the cleaning system and this version allows to you control how often it cleans so you don't have to worry about running out of fluid quickly. It also seems to be more frugal with how much cleaning fluid it uses since I haven't had to replace the cartridge and I've had it for a few weeks now.   518. I received a Braun CoolTec shaver to try out via a program run by Braun. I typically shave using a razor, but was tempted into trying out an electric shaver again with Brauns innovative new cooling system. I've been very impressed with the CoolTec. It's a very nice looking unit, the dock solves the problem of where to store the shaver (having it sat next to the sink means it's easier for me to grab and use than my razors which I have to keep away from my toddler). It was easy to get going and prime with fluid, and so far seems like a very no-fuss setup.<br /><br />The shave is the most important thing here, and for me it was the closest I've had from an electric razor. It dealt with a few days of stubble with no issue, and left me silky smooth, which quite frankly I was suprised at. Based on past experience with electric shavers I wasn't expecting much from the actual shave. The reason I only gave 4 stars is that I still don't think an electric shaver can get quite the same result as a razor. Maybe this is unfair, and maybe I'm setting my standards too high, but that's just how I feel. It shouldn't take away from the fact that it delivered a good close shave.<br /><br />I expected the cooling system to be a novelty, but it's actually very effective. There's a metal bar that sits between the two cutting blades which really does get ice cold, and I found it helped cut down on irritation. The main reason I switched to manual razors years ago is because I have sensitive skin and pushing an electric shaver around my face used to leave me with blotchy skin. The CoolTec didn't have that effect, so that's a thumbs up from me.<br /><br />The cleaning system seems to work well. As other reviewers have mentioned it leaves the shave head with a subtle chemical smell, but it smells clean, so doesn't bother me. I'm still on the first batch of cleaning fluid so I can't comment on how long they actually last, and I am slightly cynically thinking this may be just a wayto get a few more pennies out of us, but I am reserving judgement. If it prevents my shaver from clogging up then it's worth the money.<br /><br />The travel dock is a useful addition, allowing you to charge the shaver out of the cleaning dock. It'd make more sense to me if you could just plug the charger cable straight into the shaver, but as long as I don't have to take the cleaning station on holiday with me I'm happy.<br /><br />The only thing I haven't tried out is the long hair trimmer, so I can't comment on that.<br /><br />I was very excited to get hold of the CoolTec and it wasn't a disappointing experience. Overall I'm more impressed than I expected to be. It's actually converted me back to electric shaving. Good job Braun.

  520. I was provided the razor via a promotion through Braun, so I am totally unbiased. I have used several of the top brands before including Braun and never really noticed much difference.<br /><br />This product is a premium razor with high quality construction. It is meant to be used as a daily razor and not a &#34;once-a-month shave my beard razor&#34;. I have gone back and forth with straight razors vs electric and I always seem to shy away from the electric after a while because of the skin irritation they cause. This razor is meant to alleviate the heat caused by all the friction and thus reduce some of the unnecessary skin irritation.<br /><br />Overall I have used it for the past several weeks and as an electric razor, this is top notch. Its comfortable, powerful, and precise. The square head makes it easy to control if you have a goatee or mustache you don't want to accidentally shave. On top of that, the cooling feature actually works. I have no earthly idea what makes it so cold, but it literally feels like someone took it straight out of the freezer when its turned on. It takes a second or two to kick in but its definitely cold.<br /><br />Now, the cooling has no effect on the razor's ability to shave your hair. It is there to increase comfort and reduce irritation. So far, I would definitely say its much more comfortable than any other electric razor I have owned.<br /><br />It comes with a cleaning station that is super cool. I hate cleaning out my other razors and this makes the process much easier and I actually trust that its clean now. Battery life seems pretty good, I can go a week+ on one charge so on short trips all you need is the razor and its carrying case (provided).<br /><br />If you are the type that shaves every morning, this is sure to make that process easier and much more comfortable. I would definitely recommend and buy one for myself.
  521. I have tried quite a few electronic shavers but I always went back to using my regular shaver. When I was introduced to Braun CoolTec Men's Shaving system via a Braun program, I was so excited to try something to new. To say that this has been a life changer for me would be an understatement. This is hands down the best electronic shaver that is out there that is out there in the market today. This gives me a close shave and it gives me no irritation afterward. I have grown to love this and I feel that everytime I shave I get better at maneouvering around and also finishing my shaving sooner every time! I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is in the market for a new electronic shaver!

I was able to test the shaver through a program run by Braun and have been working with it for a few weeks.<br /><br />Pros - Feels very good in hand. It has a nice weight with balance. The 'CoolTec' feature is very nice. A problem that many electric shavers have is the friction can make your face feel warm and not as comfortable. The idea of cooltec is to create a cooling sensation while shaving. I liked it a lot. The shaving experience is pretty good for electric. You'll need to work around your skin for coverage and a complete shave. Again, not as good as a razor, but awfully convenient.<br /><br />Cons - Although it feels good in the hand, it is a bit more cumbersome to maneuver. If there was a bit more articulation to the shaving head would come in handy. The cooltec would also be nice if it was on the perimeter of the shaving head rather than the middle.<br /><br />Overall, it is a very nice shaver and the cooltec makes for a good feature and experience. I'd think it make a great gift.
