My Adam's Apple stick out fairly far and I always have shaving it without either cutting myself or having major irritation. This razor was able to resolve both issues.<br /><br />I loved that the Cooling bar was cold instantly. Using the cleaning base is optional and does provide benefits. The razor can be cleaned just using running tap water but the cleaning solution helps keep the razor sanitary and prolongs the life of the razor head.
  524. I have been using the Braun CoolTec system for a couple of weeks now. First of all, the cooling bar is really great and quite innovative. I wasn't sure how I would like it at first, since we are all used to the notion of a &#34;hot shave&#34;, but I find it to be really soothing. This is especially good for me since I am prone to real irritation from electric shavers. My previous model was a Toni & Guy that I picked up in Europe - it went straight in the wastebin once I tried the Braun CoolTec.<br />Now, I did receive this system as from Braun as part of a campaign, so I figured I had nothing to lose, but it has really won me over. I have long been a daily disposable razor head guy - I have never found an electric razor that gets as close a shave as I like. Unfortunately, I still haven't - but the Braun CoolTec comes close. I still see myself shaving with a regular razor most often, but I can see the potential for the Braun to fill in one to two days a week. The clean and charge system is another nice feature - I've never liked dismantling a razor and going in there with those tiny brushes.<br />Overall, I would say that the Braun CoolTec is the closest I have come to finding an electric razor that meets my needs.
  525. I was fortunate enough to be given the chance to experience the Braun CoolTec Shaving System by a program run by Braun.<br /><br />At first I was excited as this was my first foray into the electric shaving department, that excitement quickly turned to frustration, although not entirely the CoolTec products fault.<br /><br />This is a niche product, its designed extremely well, built like a tank, and reliable like any good razor should be. The Cooling System is a piece of metal that, you guessed it, gets cool during shaving. The cooling only lasts a short time, around 15 minutes but if you need to shave longer than 15 minutes you should be using something else...<br /><br />The kit comes with charging station that cleans and hydrates the razor, one important note is that the cradle is very large and takes up a decent amount of counter space, couple that with the $5 cartridges it can get pricey quick. Braun recommends you change the blades on the razor every 18 months, those can cost you anywhere in the $50 price, Amazon doesn't have them in stock anymore. When you combine all this you have a product which initial cost can be expensive compared to a manual, but how does it stack up against a manual?<br /><br />It doesn't, I hate to say it but it seems that this shave is just not as close a manual razor, but I don't think its supposed to. The cooling does help, it feels nice when the razor glides over your face. I'm a person who has thick facial hair, I had to do numerous passes to experience what I thought was a close shave, those pesky hairs by the neckline might as well be impossible to get with the electric razor. Do I like it? Yes and No. Am I going to continue using it? Certainly.<br /><br />Getting back to its not the CoolTecs Fault, because I have thick follicles, as others may have, the system is tougher for us to use, electric shavers are not for everyone, but this one does a good job.<br /><br />Pros:<br />Ergonomically Designed<br />Waterproof- Nice to shave in the shower<br />Cooling system is a nice feature, but gimmicky<br />Battery life is excellent!<br />After cleaning in charging station feels clean and fresh<br /><br />Cons:<br />Close but not close enough<br />Tough to get in the tight places<br />Expensive Cartidge Refills<br />Base Station very large.

  532. I haven't been a big fan of electric shavers as I unfortunately have sensitive skin that reacts adversely to them. I've tired a few different brands in the past(Norelco I believe) but haven't found any that work for me and had more or less sworn off ever using electric shavers again. However, I was presented an opportunity to receive a free Braun CoolTec Shaving System through a program that was being run by Braun and figured I'd give it a shot(it was free, what did I have to lose, right?)<br /><br />Upon opening the box I was quite impressed. Looked like a lot of machine and a very quality product. I read through the instruction manual(yeah, I'm a geek) and was excited to get it started up ready to use. Now, I will add here that I was coming off of a no shave November and had a little bit of half beard going. So maybe I shouldn't have been surprised when it didn't give me the closest shave of my life. First impressions..........LOVED the CoolTec part of the shaver as it completely left my skin feeling &#34;cool&#34;(duh) with no irritation at all. However, I was not impressed with closeness of the shave. I had patches of &#34;stubble&#34; that I just couldn't seem to get no matter how hard I tried to go over them. As a result, I pulled out my shaving blade and took care of the problems.<br /><br />After a couple of days I gave it another shot and once again amazed by the cooling affect. I should insert here that in all of my other experiences with electric shavers I would experience &#34;burns&#34; that would later turn into blisters(a lot like some cold sores). With the Braun CoolTec system this hasn't been a problem. But.........again a problem with getting all of the stubble around my jawline and neck area.<br /><br /> At this point I thought I would be leaving a poor review. Thankfully I persevered and continued to use my Braun. Maybe it was because I had been used to the &#34;blades&#34; of the three rounded variety and I wasn't used to this system, but after about a week I had figured the Braun out and it was shaving like a dream.<br /><br />What I love about the system now: It is a quick close shave, and as I mentioned above, the cooling system is amazing! It also comes with a self cleaning unit that does the trick and keeps it sparkling and sanitary. The Braun CoolTec system is incredibly simple and easy to use. For the most part, it just involves pressing a few buttons! I have not had to replace any of the cleaning packs yet and haven't researched the cost, but I'll jump that hurdle when I get there.<br /><br />Overall, I'd have to say I'm pleased with my Braun CoolTec shaving system...........after learning how to use it!
  533. I've gone through multiple electric shavers since my first shaver was handed down to me from my dad when my beard just started coming in at the ripe old age of 8...ok maybe 15. That first shaver was awesome, it signified my transition to manhood, but it was ultimately a heaping pile of junk and soon replaced with a regular razor as it just did not give as close or as quick a shave. Since then every shaver I've had was not able to compete with a razor on quickness or smoothness of shave so I was skeptical when Braun offered me the chance to review the CoolTec Men's shaver for free, but hey it's free right, so why not give it a chance.<br /><br />The first thing I noticed about the shaver was the price, almost $200 retail?! It better be good for that price! The next thing I noticed when I received my package was the bulkiness of the cleaning station (my bathroom is currently very small and I share it with my wife, enough said). Well I set it up and let it clean the razor, it was a bit loud but pretty quick. I then sadly used the trimmer on my epic beard I had grown over Movember, which was oddly satisfying for my wife, and was pleased with the smoothness and effectiveness of the trimmer. I was also impressed with the weight and feel of the shaver in my hand, it felt very comfortable and solid, like if I dropped it on the tile it would be fine, not the cheap light plastic feel I was expecting.<br /><br />Ok the trimmer works great, that's nice but not terribly surprising. I flipped on the cooling feature of the razor since it is the cornerstone of the product and began my shave. The cooling kicked in almost immediately and provided a marked difference to the feel of the shaver against my skin. It was refreshing and kept my skin from sticking to the shaver and my hair from getting pulled. The fact that the shaver was also freshly cleaned was noticeable as well, it kept the blades very smooth and lubricated, unlike any electric shaver I had experienced previously, even when freshly cleaned with a third party lubricating agent. The shave went relatively fast and I did not find myself needing to go over many areas repeatedly, except for a few small trouble areas. Once the shave was complete I was honestly amazed with how close and smooth of a shave I had received from an electric shaver. I would say it was about 95% as good as the best manual razor I've used, which was miles ahead of any other shaver I have experienced previously, and there was almost no irritation, which again, was unexpected and impressive. Next came cleanup.<br /><br />Cleaning the shaver was a cinch. The head pops right off and is easily rinsed, as is the shaver itself. Putting the head back on was just as easy and popping it on the cleaning station for a fresh, complete clean was a snap, much easier than other razors that you need to disassemble piece by piece, then lubricate with a spray or other third party agent, then most likely next time you use will need to apply a pre-electric shave gel or other prepping agent. Not that you couldn't do that with the CoolTec shaver but I really don't see a need to. Storing the razor safely is easy with the travel case and docking station provided. Storing the cleaning station is a bit more of a challenge as the cleaning agent in the system can spill if it is tilted too much, but the plug and cord detach which is good for storage and I found a nice spot under my sink to set the system until next time. I would definitely recommend using the cleaning station after every use to get the closest, smoothest shave out of your Braun CoolTec shaver.<br /><br />Overall I was completely amazed with the quality of shave and ease of use of the Braun CoolTec shaver and my expectations, low as they were, were far exceeded. I would say this shaver gave the best electric shave I have ever experienced. That being said I still think using a quality manual razor is faster and gives a slightly cleaner shave, although thecost of replacements can be steep and will eventually exceed the cost of this system if you require frequent shaving for your job or other reason. I won't be putting away my razors just yet but for travelling and for a quick touch up the Braun CoolTec Shaver is miles ahead of other shavers if you can get over the price and have a little bit of storage under your sink! It's definitely worth the price.
  534. I received this shaver through a promotion that was offered through Braun itself. I initially was very skeptical of a shaver that cools the skin, because my thinking was that heat would works better. After all it is known as a hot shave and not a cold one. I was quite surprised though to find that not only does it offer an incredible shave but the cooling actually reduces irritation and at appears to create smoother skin. The cold does take a little while to get used to though. The self cleaning aspect makes this a perfect product to maintain.
  535. I‚Äôve been a devout user of a manual razor ever since I started shaving in my late teenage years. I have tough facial hair and like the smooth closeness that I am able to achieve using my manual razor. I‚Äôve tried a few electric shavers in the past, but have never been impressed by the results. When I received an offer to try the CoolTec via a program run by Braun, I thought there was no harm in trying the product out. The Braun CoolTec‚Äôs main selling point is that it has a cooling bar, which is meant to minimize redness, burning, and skin irritation from shaving. Does it work? Yes and no. It has some advantages but they are unfortunately outweighed by the negatives, which have made me go back to my manual razor.<br /><br />PROS: I found that the Braun CoolTec delivers on its promises regarding the active cooling technology, cleaning system, and comfortable design.<br /><br />REFRESHINGLY COOL<br />The cooling bar definitely works and added a level of refreshing comfort to my skin which I had never experienced before. Unlike electric razors that I have tried in the past, it did not pinch my skin or pull my hair. The combination of the cooling bar and the lubricated blades helped the razor glide across my skin effortlessly. This is a great product for anyone who has sensitive skin or suffers from razor burn.<br /><br />EASY TO CLEAN<br />Cleaning is extremely easy and allows for a refreshing experience even after repeated uses. The razor is accompanied by a base which serves as a charger and cleaning station. This keeps the product clean and lubricated. It is also easy to rinse the razor in the sink since it comes with a easily detachable head. The maintenance on this product is therefore quite minimal.<br /><br />EASY TO GRIP<br />Right out of the box, I was very impressed by the design of the razor. It is compact, modern-looking, and easy-to-grip. The handle fits easily in my hand and the razor contours to the shape of my face effortlessly. Because of its compact size, it is easy to carry along when travelling and comes with a sleek travel case.<br /><br />CONS: I found that the Braun CoolTec failed to deliver when it came to closeness of the shave and efficiency ‚Äì two factors that matter most to me.<br /><br />NOT CLOSE ENOUGH<br />I have tough facial hair and am accustomed to a clean, close shave with my manual razor. I found it very challenging to get a similar level of closeness in my shave using the Braun CoolTec even after going over the same areas several times. Likewise, no matter how I maneuvered the device, I was left with stray hair below my jaw line and neck, which I ultimately had to clean up using a manual razor. Furthermore, when I tried shaving on a some short stubble, there were minimal results because the hair was not long enough.<br /><br />NOT FAST ENOUGH<br />I had expected that in comparison to a manual razor, the electric razor would be allow me to complete my shave more quickly because no shaving creams were required and the cooling bar allowed for effortless gliding across my skin. However, because I found myself having to go over the same areas (particularly on the neck) several times in order to get a clean shave, it actually took me almost 10 minutes longer to complete my shave using the Braun CoolTec. I couldn‚Äôt really afford to spend this extra time in the mornings before work, especially when the results were subpar.<br /><br />SUMMARY<br />I think the preference for choice of shaving device is highly dependent upon the user. Manual vs Electric, Wet vs Dry, etc. The choices in the market are vast. I think I‚Äôm just one of those men who prefers a classic wet shave with shaving lotion and a manual razor. I cannot get a smoother results by any other method. I think the Braun CoolTec is an innovative product and will definitely be loved by a lot of individuals, especially those with sensitive skin that suffer from irritation. I tried very hard to give this product a chance and used it continually for three weeks to see if I would get accustomed to it, but the performance did not meet my standards.
